Proyecto real 2 (cerradura eléctrica par: Vista de cerradura eléctrica con RFID

requirements: Tener conocimiento básico en electrónica.
Tener conocimiento un poco de lógica de programación
courses.description:
En este curso utilizaremos el PIC16F877A y el PIC12F675 donde haremos varios proyectos con Microcontroladores PIC en la cual sera una manera simple de entender y fácil, esto se hace para alguna función o necesidad del hogar, trabajo o escuela, recomendamos tener noción básica en electrónica, para así no abarcar todo lo básico y poder avanzar más rápido en los proyecto que se tienen propuestos, además entenderemos cómo funcionan algunos sensores y módulos que son importantes dentro del curso.


Proyecto Nextion: Control de temperatura, cerradura de puerta, dimmer en AC y encender un foco en AC, por medio de la pantalla NEXTION,
Proyecto RFID: Consiste en utilizar un lector RFID para abrir una cerradura eléctrica, además de poder registrar o eliminar a los usuarios por el lector.
Proyecto Nivel de agua: Nivel de agua para tinaco o cisterna con accionamiento de bomba de agua , consiste en programar los niveles para así accionar la bomba de agua en cierto nivel y que se apague automáticamente.
Proyecto Cerradura eléctrica para habitación: esta cerradura consiste en tener tu habitación segura, a través de acceso por RFID (Proyecto de alumno).
Proyecto sismo: Consiste en realizar un detector de sismos para alertar a las personas cuando esta temblando la tierra.
Proyecto zaguán: Sensor para zaguán o portón, este proyecto fue en base a un cliente ya que tuvo la fortuna de que nadie externo ingresara a su hogar, su zaguán fallo al momento de cerrar y se quedo abierto la noche entera, por lo que me contacto para realizar un sistema de alerta a través de un megáfono en caso de que se quede abierto el zaguán.
Proyecto insoladora: Consiste en hacer un insoladora para la creación de placas PCB, esto es debido a la necesidad de que se creen placas mas estéticas y bonitas.
Proyecto Jarvis: La realización de este proyecto es debido a la curiosidad del funcionamiento de voz y activación o desactivación de sensores y módulos por un Microcontrolador PIC
Proyecto Indicador de temperatura programable con activación de relevadores: se realizo este proyecto a petición de un alumno para su hogar, ya que quería tener un controlador de temperatura para su hogar y que fuera programable.
Proyecto Nivel de agua versión chica: Nivel de agua para tinaco o cisterna con accionamiento de bomba de agua, se le agregaron únicamente 2 niveles para así accionar la bomba de agua en el nivel máximo y que se apague automáticamente o de forma manual, esta versión incluye la activación automática o manual.
Proyecto Corredera para un proyecto de alumno: el alumno reutilizo el esqueleto de una impresora para poder hacer la función de corrimiento de extremo a extremo, esto fue programado en un Microcontrolador PIC.
Proyecto CNC Plotter con Microcontroladores PIC o Arduino: Se aprenderán a usar motores a paso ya que así podremos crea una CNC casera con lo visto , ademas los materiales son reciclados, también obtendremos el conocimiento de como funciona una CNC desde sus bases hasta la construcción de este gran proyecto.
Proyecto Elevador de 4 pisos: En este proyecto se realizo el prototipo de un elevador de 4 pisos para un modelo real, con sus respectivas activaciones y sensores del elevador.
Proyecto Reloj Binario: Este proyecto fue personal, por lo que decidí realizar un reloj binario para mi escritorio, la cual se ve estético y distinto a los relojes comunes, este proyecto se realizo desde 0.
Proyecto Brazo robotico: en este proyecto imprimimos un brazo robotico por medio de una impresora 3D, lo cual hicimos una secuencia que grabara el robot para así realizar alguna tarea o función durante el proceso.
Proyecto Invernadero: En este proyecto estaremos controlando el ambiente de plantas para el correcto crecimiento, tanto de frutos como vegetales, en este proyecto utilizaremos varios sensores entre ellos sensores de humedad de suelo, DHT22, entre otros módulos programados por microcontrolador, este proyecto esta en funcionamiento en un invernadero real (PRÓXIMAMENTE).
Proyecto PLC: En este proyecto un cliente llego a mi negocio con lo que quería que le repliquemos el PLC que diseño hace años para hacer algo de automatización, por lo que me pidió replicar el PLC y realizarlo en placa PCB para su funcionamiento en el entorno real de su empresa. Este proyecto próximamente estará disponible.
Este curso es más practico que teórico, por lo tanto nos enfocaremos a desarrollar los proyectos con todo lo que veremos, estos proyectos los puedes enfocar en algo personal, educativo o laboral.


El lenguaje utilizado para este curso es basic, un lenguaje sencillo y fácil de comprender para la programación de microcontroladores pic, espero este curso sea de tu agrado y te esperamos dentro.


Este curso se ira actualizando de vez en cuando, ya que los proyectos son propios o de alumnos.
target_audience: Personas interesadas en el mundo de los microcontroladores, que quieran aprender en un lenguaje sencillo
Personas que busquen hacer proyectos con electronica o simplemente aprender algo nuevo

courses.title: Staying Connected - Bridging Digital Gaps
courses.bio: Accessible digital training for aging adults and beginners
requirements: No prior training necessary and minimum technology knowledge necessary. You will learn everything you need to know
Smartphone, tablet and/or computer
courses.description:
Staying Connected - Bridging Digital Gaps
In 2022 the digital and physical worlds are almost indistinguishable yet many individuals are having difficulties staying connected. This four-part course provides accessible training for aging adults and those who want to participate in their digital community but lack technological skills. The course consists of the following parts
1. Devices(Desktop, Mobile and Tablet),
2. Email, Apps
3. Websites, Internet and
4. Social networks
As technology continues to rapidly expand many aging adults are being left behind. This was made extremely prevalent during the COVID-19 pandemic. Many aging adults want to join and be part of online communities. However, many are intimidated or overwhelmed with technological barriers. Aging adults have even created digital accounts but are underutilizing their digital resources. This is not due to their lack of interest but rather lack of know-how and tech-savviness.


According to the Canadian Internet Registration Authority (CIRA), nearly 3 out of 4 Canadians spend at least 3 to 4 hours online each day.  These experiences can be very positive if there is ease of use and the complete opposite if not.  Adults 55+ are surfing the Internet using mobile devices. Their use has drastically increased from 24% to 57% between 2015-2019 and continues to grow. The COVID-19 pandemic has changed the world forever and the impacts of it will continue to show their ripples. One of these changes are the rapid technological advancements; pair this with the sudden rise in use and you've got a recipe that leaves aging adults vulnerable to being left out of the conversation. "Older adults are experts in their lived experiences and can identify the potential barriers to technology adoption and use.” -  Shengzhi Wang This age-friendly four-part workshop teaches all the fundamentals of digital platforms, websites, social networks and email/apps.


This project was supported in part by a Centre on Aging University of Manitoba Age-Friendly University Initiative Fund 2021-2022
Age-Friendly Hub on the UManitoba website
target_audience: Aging adults and those who want to participate digital communities but lack the technological skills.

courses.title: Lenguaje ANSI C orientado a Sistemas Embebidos
courses.bio: Aprenderás los fundamentos básicos y avanzados de Programación en C para que programes cualquier Microcontrolador
objectives: Conocimientos solidos en Lenguaje C aplicado a Microcontroladores
Aplicación del lenguaje C a proyectos en sistemas embebidos
Manejo de herramientas y funciones que ofrece el lenguaje C
Importancia en el campo laboral del lenguaje C
Creación de algoritmos legibles aplicados a Microcontroladores
requirements: Conocimientos muy Básicos del Lenguaje C
Internet
PC o Laptop
courses.description:
Un programa codificado en lenguaje C resulta muy útil en la aplicación de uControladores, dado que su compilación es bastante eficiente y óptima acercándose a la codificación de lenguaje de máquina.
En la primera parte se plantean elementos genéricos de lenguaje C, pero siempre mirando las posibles aplicaciones con uControladores.
Este curso se enseñará métodos de programación estructurada en lenguaje C, técnicas de creación de algoritmos para resolver problemas en el campo laboral, además de manejar todos los recursos del poderoso lenguaje C.
El alumno al culminar este curso será capaz de saber usar las herramientas necesarias para programar cualquier microcontrolador. Sabrá usar las funciones, condiciones y crear algoritmos óptimos para dar solución a un problema en específico.
Conocer la programación y la esencia del lenguaje C, le abrirá al estudiante muchas puertas en el mundo de autómatas programables, ya sea en el campo industrial o investigación y desarrollo.
Se han puesto a disposición del alumno varios ejemplos de programación en lenguaje C, tanto en escritorio como en lo real, se han usado ejemplos reales de proyectos realizados en el campo laboral como ingeniero de proyecto.
Toda la experiencia usando lenguaje C aplicado a microcontroladores se usarán en este curso , además se enseñara técnicas para optimizar el algoritmo y hacerlo más legible e eficiente y que tus proyectos se vean como profesionales.
target_audience: Estudiantes

Profesionales
Ingenieros
Apasionados por la Electrónica.

NOTE:  This course has over 8 hours of content, however it in incomplete, the course contains complete videos lessons for embedded-c bare metal developemt, embedded-c modular design, primer of arm assembly programming and building peripheral drivers in assembly language and bare-metal embedded-c. I have also attached the complete source code for the robot that was intended to be built in the last video sections.
We are going to embark on a very exciting journey together. In this course we are going to professionally design,code and build an obstacle avoidance autonomous robot purely in bare-metal embedded-c and assembly language. We are not going to use any third party libraries and API's in this course.


By the end of this course you will be able do the following, among many other things:

You will be able to create professional project documentation.
....Just take a look at the full course description and join us inside!

courses.title: Build Your Own Super Computer with Raspberry Pis
courses.bio: Create a computer cluster using Raspberry Pi boards - everything from hardware, software, design and networks
requirements: Students will need to own a laptop or desktop with an internet connection and an SD Card Reader / Writer

Materials for this class can vary based on your ambitions, but the minimum required materials are: 2 or more Raspberry Pi computers, 2 or more ethernet cables, a router or network switch, 2 or more micro-USB power supplies (5 Volt, 1.5 to 2 Amps), a wired USB keyboard, 2 or more micro SD cards (8 or more GB), a monitor with an HDMI input, and an HDMI cable.
courses.description:
Have you ever wanted to build your own super computer? Do you want to write programs that can run simultaneously on as many computing nodes as you wish? Do you want to learn what it takes to combine the processing powers of two, four, eight or more Raspberry Pis and run simulations at a fraction of the time and cost of running on a mainframe or even a high-end desktop computer?
If you've answered yes to any of these questions, then this course is for you. In this step-by-step series of video lectures, you'll learn how to set up your own computer cluster using cheap, affordable computers - and it doesn't get any more affordable than the Raspberry Pi.
Whether you're a Raspberry Pi enthusiast, a scientific researcher in need of cheap, expandable processing power, a programmer looking to expand their horizons with multithreaded algorithms, or a student looking to learn more about using Linux to build computing clusters, then you'll find plenty of value in this class as you build your own Raspberry Pi super computer.
These lectures are specially tailored to the Raspberry Pi 2 B+ board using Raspbian (a distribution based on Debian), which is a good place to start if you're unfamiliar with the Linux command line or building computer networks. If you are comfortable with the various flavors of Linux, you can use this course as a guideline for what it takes to build your own cluster using a different distribution.
Lastly, this class is a "living course", which means as we receive feedback and requests for specialized tutorials or updates, we'll continually update and add more to improve the quality and content of the course.
target_audience: This course is designed for anyone with a zeal for learning how computers work - especially with an interest in creating your own computer cluster
You should be comfortable using a Linux command line, but you don't have to be knowledgeable - every single step of the way is recorded and documented to follow along easily
If you love Raspberry Pis and own more than one, building a computer cluster is a fun way to learn how to get them to interact together and use all of their computer processing power combined

requirements: Não é necessário ter nenhum conhecimento na área, mas se tiver, vai facilitar o aprendizado.
courses.description:
Com mais de 3 anos de experiencia na área, criamos esse curso para facilitar o aprendizado de quem sempre quis entrar nesse mercado! Ensinando do zero ao avançado.
São 9 aulas ensinando o desbloqueio de iPhones em qualquer tela de bloqueio que eles estiverem (Inativo, Indisponível, Senha numérica, iCloud e senha, bloqueado para proprietário). Tudo isso pelo seu computador ou notebook windows e em caso de dúvidas suporte pelo whats.


Grandes novidades ->
#1 -> Desbloqueio Passcode (iPhones que estão na Senha de bolinha, Indisponível ou Inativo) que estejas do ios 14 até o 16, após o desbloqueio podendo atualizar normalmente o aparelho sem bloquear de novo, e subindo sinal de chip (Não pode formatar de fabrica). Desbloqueio praticamente de graça ! pelo Windows.


#2 -> Desbloqueio Tela de iCloud e Senha até ios 16.x subindo sinal de chip pelo Windows !
Você vai terminar esse curso com um grande conhecimento na área, que vai agregar muito na sua bancada, feito pra quem tem loja, pra quem trabalha em casa com sua bancada ou até mesmo para curiosos, abordamos todos os tópicos do processo:
# Preparação de Pendrive
# Identificação de tela de bloqueio
# Exploração de Falha no iPhone
# Software no iPhone
# Burlar a Tela de Bloqueio
# Subindo rede em todos modelos
# Checagem de imei
# Exploração de falha sem Pendrive


Entre outras varias coisas que você vai aprender! Não será necessário a utilização de macbook, tudo será feito pelo seu computador ou notebook Windows, e um cabo de iPhone para conexão. Vai utilizar um dos melhores e mais utilizados programas para desbloqueio. Entre pra essa equipe !
target_audience: Técnicos em Eletrônica
Técnicos de Celulares
Manutenção de Celulares
Reparo em Software de Celulares
Software
Conserto de Celulares
Desbloqueio de iPhone

courses.title: Introducción a Arduino, Sensores y Robótica
courses.bio: Principios básicos de programación en Arduino e introducción a los circuitos básicos para conectar Arduino.
objectives: Contar con las herramientas necesarias para desarrollar interacciones en Arduino
Ser capaz de construir circuitos básicos con Arduino
Aprender a controlar leds y fotoresistores
Tener los conocimientos básicos para dimmerizar leds

Introducción a Programación: Presentación del entorno de programación IDE
Motores DC. Aplicación PWM: Motor DC y código en funcionamiento
Ejemplo de relé y lámpara 240v ac
Interacción entre Arduino y el mundo del: Altavoz, Librerias Locales en IDE y música

requirements: Materiales:

2 Arduino Uno, 1 Motor micro servo,  6 Fotorresistor LDR, 1 Rele 5v,  1 Cable USB tipo A a tipo B, 1 Mini breadboard,  1 Transistor BD 137 o 135, 1 Acelerometro ADXL 335,  1 Diodo 1N4007, 1 Motor DC,  1 Potenciometro ajustable 10kohm,  1 Resistencia 1000 ohm,  10 Resistencia 220 ohm,  1 Resistencia 10kohm,  1 Diodo Led 5mm,  1 Buzzer, 1 Juego de cables Jumper cables- Macho/Macho (10 uds.), 1 Sensor de Ultrasonido HC-SR04, 1 LED RGB, 1 Sensor de fuerza, 1 Pulsador, 1 Sensor Piezoelectrico, 1 Sensor PIR, 1 Sensor de humedad y temperatura ambiente DHT11, 1 Sensor de temperatura LM35.
courses.description:
¿Quieres conocer más sobre Arduino?
Adquiere los conocimientos básicos necesarios para empezar a generar interacciones entre el ordenador y el mundo exterior a través de sensores de todo tipo o motores. Darás los primeros pasos hacia la robótica, domótica o la gestión digital de luces con sensores.
Arduino es una plataforma de hardware libre, basada en una placa con un microcontrolador y un entorno de desarrollo, y se puede utilizar para desarrollar objetos interactivos autónomos o puede ser conectado a cualquier software del ordenador que se comunique con el Puerto serial. (por ejemplo: Macromedia Flash, Logic, Processing, Max/MSP o Pure Data).
En este curso veremos juntos los siguientes temas:
+ Programación placa Arduino
+ Robótica y domótica
+ Interacción entre el mundo digital y el mundo físico
+ Programación y diseño de circuitos para conectar Potenciómetros, Botones y Sensores tales como LDR (fotoeléctricos), Transductores (de sonido)
+ Sistemas Aplicables a la Robótica y la Domótica. Programación y diseño de circuitos para controlar LEDs, Motores DC y Motores Servo mediante la Modulación de Ancho de Pulso (PWM)
Al terminar el curso tendrás las herramientas necesarias para construir circuitos básicos con Arduino, controlar leds y fotorresistores y dimmerizar leds.
target_audience: Estudiantes, diseñadores, ingenieros, arquitectos, artistas, programadores, creadores, técnicos de sonido, músicos o cualquier persona que esté interesada en el tema

courses.title: Program ESP32 without Coding
courses.bio: Program ESP32 Board without writing a single code in A Professional Environment

Hardware and Software Requirements: Download and Install Arduino ESP and USB Driver
Setting Up the ESP32 Development Environment
Setting Up Your ESP32 Development Environment
ESP 32 Pinout: Download and Install Arduino ESP32 v1 Development environment
ESP32 Pinout, Board Overview, and Development Environment Setup
Example: Blink Led with One Click: Example: Blink Led with One Click
Upload blink Led Code and Test it
First ESP32 Program: Blinking an LED
Control Led with a Button: Upload Button Code and Test it
Interactive ESP32: LED Control with a Button
Practical Example Infrared Obstacle Avoi: Practical Example Infrared Obstacle Avoidance Sensor
Led Bar Counter Encoder Shift Register: Led Bar Counter Encoder Shift Register
Using Shift Registers with LED Bars

requirements: Basic experience in Electronics
A Will to apply, not just watch
courses.description:
Introduction:
The ESP32 is an open-source IoT electronics platform based on easy-to-use hardware and software. Sensing the environment by receiving inputs from many sensors, ESP32 affects its surroundings by controlling lights, motors, and a number of other accessories. It's intended for anyone making interactive hardware projects, and in this course, we will make it easy for you to program ESP32 boards and start testing your codes freely.
In this course, you will learn how to program the ESP32 board without writing a single code in a professional environment. It will help you unleash your full potential without the hassle of writing codes. This course will teach you how to program ESP32 without having to learn to code. The course will also show you how to create a web server using ESP32.
Contents and Overview
In this course, I'm going to teach you how to program the ESP32 board without writing a single line of code. All that you have to do is drag and drop.
You will get rid of the hassle of writing long codes to achieve things with your ESP32 in this course.
You will also get to know how you can use different modules like Bluetooth, SPI, I2C, graphical LCD, and stepper motors, and how to enter the world of ESP32 programming without coding. I'm sure that at the end of this course you will find this way much easier for you to make projects without coding. And even if you want to teach your child how to program, you can get them started using the knowledge that we are offering in this course.
You will also take a practical example, which is an obstacle avoiding robot, and you will learn how to connect it practically and how to program it using the software without coding. I'm sure that at the end of this course you will gain a lot of knowledge and you will use this software on a daily basis because it will make your life much easier.
Boards that can be Simulated:
ESP8266, ESP32
Arduino boards
Arduino clones
Raspberry Pi
Teensy
Femto IO
Controllino, Goldilocks Analogue, FreeSoC2, chipKIT, micro:bit, Maple Mini, and a number of Arduino clones
Why You Should Take This Course:
ESP32 Programming without Coding. Program ESP32 Board without writing a single code in a professional environment.
Experience total freedom and control with ESP32 Programming without Coding.
Save time on tedious coding and focus on your creativity to get straight to business.
It is an easy way to prototype your next invention. With ESP32 Programming without Coding, you can do it all in a few steps.
You will learn how to configure the ESP32 and how to use it with Arduino IDE.
Learn to program ESP32 without Coding. Learn to program ESP32 with Arduino IDE.
Course Benefits:
Code-free ESP32 Programming: If you're looking for an easy way to program the ESP32, you've come to the right place. With our code-free programming interface, you can get started quickly and easily. Plus, our coding-free approach means that you don't have to be a coding expert to get started - anyone can do it!
Easily Program ESP32: The ESP32 is a powerful yet low-cost microcontroller that can easily be programmed without any prior coding experience. With just a few simple instructions, anyone can get started with the ESP32 and begin creating amazing projects.
Anyone can pick up the basics of programming an ESP32 without having to learn an entire coding language. This course will teach the very basics of programming the ESP32 chip using a few simple components. No coding experience is necessary.
What are you waiting for? Join and Enroll in this course now!
What You Will Learn:
How to program ESP32 without coding
Basics of electronics project setup and modification
Understanding and using various modules and sensors
Practical examples and projects
Who Is This Course For:
Beginners in electronics and programming
Individuals interested in ESP32 projects
Parents wanting to teach their children programming
Hobbyists and enthusiasts in electronics
Requirements:
Basic computer skills
No prior knowledge of programming required
ESP32 board and basic electronics components


About the Instructor Info
Educational Engineering Team
Team of skilled Engineers Sharing Knowledge with the World
Educational Engineering Team is a Leading Team in the Microcontroller Industry, with over 13 Years of Experience in Teaching and Doing Practical Projects.
We strive to put all our hands-on experience in these courses. Instead of superficial knowledge, we go into the depth of the topic and give you the exact, step-by-step blueprint on how to tackle simple as well as complex topics in easy and digestible bite-sized videos.
This real-world knowledge enables you to grasp knowledge easily, and you can apply this learning immediately to your life and projects.
Educational Engineering Team has been in the Programming and Microcontroller business since 2007. We have been part of many projects. Over the course of these years, we have gained a good insight into students’ and educators’ needs. We are passionate about sharing all our collective knowledge with you. As of 2018, we have already taught over 250k-THOUSAND students and counting.
Currently, we have more than 100+ Courses on Udemy.
Educator and Author of “Educational Engineering”
Ashraf is an educator, Mechatronics engineer, electronics and programming hobbyist, and Maker. He creates online video courses on the EduEng YouTube Channel (More Than 4 Million Views, 20k + Subscribers) and author of four Microcontroller books.
As a Chief Educational Engineer since 2007 at Educational Engineering Team, the company he founded, Ashraf’s mission is to explore new trends and technology and help educate the world and make it a better place.
Educational Engineering offers educational courses and Bootcamps, articles, lessons, and online support for electronics hobbyists, Programming hobbyists, Microcontroller hobbyists, STEM students, and STEM teachers.
The team also works as freelance engineers, helping many students in their graduation projects, and providing guidance and consulting for many students over the years to help them kick-start their careers.
Ashraf’s core skill is explaining difficult concepts in a step-by-step easy-to-understand manner using video and text. With over 11 years of tertiary teaching experience, Ashraf has developed a simple yet comprehensive and informative style in teaching that students from all around the world appreciate.
His passion for Microcontrollers and Programming, particularly for the world of Arduino, PIC Microcontroller, Raspberry Pi, has guided his personal development and his work through Educational Engineering.
Ashraf’s online courses have helped over 250,000 people from around the world to be better and to make a great career in the industry.
Educational Engineering Team offers Courses on:
Circuit Design, Simulation, and PCB Fabrication
Arduino, PIC Microcontroller, and Raspberry Pi
Programming in C, Python, and other programming languages
PLC Industrial Programming and Automation
3D Design and Simulation
ESP and IoT World
target_audience: Anyone Interested in Programming ESP32 Without coding

Anyone Interested in Turn Ideas into Projects quickly
Anyone Interested in saving Time, Effort and Money while Programming ESP32

courses.title: Crea tu primer circuito con VHDL y FPGA
courses.bio: Con nuestro curso tutorial de VHDL aprenderás a crear tu diseño y descargarlo en tu FPGA
objectives: Que es VHDL y una FPGA
La sintáxis de VHDL
Crear diseños funcionales y estructurales con VHDL
Simular tus diseños con Modelsim
Implementar tu diseño VHDL en una FPGA utilizado Vivado
Crear tu propio microprocesador
requirements: Modelsim licencia de estudiante gratuita. En el curso se explica cómo instalarlo
Xilinx Vivado o Altera(Intel) Quartus-II. En el curso también se explica todo el proceso de instalación
Conocer las bases del diseño digital
Nociones de programación
Opcionalmente, una placa de prototipado con FPGA, trabajaremos con Artix-7 de Xilinx y Ciclone-II de Altera pero es válida cualquier otra.
courses.description:
Con nuestro curso de VHDL aprenderás a crear tu diseño digital y descargarlo en una FPGA.
Esta formación incluye más de 8 horas de clases de teoría y laboratorios. Además está en constante crecimiento con las sugerencias de los alumnos. ¿Quieres que hablemos de algún tema concreto? Dínoslo y añadiremos una clase.
A través de tutoriales, clases teóricas y clases prácticas de VHDL y FPGAs podrás crear tu primer diseño en VHDL y hacerlo funcionar en tu FPGA de Xilinx o Altera.
Para ello no es necesario disponer de ningún conocimiento previo sobre VHDL. En el curso iremos recorriendo todo lo que hace falta para poder crear diseños desde cero.
En este curso aprenderás todas las nociones básicas de VHDL y FPGA. Desde lo más básico hasta como crear test avanzados para simular de forma profesional tu diseño.
Todos los diseños los implementaremos sobre diferentes placas con FPGA reales. Trabajaremos con la Nexys 4 de Digilent y también con FPGA de bajo coste de Altera. Aún así, si tienes otra placa diferente también te valdrá para seguir el curso. Si tienes dudas de cómo utilizarla pregúntanos.
El curso cubre más de 40 videos que muestran la sintaxis de VHDL, de manera ordenada y sistematizada, de tal forma que al terminarlos el alumno es capaz de crear e implementar sus propios diseños.
Además, el curso tiene un gran número de ejemplos de laboratorio, con su correspondiente código VHDL que permite aplicar todos los conocimientos adquiridos. En estos laboratorios se trabajará desde los aspectos más básicos hasta la creación de un microprocesador completo totalmente funcional sobre la FPGA.
target_audience: Quien desee aprender a crear sus propios circuitos digitales con FPGA y VHDL
Estudiantes de Ingeniería Electrónica, Informática, de Sistemas o de Telecomunicaciones
Amantes de la electrónica que quieran dar un salto adelante en sus conocimientos
Gente que haga proyectos con Arduino y quieran realizar diseños más complejos

courses.title: Der Aufbau eines Computers
courses.bio: Der umfassende Einsteigerkurs
objectives: 💻 Du lernst die Grundkenntnisse der Computerhardware, dazu gehört die Funktion aller Hardwareteile, deren Funktion und Anschlüsse
⏱‍️ Du profitierst zudem von einem schnellen Support für Deine Fragen, Vorschläge oder Sonstigem
📚 Da die Lektionen sehr kurz doch enorm umfänglich gestaltet sind, werden sämtliche 56-Multiple-Choises und Aufgaben zur Verfügung gestellt
🌐 Du wirst das Zusammenspiel der Hardware verstehen und Grundwissen für einen Selbstbau oder Kauf aneignen
requirements: Es werden keine Vorkenntnisse benötigt!
courses.description:
Thomas Watson sagte 1943: „Ich denke, dass es einen Weltmarkt für vielleicht fünf Computer gibt.“
Nahezu überall sind Computer im Einsatz. Seit dem ersten Rechner im Jahre 1941, wächst die Entwicklung mit unberechenbarer Geschwindigkeit. Immer werden sie kleiner und besser. PC, Tablets, Handys und Smart Watches sind dafür ein Beispiel.


Wäre es nicht schade, nie gewusst zu haben, wie diese äußerst komplexen Systeme funktionieren?


In diesem Kurs dreht sich alles um den Aufbau eines Computers. Du wirst lernen, wie die einzelnen Komponenten aufgebaut sind, zu welcher Aufgabe sie beitragen und wo diese angeschlossen sind. Dieser Kurs lehrt Dich das Grundwissen über die Computer Hardware. Mein Ziel war es, diesen Kurs sehr kurz und doch umfassend zu gestalten. Am Ende wirst Du die ganzen Hardwareteile und deren Anschlüsse nochmals repetieren. Nach diesem Kurs wirst Du Dich mit Deinen Freunden und anderen Leuten, über die Computertechnik umfänglich unterhalten können. Auch wirst Du ein umfängliches Grundwissen für den korrekten Kauf oder Zusammenbau eines Computers aneignen. Ab jetzt wirst Du auch IT-Fachwörter, zum Beispiel in den Massenmedien, verstehen. Somit eignet sich der Kurs für Jeden!


Vorteile:
- Kurz und bündig, doch umfassend und informativ
- Umso kürzere Lektionen, desto besseres Konzentrationsvermögen
- Durch kurze Lektionen den besten Lerneffekt erzielen


- Das Wichtigste zusammengefasst
- All-in-One: Komplette Hardware des Computers
- Hardware Verbindungen mit dem Mainboard erklärt
- Englische und Deutsche Bezeichnungen erwähnt


- Einzelne Themen abrufbar
- Der Kurs ist übersichtlich nach Thema gegliedert
- Die logisch aufeinander aufbauenden Abschnitte, bzw. Lektionen


- IT-Fachwörter verstehen
- Dein Wissen mit Freunden teilen
- Grundwissen für Computer Zusammenbau und Kauf aneignen


Features:
- Umfangreiche Lektionen
- Zahlreiche Quizze
- Sehr viele Aufgaben
- Präsentationstext zum Download
- Powerpoint Präsentation zum Download
- Und noch Vieles mehr...
target_audience: An Leute, die sich zum ersten Mal mit dem Thema befassen
An Jene, die sich für die Elektronik interessieren
An neugierige Computer Fans
An Programmierer, welche in die Hardwarewelt eintauchen wollen, um zBs. die Hardwareauslastung besser zu verteilen
Somit eignet sich der Kurs für Jeden! ;-)

courses.description:
En la Industria 4.0 requerimos que los equipos(hardware) y programas(software) se comuniquen entre si para mejorar procesos y que nos permitan una correcta toma de decisiones.
Node-Red es la herramienta que nos permite ligarlos fácilmente y tener una productividad mayor.
Este es el curso básico de manejo de Node-Red, con el cuál entenderás sus conceptos básicos y podrás desarrollar tus propios flujos.
Muchas gracias por participar en mi curso.
target_audience: Público en general interesado en Industria 4.0 y personas con deseos de desarrollar soluciones IoT

courses.description:
これからArduino（アルディーノマイコン）を触ってみたい！Arduinoなどに搭載されるマイコン（マイクロコンピュータ）を使ったプログラミングに知識ゼロから挑戦してみたい！
オームの法則などの電気回路の基礎知識は少しあるものの、実際に自分の手で回路設計して何か形になるものを作ってみたい！
デジタル回路の知識が全くないのでこのコースをきっかけに勉強してみたい！
そういった方のニーズに応えるため、本コースを制作しました。
コースの前半では、LEDを点滅させる簡単な回路から始めます。小さな成功体験を積み重ねながら、徐々に難易度を上げていきましょう。


デジタル回路とアナログ回路はどう違うのか？
Arduino以外に必要な電子部品を一式揃えるにはどこで購入すれば良いか？
LEDを点滅させるシンプルなデジタル回路設計はどのようにすれば良いのか？
リモコンなどに使われるプッシュスイッチで動くデジタル回路の設計方法を学びたい。
スピーカーなどのボリューム調整用のつまみに使われる可変抵抗とArduinoとの接続方法やプログラミング方法を学びたい。
といった回路設計に付随して必要になる様々な基礎知識をゼロから学べるのはもちろん、
本コースを通じて、
プッシュスイッチと電子ブザーを使った電子ピアノを開発したり、
7セグメントLEDを使った時限爆弾風カウントダウンタイマーを開発したり、
人感センサーを使って人を検知し、LEDを点灯させる回路設計のノウハウも学べます。


本コースを学び終える頃には、自らの手で様々な回路設計や電子工作を行う際に必要になるデジタル回路設計の基礎知識を習得することができます。
私たちの身の回りには、実は電子工作を活用できる場面が多々あります。
このコースをきっかけに回路設計や電子工作の楽しさを体感し、組み込み開発ができるエンジニアとしての第一歩を踏み出しましょう。


本コースは英語のドキュメントを活用する場面がありますが、講師の解説がついていますので、頑張って学んでいきましょう。


それではコースの中でお会いできることを楽しみにしています。




Arduinoとは・・・
「Arduinoボート」および「Arduino IDE」から構成されるシステムです。
「Arduinoボード」はマイコン、入出力ポートを備えた基板（マイコンボード）であり、Arduino UNOやArduino Nanoなどがそれに相当します。
「Arduino IDE」はプログラムを作成・コンパイル・デバッグをし、それをArduinoボードに転送するための統合開発環境と呼ばれるPC上で動作させる一種のソフトウェアです。
プログラムを組み込むことで、モータの制御やセンサの状態検知などを行うことができます。
外部の電子部品の入出力機能を持ち、デジタルやアナログ出力、シリアル通信処理ができるようになっており、
またプログラミング処理能力を持ち、計算処理や割り込み処理機能なども持ち合わせています。
今回のコースでは、C言語を使っていきますのでプログラミングに触れることもできます。


このコースは「直感的にわかる！電気回路/電子回路の基礎を学ぼう」の待望の続編コースになります。
このコースだけでも受講を進めることは可能ですが、前作も受講することでより理解が深まります。
target_audience: マイコンの初心者・入門者。電子工作の初心者・入門者

Arduinoを買ったけど何からはじめていいかわからない方
ハードウェアエンジニアになりたい方・組み込み開発に携わりたい方
ソフトウェアエンジニアからステップアップしたい方
フルスタックエンジニアを目指している方
直感的にわかる！電気回路/電子回路の基礎を学ぼうコースをすでに受講していて電気回路の基礎知識がある方

courses.description:
This complete hands-on, step by step course is targeting the Raspberry Pi. Note that everything also works perfectly for Raspberry Pi 2 and 4 & 5 versions.
You don’t need any knowledge in programming, electronics, or anything else. To get started, you just need a computer to work from, and a Raspberry Pi board.
At the end of the course, you will have a strong foundation with your Raspberry Pi, and you will be able to start your own projects in no time.


Why this course?
You will know about IoT in depth.
You may be just getting started, or have already started to learn how to build projects with your Raspberry Pi. But knowing what to do first, and which path to follow can be quite hard and you may feel stuck.
The problem with most online resources for Raspberry Pi is that they focus on making you run existing programmes to make you feel like you’ve accomplished a lot, but in reality, you’ve just copied/pasted some random code and didn’t even scratch the surface. "Why" you should do that” is not involved. So, the next time you have to do something on your own, you feel stuck and too dependent on other people's code.
This course will focus on the “why” and make you much more autonomous with your Raspberry Pi so you will be able to start your own projects without having to desperately search for code to copy/paste on the Internet. My personal goal is to make you understand enough to get started in a short period of time, and make you think as a problem solver, with engineer-level thinking skills.


→ And how will we do that, you may ask?


Simple:
HANDS-ON.
STEP BY STEP.
NO COPY AND PASTE.


This course is not a course where you just download some code and run it. This is a course where you will truly understand how to write code and work with the different Raspberry Pi functionalities.
I will take the time to explain everything, step by step, even the basic things. I will write the code with you and explain why I write what I write. With the activities and final project, you will have even more opportunities to practice on your own, and you will make progress without even noticing it.


→ What will you do/learn in this course?


Here’s an overview of the different topics we’ll cover:
Introduction to IoT
IoT Implementation
IoT Application
Setup your Raspberry Pi and install Raspberry Pi OS without an external monitor and keyboard.
Get good Python3 programming basics.
Work with the Raspberry Pi’s GPIO panel.
Use a DHT11 sensor read and send data to server using Raspberry Pi
Micropython
Discover how to use a Unix terminal and the most useful command line tools.
A little bit PHP.
POSTMAN, API
Database Management
Create a web server on your Raspberry Pi.


Who this course is for:
DYI enthusiasts, Entrepreneurs, Engineers, Developers, Professionals, College and school students and anyone with an interest in learning IOT
target_audience: Beginner
Intermediate
Advanced

Gerek iş hayatı için gerek kişisel bilgisayar kullanımı için, gerekse mevcut bilgilerimizi pekiştirmek için kursumuz ideal bir seçim olacaktır.
Tüm kurs boyunca eğitim videolarımızın dışında, ders materyalleri ve ders sonlarında sınavlar ve ödevler olacaktır. Bu sınav ve ödevler sizin öğreniminizi daha kolaylaştıracak ve hangi konuya tam hakim olamadığımızı gösterecektir. Bunun için lütfen bu sınav ve ödevleri mümkün olduğunca yapalım. Ek olarak anlamadığınız veya konudan farklı bir soru sormak için, videoların altında bulunan "Soru & Cevap" kısmından sorularınızı belirtebilirsiniz. Ya da özel olarak tarafıma mesaj olarak görüşlerinizi ve sorularınızı gönderebilirsiniz. Mümkün olduğunca eğitimimizi izlerken, uygulamalı olan işlemlerde, bir yandan da kendi bilgisayarımız üzerinden uygulayalım.
Kısaca bu eğitimimizde bilgisayar kullanımına hakim olmuş olacak ve herhangi bir sorunda müdahale edebileceğiz.
Unutmayalım, Gelecek Bilişimde!

courses.title: IOT practice with temperature sensor data
courses.bio: Build an IoT Project with Arduino from scratch
objectives: Setup development environment for internet of thing (IoT).

requirements: Eager to know IoT.
courses.description:
IOT practice with temperature sensor data
Reading and visualization of temperature data is a good example to help us understand the world of IoT. It is easy to implement and you can find out more interesting user scenarios anytime if you want.
Since the NodeMCU LoLin supports multiple Wi-Fi modes, we can publish temperature data to a remote server. This means that by the end of this course, you will be able to send temperature data anywhere you want.
Additionally, since the IoT hardware in this course is battery-powered, you can collect temperature data from anywhere. All you need is a Wi-Fi hotspot (or a smartphone).
We can just connect NodeMCU LoLin directly to temperature sensor DHT22, get temperature data from it, and then publish it to a remote Raspberry Pi. But in this course, I just wanna show you how to use an Arduino UNO in between. One reason is that with this solution, you have more free pins. For the future, if you wanna connect more IoT hardware to NodeMCU LoLin, the IoT infrastructure has already been well prepared by this project.
Through this IoT project, you will learn:
Hardware
Connect IoT hardware components so that they can work together.
Power up IoT hardware.
Software
How to get temperature data from a temperature sensor DHT22.
How to forward temperature data from the sensor to Arduino UNO.
How to connect Arduino UNO and NodeMCU LoLin by using Breadboard.
How to forward temperature data from Arduino UNO to NodeMCU LoLin.
How to transmit temperature data from NodeMCU LoLin to remote Raspberry Pi via MQTT Message.
Development Environment
Set up a Development environment using Arduino IDE and Visual Studio Code.
Programming and Upload code from laptop to Arduino Uno and NodeMCU LoLin.
Production Environment
Use Battery supply for IoT Hardware so that you can take your IoT Hardware everywhere.
target_audience: People who curious about internet of thing and are interesting to get hands dirty for IoT practice

courses.description:
TIA PORTAL İLE SCADA PROGRAMLAMA EĞİTİMİNE HOŞGELDİNİZ
Ben Ayberk, kursumuz hakkında genel bir bilgi vermek gerekirse şunları söyleyebilirim:
Bu eğitimde, uzun yıllar endüstriyel otomasyon alanında çalışan bir mühendis olarak yılların verdiği saha tecrübesi ve birikim ile Scada programlamayı anlatıyorum. Bu konu hakkında daha önceden bir bilginizin olmaması hiç problem değil. Çünkü sıfırdan başlayarak ileri düzeye doğru adım adım gidiyoruz. Yalnız Scada programlama PLC tabanlı sistemler üzerinde yapıldığı için bu kursa başlamadan önce en azından orta seviyede PLC programlama bilmek sizler için faydalı olacaktır. Eğer bu konuda bir eksiğiniz var ise bu açığı PLC programlama kurslarımız ile kapatabilirsiniz.
Kursumuzda dersler belirli bir mantık sırasına göre ilerlemektedir. Bundan dolayı ders videolarını sırayla izlemeniz konuları daha rahat kavramanızı sağlayacaktır. Derslerimizi sırasıyla izleyip ve derslerde anlatılanları uyguladığınızda, Scada programlama konusunda çok iyi bir noktaya geleceğinizi size garanti ediyorum.
Kursumuzda öğrenciler sordukları bütün sorulara ayrıntılı geri dönüşler almaktadır ve bundan dolayı özel bir ders alıyormuş gibi hissetmektedirler. Kursun bu dinamik yapısı, öğrencilere kısa sürede konuları anlama ve hedeflerine ulaşma konusunda yardımcı olmaktadır.
Eğitim boyunca kullanacağımız WinCC Runtime yazımı ile oluşturduğunuz Scadayı çalıştırabilecek ve Factory IO üzerinde simüle ederek her şeyi kontrol edebileceksiniz. Ayrıca sistemin sahada gerçek ekipmanlar üzerinde de nasıl çalıştığını görebildiğiniz bir eğitim tecrübesi yaşayacaksınız.
Kursumuzda birtakım konuları öğrencilerin en iyi şekilde anlayabilmesi için bu derslerin uygulamaları özel deney setleri üzerinde yapılmıştır. Ayrıca eğitimin her bir kısmı bittikten sonra öğrendiğiniz her şeyi pekiştirmeniz için sizlerle örnek Scada uygulamaları yapacağız.
Yukarıda söylediğim bütün her şeyi yapabilme amacıyla oluşturduğum Scada programlama eğitimi temelden ileri seviyeye doğru 3 kısımdan oluşmaktadır. Kursun birinci kısmında temel seviye konulara yer verilmiş olup, bu kısmı tamamladığınızda profesyonel meslek hayatınızda Scada programlama konusunda  temel ve önemli bir ilerleme kaydetmiş olacaksınız.

requirements: Beginners
courses.description:
In this course you will learn about
Basic Electronic Components
How they work?
Basics of Arduino and how to assemble circuits
In a nutshell, an Arduino is an open hardware development board that can be used by tinkerers, hobbyists, and makers to design and build devices that interact with the real world.
Is Arduino coding or programming?
Arduino IDE is a special software running on your system that allows you to write sketches (synonym for program in Arduino language) for different Arduino boards. The Arduino programming language is based on a very simple hardware programming language called processing, which is similar to the C language.
What language is Arduino?
The Arduino language is a subset of C/C++, where you can also use assembly for ultra-low level code. When saying “programming on Arduino”, in fact you don't program the Arduino board itself, but the microcontroller inside the board.
How many types of Arduino do we have?
How many types of arduinos do we have? Explanation: There are 4 Arduino boards and 4 Arduino shields that fit on top of Arduino compatible boards to provide additional capability like connecting to the internet, motor controller, LCD screen controlling etc.
Can I use HTML in Arduino?
Send data to Arduino

You can use this array to store values for sketch functions. This button will send PWM value 123 to pin 5 and turn on connected LED. Similarly you can use HTML inputs (and forms) to work with hardware.
Is Arduino used in robotics?
With the Arduino Robot, you can learn about electronics, mechanics, and software. It is a tiny computer on wheels. It comes with a number of of project examples you can easily replicate, and it is a powerful robotics platform that you can hack to perform all sorts of tasks.
target_audience: Beginners curious to know about Electronics and Arduino

courses.description:
Este curso explora las diversas características de la comunicación entre dispositivos IoT como Raspberry PI y la nube mediante Amazon AWS IoT  utilizando una cuenta gratuita de AWS (free tier).


Nos introduciremos al mundo del internet de las cosas (IoT) desde la perspectiva de un programador y no así desde la de un experto en sistemas embebidos o electrónico como es el caso en muchos otros cursos, eliminando así la complejidad de aplicar estas tecnologías cuando no se cuenta con experiencia o acceso a microcontroladores como el ESP32, ESP8266 o tarjetas como Arduino.


Abordaremos los fundamentos de IoT desde cero con ejemplo gráficos para comprender su funcionamiento paso a paso.


Exploraremos los servicios de AWS IoT desde una perspectiva general, y nos enfocaremos particularmente en los servicios AWS IoT Core y AWS IoT analytics, su ubicación en el ecosistema de AWS y sus beneficios.


El acceso a dispositivos embebidos puede ser complicado en ciertos países y áreas, este escenario es menos común con Raspberry PI ya que se utiliza para diversos fines. Esto lo convierte en una excelente opción para utilizarlo como dispositivo IoT. Aprenderemos a configurar un Raspberry PI para su uso con AWS IoT Core de forma correcta utilizando programación fácilmente entendible en lenguajes de alto nivel ampliamente conocidos (JavaScript) y herramientas de programación por eventos como Node-RED.


Exploraremos la forma correcta de manipular datos IoT sin incurrir en muchos servicios o altos costos, desde una perspectiva simplificada y aplicada a situaciones de la vida real.


Crearemos ejemplos sencillos que pueden utilizarse y extenderse al mundo real, con un enfoque enteramente en AWS IoT y su funcionamiento. Utilizaremos herramientas como Amazon QuickSight para el analisis de datos IoT.


Aprenderemos como utilizar el GPIO de un Raspberry PI como punto de entrada para hacer lecturas de sensores y sistemas externos de forma sencilla sin incurrir en electrónica compleja.


Exploraremos AWS IoT Device Shadow service con ejemplos visuales para comprender el manejo de estados IoT en la nube.


El curso pretende eliminar la complejidad de sistemas embebidos, exceso de servicios y tecnologías no relacionados usualmente asociada a cursos de este tipo.
target_audience: Principiantes que deseen aprender sobre AWS IoT desde cero
Entusiastas de IoT que deseen aprender a hacer uso de los servicios de AWS IoT
Programadores que deseen aprender de IoT sin lidiar con la complejidad de microcontroladores o su difícil acceso
Entusiastas y programadores de Rasberry PI que quieran extender su uso a IoT y soluciones en la nube
Profesionales del mundo de IoT que deseen extender su conocimiento de AWS IoT

courses.title: Mini-Course: How Computers Compute?
courses.bio: A first course you need to understand how computers work.
requirements: No
courses.description:
Understanding how computers compute is the first step towards understanding how computers work. There are three building blocks in understanding how computers compute.
1. How computers represent numbers: Binary numbers
2. Who does the computing: Transistor
3. How to combine transistors to do computing: Building an adder
The first hurdle in learning how computers work is binary number. A lot of people have trouble in seeing binary numbers as legit numbers, myself included. So this course aims to provide you a thorough understanding about numbers from a unique perspective. After comfortable with binary numbers, we will talk about the little device at the core of modern electronics: transistor. We won’t get into the quantum mechanics detail behind the transistors fundamental to our modern way of life, but we will briefly talk about what it does. This will pave way for a good understanding about how to use them to do computing. Once we are comfortable with how numbers are represented and what the little computing device can do, we will dive into the details about how to combine those little transistors in making an adder that can add two numbers. We will also talk about how computers do subtraction using a trick called two's complement method.
This mini course will equip you with a thorough understanding about how computers do computing exactly.
target_audience: Anyone who's interested in computer technologies but frustrated with the current resources

courses.description:
Hello there! We are excited to introduce our new course, Altium PCB Design: Learn by Building Circuits. This course is designed for those who want to learn how to design and build printed circuit boards using the Altium Designer software.
In this course, you will learn the basics of Altium Designer, how to create a schematic, and how to layout and route your PCB. You will also have the opportunity to build several circuits throughout the course.
Course Overview:
This course is designed to help students learn Altium PCB design through the process of building circuits. By working on circuits, students will learn how to use Altium to design and build PCBs. The course will cover the basics of Altium, including schematic capture, layout, and routing. By the end of the course, students will be able to design and build their own PCBs using Altium.
What You'll Learn:
Introduction to Altium Designer: Understand the basic functionalities of Altium Designer.
Creating Schematics: Learn how to create and edit schematics.
Layout and Routing: Master the layout editor and routing techniques.
Using the Autorouter: Learn how to use Altium’s Autorouter for efficient PCB design.
Library Management: Understand how to use the library editor and create custom libraries.
Building Circuits: Apply your knowledge by designing and building real-world circuits.
Troubleshooting: Learn techniques for troubleshooting and refining your PCB designs.
Why You Should Take This Course:
Learn the Basics of PCB Design: Gain a solid foundation in PCB design using Altium Designer.
Work with Schematics and PCB Layouts: Develop skills in creating and managing schematics and PCB layouts.
Use Libraries in Your Designs: Understand how to use and manage libraries in Altium Designer.
Design Your Own PCBs: Learn to design custom PCBs for your projects.
Real-World Application: Build circuits and apply your knowledge to practical projects.
Course Benefits:
Design the Future: PCB design is a crucial skill for any electrical engineer. Learn how to use Altium to bring your projects to life.
Create Custom PCBs: With the basics of PCB design, you’ll be able to create custom boards for any project.
Master Altium Designer: Gain the skills needed to use Altium Designer efficiently and effectively.
Course Outline:
Introduction and Discussion
Requirements
Coding
Circuit Design
Prototype House Construction
Circuit Building
Project Demonstration
Who Is This Course For:
Beginners in PCB Design: Individuals new to PCB design and Altium Designer.
Electronics Hobbyists: Enthusiasts looking to expand their skills in PCB design.
STEM Students and Educators: Those involved in STEM education seeking practical, hands-on experience.
Professional Developers: Developers aiming to integrate PCB design into their projects.
Requirements:
Basic Electronics Knowledge: A fundamental understanding of electronics is recommended.
Computer Access: A computer with internet access.
Altium Designer Software: Access to Altium Designer for hands-on practice.
About the Instructor:
Educational Engineering Team is a renowned group of skilled engineers with over 13 years of experience in teaching and practical projects. courses.title: Programar CLP Allen Bradley Micro800 no CCW
courses.bio: Programação dos CLP's da família Micro800 e seus recursos
objectives: Programar e Desenvolver projetos utilizando CLP Allen Bradley da Familia Micro800 (micro810,micro820,micro830,micro850 e micro870).
Criar Lógicas de programação e aprender as principais instruções do CLP

Aprender a usar o Protocolo Modbus Serial e Ethernet em suas aplicações

Aprender a usar as entradas e saídas analógicas

Instalando o Software CCW e Atualizando a Versão
Principais Instruções: Usando o Relógio do CLP Parte-1
Usando o Relógio do CLP Parte-2
Bloco de função definido pelo usuário - UDFB
Usando Encoder - Instrução HSC Parte-5 PLS
Usando a versão Developer do CCW
Conversando com Aplicativos: Enviando e recebendo dados do Labview
Enviando e recebendo dados do Labview - outro exemplo
Colocando o CLP em Rede: Protocolo Modbus Serial como Mestre Parte-1
Protocolo Modbus Serial como Mestre Parte-2

requirements: Computador com Windows
courses.description:
O aluno vai aprender a programar os clp's desta nova família da Allen Bradley e aplica-los em seus projetos de automação.
O curso vai mostrar as principais instruções básicas e avançadas do clp, configurar e criar objetos básicos na IHM Panel View 800, utilizar a instrução para uso do encoder, utilizar as saídas rápidas para uso do PWM, Comunicar com outros dispositivos usando Modbus e ASCII na porta serial e na porta ethernet, trocar dados com o supervisório FactoryTalk ME e com o LabView, diferenciar o uso do CCW gratuíto com a versão developer, e muito mais.
Iremos utilizar a linguagem Ladder na programação a mais utilizada em programação de clp's, veremos também uma aplicação utilizando linguagem de texto.
A área de automação é uma das que mais cresce no brasil e no mundo, por isto a importância de se aprender a programar uma família de clp's para estudantes, técnicos, engenheiros e qualquer pessoa envolvida na área de automação industrial, e nada melhor que começar os seus estudos por uma das maiores fabricantes de CLP e soluções de automação do mundo.
Após a conclusão do curso o aluno estará apto a :
- Identificar e escolher o melhor CLP para sua aplicação
- Criar um novo projeto e rotinas de usuário
- Navegar e usar os recursos do software CCW
- Criar projetos básicos e avançados usando lógica do CLP e dispositivos analógicos e especiais como o  encoder
- Identificar e criar projetos básicos usando a IHM Panel View 800
- Fazer download e upload do programa
- Identificar e limpar as falhas do CLP
- Realizar a comunicação do clp com outros dispositivos e softwares


Apesar do curso não ter pré-requisitos é desejável conhecimentos básicos em elétrica e informática básica.
target_audience: Estudantes,Tecnicos,Engenheiros e Intusiastas em Programação de CLP

courses.title: Safety Controller SC10-2ROE
courses.bio: Learn how to program safety controller and interface it with PLC and Node-RED
requirements: Basic fundamentals of digital electronics
Basic PLC Programming
Basic understanding of safety circuits
courses.description:
Gone are the days when we were using traditional safety circuit which are easily hackable or bypassed by unauthorized person which further cause damage to your security system. In Today's world with the advancement of technologies, the safety devices are getting smarter by adding extra layer of security (RFID). Have you heard of a door switch which has RFID? This allows hard to hack the safety circuit and hence provide better security. In this course, you will learn about smart safety devices and their interfacing with Safety controller SC10-2ROE. This safety controller can be programmed with a free safety controller software which is highly easily to program using icon-based software.
You will learn how to use and install SC10 controller along with safety devices like RF Door switch, Magnetic door switch and EM-Stop in your industrial application. Furthermore you will see how to integrate 3rd party controller like S7-1200 PLC with SC10 controller over PROFINET and how to visualize the safety devices on the dashboard using Node-RED via MODBUC TCP/IP

Key topics
Understanding SC10 controller
Various safety devices like RF Door switch, magnetic door switch, EM-Stop, S22 Pro Manual button
In-series diagnostic feature
How SC10 controller can communicate with S7-1200 PLC via PROFINET.
Sharing of safety and non-safety signal
Bypassing the sensors
Adding more virtual non-safety signals over PROFINET
Visualizing the safety signals on the dashboard using Node-RED
target_audience: PLC Programmers
Factory Automation or Shop floor Engineer
Industrial technician
Software developers

courses.title: [반도체 전문가] 우종석의 왕초보자도 쉽게 배우는 반도체 병아리반
courses.bio: 쉽고 편하게, 반도체와의 설레는 첫만남
objectives: 반도체의 기초 개념을 학습하고, 반도체의 역할과 특성을 이해할 수 있다.
반도체의 동작 원리를 설명할 수 있다.
반도체 산업을 네 가지로 분류하여 설명할 수 있다.
메모리 반도체와 비메모리 반도체의 각 특징 및 차이점을 알 수 있다.
반도체 Fab에 대한 개념을 이해하고, 반도체 제조에 사용되는 장비들의 활용 방안을 알 수 있다.
반도체 제조의 핵심인 Wafer를 이해하고, 수율향상을 위한 Wafer의 발전 방향을 설명할 수 있다.
Deposition, Photolithography, Etch를 중심으로 반도체 8대 공정의 흐름을 이해할 수 있다.
requirements: 별도의 선수지식이 없어도 충분히 수강이 가능합니다.
courses.description:
반도체가 주요 산업으로 떠오르면서 많은 사람들이 반도체에 관심을 갖게 되었습니다.
반도체를 잘 모르더라도 OK! 반도체에 관심만 있다면?
반도체 제품부터 제조 및 생산까지 한 번에! 반도체를 전혀 모르시는 분들도 완벽하게 반도체 생태계를 이해할 수 있습니다.


[반도체] 실리콘 웨이퍼 위에 네모 모양의 금속 만들기
반도체가 무엇인지 그 정의를 이해하고, 여러분들의 삶 속에서 반도체가 어떻게 활용되는지 알 수 있습니다.


[반도체 Value Chain?] IDM(종합), Fabless, Foundry, OSAT의 긴밀한 협력
종합 반도체 회사부터 후공정 회사까지, 반도체 생태계를 반도체 Value Chain에 속한 기업들의 역할을 바탕으로 쉽게 이해할 수 있습니다.


[반도체 제조?] 그림을 그리고, 깎고, 청소하고, 쌓는 과정이다.
보편적으로 칭하는 반도체 제조 8대 공정의 근본적인 핵심은 쉽게 말하면 그림을 그리고, 원하는 대로 깎고, 청소하고, 필요한 만큼 쌓아가는 과정입니다. 그림을 그리고, 깎고, 쌓는 과정이라는 점에 초점을 맞춰 반도체 제조 프로세스를 이해한다면 복잡한 반도체 제조 공정을 쉽게 이해할 수 있습니다.
target_audience: 반도체 비전공자
반도체의 정의, 중요성, 산업 등 개념 전반을 알고자 하는 자
다른 강의나 유튜브를 시청하여도 반도체 개념에 대해 100% 이해하지 못한 자
반도체 제조 프로세스 전반을 쉽게 이해하고자 하는 자

objectives: Programação básica em C#

courses.description:
Programação, Orientação a Objetos, Comunicação Serial e projetos práticos!
Nós 7 módulos com quase 12 horas de conteúdo detalhado vou ajudar você a construir o conhecimento para criar interfaces no Windows para projetos com Arduino, usando téncnicas de programação orientada a objetos.
*** Faça como mais de 14000 alunos inscritos em nossos cursos e venha aprender conosco! ***
DIFERENCIAIS DO INSTRUTOR
Professor com experiêcia. Já lecionei em Universidades e Faculdades em cursos de graduação e pós-graduação onde orientei vários Trabalhos de Conclusão de Curso usando microcontroladores, Arduino e programação.
Formação sólida. Mestre em Engenharia de Sistemas, Pós-Graduado em Cloud Computing e Graduado em Engenharia da Computação.
Profissional de Tecnologia. Mais de 20 anos atuando na área de tecnologia além da docêcia, com mais de 20 anos em desenvolvimento de software, gestão de equipes e sócio-fundador de startup.
====================================
>>> VEJA O QUE OS ALUNOS ESTÃO COMENTANDO <<<


⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ "O professor é sensacional! Aprendi muito mais do que esperava", Lunno C.


⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ "Explicação clara e tranquila. Isso é tudo que um curso EAD deve oferecer, além é claro, da abordagem do conteúdo [...]", Nilson da Costa B.


⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ "Boa didatica e esta fornecendo toda a base para seguir com o curso", Diego Santos O.


⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ "Muito bem organizado com excelente didática, muito boa sintonia da comunicação verbal com o material visual.", Márcio Sanglard T.


⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ "Tenho me surpreendido com didática, e com o nível de detalhes das explicações ", Silvio M.
====================================
Este curso é voltado para todas as pessoas que desejam integrar seus projetos em Arduino com o computador. Vamos utilizar os princípios básicos da programação C# e do Arduino para criar do absoluto zero, interfaces de controle para nossos projetos com base na comunicação serial.
Os softwares supervisórios são largamente utilizados na indústria de modo geral. Neste curso fazer nosso próprio supervisório para apresentar informações sobre nossos projetos como temperatura, luminosidade, umidade etc. Também para realizar controles de acordo com certos parâmetros definidos.
Vamos começar desde o básico da linguagem C#, avançar pela programação orientada a objetos e realizar a integração passo a passo evoluindo a estrutura do código de cada projeto.
São quase 12 horas de conteúdo em vídeo para você aprender o que precisa para desenvolver seus projetos integrados com o PC.
O curso está dividido em 7 seções descritas a seguir:


Apresentação. É uma seção curta onde o instrutor é apresentado e fala sobre o curso de forma geral. Também é onde são os mostrados softwares utilizados no curso.


Introdução à Programação em Linguagem C#. Nesta seção veremos os conceitos básicos da programação C#. As estruturas condicionais, loops, variáveis e outros aspectos da linguagem serão mostrados aqui.


Windows Forms e POO com C#. Para que você que ainda não conhece a programação orientada a objetos esta seção te dará uma visão de alguns conceitos desse paradigma. Veremos também os Windows Forms, peça chave para este curso.


Comunicação entre o Arduino e o PC. A comunicação é palavra chave neste curso. Esta seção mostrará que você provavelmente já realiza comunicação em seus sketches mas falaremos dessa comunicação de forma mais ampla.


Projeto 1 - Multicolor Monitor Serial. Esta é a seção onde começamos a colocar a mão na massa em forma de projeto. Vamos criar do absoluto zero um monitor serial similar ao que temos na IDE do Arduino mas com uma funcionalidade a mais: cores! Ficou curioso? Vem conhecer o projeto!


Projeto 2 - Interfaceando a Shield Multifunção. Neste projeto vamos utilizar o Arduino Uno juntamente com a Shield Multifunção para apresentar informações de temperatura, LEDs e leitura analógica. Vamos aprender como criar nosso próprio componente em C# e a utilizar componentes prontos.


Conclusão. Na seção de conclusão eu deixo um pequeno desafio para que você possa usar tudo que foi visto ao longo do curso para pôr a mão na massa e programar um projeto sugerido nesta seção.
target_audience: Pessoas  tenham interesse em se aprofundar no uso de Arduino com PC .
Qualquer pessoa com conhecimento básico de Arduino e algum conhecimento de programação.
Estudantes de cursos de Engenharia Eletrônica, Computação, Automação ou afins.
Qualquer um com interesse em programar supervisórios para Arduino
Alunos que querem fazer TCC com Arduino

courses.title: Introduction to C.H.I.P
courses.bio: Learn how to create software and hardware projects using CHIP and python programming
requirements: Students will need basic knowledge of programming
courses.description:
This is an introductory course to CHIP which is a 9$ computer. This course is great for those who are interested in either learning physical computing or want to use the chip as a full-fledged computer. This course only assumes that you have basic knowledge of programming and does not require you to know Linux commands or Python programming. However, a knowledge of the mentioned would greatly speed up your learning process.
If you do not know Linux or Python, no need to worry. The course has sections that cover the basics of Linux to get you started.

The chip is a 9$ device which will act as the CPU to which we will need to connect basic peripherals like a keyboard,mouse and a monitor to make it work as a full-fledged computer. The course will teach you to set up the CHIP and make it work as a low cost computer. You will also learn to work with hardware in combination with the GPIO pins of the CHIP.
You will be learning from 3 projects. The first project will be your first step in physical computing and you will learn about GPIO pins and how to use them.
The second project will teach you to create a very simple and basic GUI with which you can control hardware and thus works as a virtual remote. Pretty cool right?
The third project is an ATM greeting machine which works with sensors to greet a person entering and exiting an ATM vestibule.
The course provides error-free source code for the above mentioned projects.
The entire course course can be completed over a period of 3 hours assuming that you have all the hardware necessary. Do not worry if it takes you longer since the longer it takes, the more you will be learning and more the fun.
By the end of the course, You will learn how to setup the CHIP, install and update the various packages needed for the projects. You will also learn basic Linux commands and the python code to make some really cool projects.
target_audience: This is an introductory course meant for those who are interested in exploring the CHIP. While a knowledge of Linux operating system and Python programming language will be helpful, it is not required to follow this course. The basics of Linux will be taught as a part of this course.

objectives: Comprender los fundamentos de electrónica
Uso de las principales herramientas electrónicas

Reparacion de controles PlayStation

Introducción: Adquiere los productos que te recomendamos

requirements: No se necesita experiencia. Aprenderás desde lo más básico del mundo electrónico hasta dominar las habilidades
courses.description:
El mundo de los videojuegos no para de crecer, y con él, la necesidad de técnicos que sepan reparar controles y consolas como unos verdaderos cracks. Si te interesa meterte en la electrónica aplicada a videojuegos, este curso es para ti, desde cero, sin rodeos y con mucha práctica.


Aquí aprenderás a fondo cómo funcionan los controles de distintas consolas, cómo detectar y resolver las fallas más comunes, y tendrás una introducción práctica para entender y reparar las consolas mismas, todo explicado paso a paso.


Este curso cubre temas esenciales como electricidad, ley de Ohm, mediciones, soldadura y electrónica básica, explicados de forma sencilla para que no te pierdas aunque nunca hayas tocado un cautín.


Además, este curso está respaldado por El Taller de Alex, un taller en México con casi 10 años de experiencia reparando controles y consolas. Eso significa que estás aprendiendo con la misma metodología y trucos que usamos en reparaciones reales, no teoría de libro.


Al terminar, tendrás la capacidad para diagnosticar y arreglar problemas en controles y consolas, y el conocimiento para enfrentarte con confianza a cualquier dispositivo electrónico que llegue a tus manos.


Si buscas un curso práctico, divertido y con bases sólidas para destacar en el mundo de la reparación de videojuegos, no busques más. ¡Nos vemos dentro y prepárate para darle vida a esos controles que otros dan por muertos!
target_audience: Técnicos de consolas con interés en especializarse electrónicamente

courses.title: Do It Yourself PLC Trainer
courses.bio: Project, Setup PLC Trainer with CODESYS and Arduino Uno Compatible Board

Working With the Arduino IDE: Load Sketch to Arduino Uno Compatible Board
Wiring the Arduino Uno Compatible Board: Analog I/O, The Potentiometer, LED5 and completing the board assembly
Sample Lesson, Basic Ladder Logic Diagra: Lesson and Exercises for Beginner Basic Ladder Logic Diagram
Questions for Beginner Basic Ladder Logic Diagram

requirements: Some basic electrical training and electronics.
Able to read schematic symbols.
courses.description:
The intent is to provide instructions to set up a PLC training station to support self-learning of PLCs and to practice PLC programming. When you are learning to program the PLC, you will want to test the logic you are writing and the most hands-on way to do that is with real world I/O connected to real world devices. But the price of industrial hardware is too high for someone who is teaching themselves. Using your PC, CODESYS Software and an Arduino Uno Compatible board; this can be done at a much lower cost. CODESYS software running on your PC can operate as a PLC CPU. The Arduino Uno Compatible board can connect to inputs and outputs. This coarse will show you how to install and setup the software and how to connect components that make up the I/O with a solderless breadboard. Also, you get to learn about CODESYS and Arduino along the way.
Videos take you through the process step by step.
Included is a beginner level lesson and exercises to get started programming with Ladder Logic Diagram programming language.
Parts required are: Arduino Uno Compatible Microcontroller Board, Solderless Breadboard, 5 Resistors 10 Kilo-ohm, 5 Resistors 220 ohm, 5 LEDs, 5 Momentary Push Buttons,  a 10 Kilo-ohm Potentiometer and some wire jumpers to connect it all together.
target_audience: Beginner level PLC programmers interested in self learning.

ADC Library Interface With PicMicroController (MikroC)
ADC Library
ADC (Analog to Digital Converter) module is available with a number of PIC MCU modules. ADC is an electronic circuit that converts continuous signals to discrete digital numbers. ADC Library provides you a comfortable work with the module.
Library Routines
ADC_Init
ADC_Get_Sample
ADC_Read
ADC_Init
Prototype
void ADC_Init();
Returns
Nothing.
Description
This routine initializes PIC’s internal ADC module to work with RC clock. Clock determines the time period necessary for performing AD conversion (min 12TAD).
Requires
MCU with built-in ADC module.
Example
ADC_Init();  // Initialize ADC module with default settings
target_audience: Any Person Using Adc in Electronics Project

courses.description:
Have you wanted to repair a broken iPhone 4GSM (AT&T Version), but weren't sure where to start? Start here! Let our easy to follow, do-it-yourself course help you accomplish your repair. This course is designed for anyone with the need, desire, or want to repair any iPhone 4GSM. Our lectures cover all of the major repairs related to the iPhone 4GSM.

Not only do you get amazing instruction with easy to follow steps, but you get all of these repairs in one place. Now you can have quality repair videos for the iPhone 4GSM at your fingertips. You will receive knowledge from industry professionals that have been in the repair industry since 1997 and have help thousands of individuals with their own phone repairs. With each lesson you can easily follow along as we show detailed, step by step instruction on each of the repairs listed.
The skills that you will learn with our course give you the ability, if desired, to start your own repair service. What could be better than making money repairing the iPhone 4GSM for your friends, family and people in your community! With this small investment and minimal time you can be on your way to potentially making huge profits. What better time than now to join the multi-billion dollar cell phone repair industry and start to receive your piece of the pie!
The total instruction for all repairs is 15 videos over 2 hours of jam packed knowledge with everything you need to know about iPhone 4GSM repairs. This will give all who watch the guidance and knowledge to repair any iPhone 4GSM.

Bilgisayar teknolojileri günümüzde hızla gelişiyor ve iş dünyasında vazgeçilmez bir rol oynuyor. Bilgisayar teknikerliği kursu, bu heyecan verici alanda kariyer yapmak isteyenler için mükemmel bir başlangıç noktası sunuyor.


Bu kurs, bilgisayar donanımı, yazılımı ve ağ teknolojileri konularında temel bilgileri öğretmek amacıyla tasarlanmıştır. Kurs boyunca, bilgisayar bileşenlerinin çalışma prensiplerini, işletim sistemlerini ve temel yazılım uygulamalarını öğreneceksiniz. Ayrıca ağ teknolojilerinin temellerini kavrayacak ve bilgisayar güvenliği konularında uzmanlaşacaksınız.
Kursunuzun bir parçası olarak, pratik becerilerinizi geliştirecek ve gerçek dünya senaryolarında sorun giderme becerilerinizi uygulayabileceksiniz. Bilgisayar donanımını onarma, yazılım sorunlarını çözme ve ağ problemlerini teşhis etme gibi pratik beceriler edineceksiniz.
Bilgisayar teknikerliği kursu ayrıca sizi müşteri ilişkileri konusunda da donatacaktır. İyi iletişim becerileri, sorunları anlama ve etkili çözümler sunma konusunda size yardımcı olacaktır. Bu da sizi müşterilerinizle başarılı bir şekilde etkileşim kurabilen bir profesyonel yapacaktır.
Kurs sonunda, bilgisayar teknikeri olarak iş bulma ve kendi işinizi başlatma fırsatlarına sahip olacaksınız. Bilgisayar teknolojileri her geçen gün daha fazla talep görüyor ve bu kurs size bu büyüyen sektörde bir adım önde olmanızı sağlayacaktır.
Hemen Bilgisayar Teknikerliği Kursumuza katılarak, bilgisayar dünyasında uzmanlaşmanın heyecanını yaşayın ve kariyerinizi bir sonraki seviyeye taşıyın!

courses.description:
Este curso te preparará para afrontar cualquier desafío IoT a nivel Profesional.
Sin depender de servicios de terceros, en tu propia nube, bajo tu íntegro control.
El curso es totalmente práctico, verás código de inicio a fin.
Aprenderemos a:
