courses.description: Bu Eğitimde Robotik Kodlama Eğitimine Farklı bir Bakış açısı açacağız. Visual Studio Code ile Platform Bağımsız projeler geliştireceğiz. Platform bağımsız derken ne demek istediğimi hemen açıklayım. Arduino, ESP8266, Raspberry pi, Orange pi vb. kartlarını artık tek bir platform (PlatformIO) ile programlayabileceğiz. Robotik kodlamaya sıfırdan ve derinlemesine bir giriş yapacağız. İlk olarak neden yazılım? Neden Robotik kodlama?  sorularını cevaplandıracağız. C ++ dilini detaylı bir şekilde öğrenip robotik kodlamaya hazır hale geleceğiz. İlk projelerimiz eğitim amaçlı olup bir şeyler yapabildiğinizi kanıtlayacağız. İlerleyen projelerde gelişimi farkedeceksiniz ve Artık Eğitim amaçlı projelerden kurtulup günlük yaşamamızda kullanacağımız projeler geliştireceğiz. Eğitim setindeki çekmemdeki amacım endüstri 4.0 toplum 5.0 kavramlarına uygun olarak yetişmenizi ve geleceğe rakiplerinizden daha hazır olmanızı sağlamak. Toplum 5.0 ya da bir başka deyişle ‘‘süper akıllı toplum’’, dijitalleşme ve yapay zekânın toplumsal yaşamdaki etkilerinin her yönüyle değerlendirildiği, insanların makine ve robotlarla ilişkisinin en verimli biçimde sağlandığı, büyüme ve kalkınmayı amaçlayan bir toplum modelidir. Endüstri 4.0; İş süreçlerinin veriye dayalı bilimsel metotlarla yönetildiği, Nesnelerin İnterneti, Büyük Veri ve Makinalar Arası İletişim teknolojilerinin birlikte kullanılması ile ortaya çıkan yeni Sanayi Devrimi’ne verilen isimdir. Kursu edindiğiniz günden itibaren fiyatına göre sizlere çok fazla bilgi deneyim kattığını göreceksiniz. Binlerce tl verip kavrayamayacağınız konuları tekrar tekrar dinleyerek öğreneceksiniz. Robotik kodlamaya gönül veren tüm arkadaşların arşivinde olması gereken bir çalışmayı sizler için hazırladım. İYİ SEYİRLER :)
target_audience: Öğrenmeyi,Kendini Geliştirmeyi seven,Robotik Kodlamaya meraklı bireyler.

Nesnelerin interneti konularına meraklı bireyler.

courses.title: Hardware for Microcontroller and Electronics
courses.bio: This course will give you everything you need to start playing with Most Common Hardware for Makers Today
requirements: A breadboard
A Will to Apply not Just Watch!
jumper wires
battery
courses.description:
This commonly used hardware for microcontrollers and electronics course is intended for those interested in learning new things about different platforms and devices used by makers today.
Welcome to this course. In this course, we'll take you by the hand and introduce the foremost common devices, concepts, and software employed by makers, engineers, and microcontroller geeks worldwide, to assist you in kick-starting your career in the microcontroller and electronics world.
You will get to understand new things like single board computers and single board MCUs and the difference between them, why we use modules, and what development boards are available nowadays, additionally to different platforms available for you to use in your journey.
You will gain more knowledge about the various types of commonly used hardware for makers and engineers. We will look at the commonly used hardware that engineers make cars and microcontroller geeks utilize more than others.
Why You Should Take This Course:
This course is designed to give you everything you need to start playing with hardware for makers today.
You will learn how to set up a circuit just by following a diagram and troubleshooting it if something goes wrong.
This course is for anyone who wants to get started with making things.
Course Benefits:
Design and Test Electronics: Breadboards are one of the most essential tools in designing and testing electronics. They provide a convenient platform to quickly prototype circuits without having to solder components together. Additionally, development boards and modules can be plugged into breadboards to create even more complex designs. Single-board computers can also be used with breadboards to test code before implementing it on a larger scale.
Make Invention Easy: Breadboards, platforms, development boards, modules, and single-board computers make it easy to develop inventions. These tools provide a variety of ways to easily connect hardware and test electronics. They also allow for experimentation and prototyping without the need for soldering.
Things That Will Be Covered in This Course:
General boards: how they work and their internal structure, and why it's important to use them.
Development boards: what they are and the difference between a development board and a single-board computer.
Single board computers: their importance and the difference between them and other electronic and microcontroller boards available.
Platforms like Arduino and others: why it's important to use platforms as you work with electronics and microcontrollers.
Modules: if you haven't heard of modules or if you have heard of them but don't know how to use them and why it's really important to use them.
Topics That Will Be Discussed During the Introduction to Electronic Components Course Are:
Breadboards
Platforms
Development Boards
Modules
Single Board Computer
Single Board MCU
I'm sure that you will enjoy this course and it will add a lot of knowledge to you. ENROLL NOW!
What You Will Learn:
Understanding and using breadboards, platforms, development boards, modules, and single-board computers.
Setting up circuits by following diagrams.
Troubleshooting and testing electronics without soldering.
Who Is This Course For:
Beginners in electronics and microcontroller projects.
Individuals interested in learning about commonly used hardware for makers.
Hobbyists and enthusiasts in electronics.
Requirements:
Basic computer skills.
No prior knowledge of electronics required.


About the Instructor Info
Educational Engineering Team
Team of skilled Engineers Sharing Knowledge with the World
Educational Engineering Team is a Leading Team in the Microcontroller Industry, with over 13 Years of Experience in Teaching and Doing Practical Projects.
We strive to put all our hands-on experience in these courses. Instead of superficial knowledge, we go into the depth of the topic and give you the exact, step-by-step blueprint on how to tackle simple as well as complex topics in easy and digestible bite-sized videos.
This real-world knowledge enables you to grasp knowledge easily, and you can apply this learning immediately to your life and projects.
Educational Engineering Team has been in the Programming and Microcontroller business since 2007. We have been part of many projects. Over the course of these years, we have gained a good insight into students’ and educators’ needs. We are passionate about sharing all our collective knowledge with you. As of 2018, we have already taught over 250k-THOUSAND students and counting.
Currently, we have more than 100+ Courses on Udemy.
Educator and Author of “Educational Engineering”
Ashraf is an educator, Mechatronics engineer, electronics and programming hobbyist, and Maker. He creates online video courses on the EduEng YouTube Channel (More Than 4 Million Views, 20k + Subscribers) and author of four Microcontroller books.
As a Chief Educational Engineer since 2007 at Educational Engineering Team, the company he founded, Ashraf’s mission is to explore new trends and technology and help educate the world and make it a better place.
Educational Engineering offers educational courses and Bootcamps, articles, lessons, and online support for electronics hobbyists, Programming hobbyists, Microcontroller hobbyists, STEM students, and STEM teachers.
The team also works as freelance engineers, helping many students in their graduation projects, and providing guidance and consulting for many students over the years to help them kick-start their careers.
Ashraf’s core skill is explaining difficult concepts in a step-by-step easy-to-understand manner using video and text. With over 11 years of tertiary teaching experience, Ashraf has developed a simple yet comprehensive and informative style in teaching that students from all around the world appreciate.
His passion for Microcontrollers and Programming, particularly for the world of Arduino, PIC Microcontroller, Raspberry Pi, has guided his personal development and his work through Educational Engineering.
Ashraf’s online courses have helped over 250,000 people from around the world to be better and to make a great career in the industry.
Educational Engineering Team offers Courses on:
Circuit Design, Simulation, and PCB Fabrication
Arduino, PIC Microcontroller, and Raspberry Pi
Programming in C, Python, and other programming languages
PLC Industrial Programming and Automation
3D Design and Simulation
ESP and IoT World

Anyone who wants to learn more about Different Platforms Available
Anyone who wants to learn more about Single Board Computer
Anyone who wants to learn more about Single Board MCU
Anyone who wants to learn more about Development Boards
Anyone who wants to learn more about Modules

courses.description:
Aprender a reparar teléfonos móviles, smartphones o celulares, es una profesión anti-crisis: si se venden menos dispositivos nuevos, se repararán más los antiguos. Además, la legislación actual (EEUU/Europa, derecho a reparar; España, índice de reparabilidad) va en la misma dirección: cómo reparar y reutilizar lo máximo posible, para cuidar del medio ambiente.
Sin lugar a dudas, es una profesión de futuro.
El punto fuerte de este curso online de reparación de móviles, es el acuerdo que tenemos con ANOVO, que es el servicio técnico OFICIAL de reparación de telefonía número 1 en España y uno de los principales de Europa, lo cual asegura la calidad del contenido formativo y facilita la inserción laboral. Es un curso en el que vas a aprender desde cero, sin necesidad de experiencia previa. Mezcla teoría con reparaciones reales, y está enfocado a que encuentres trabajo, ya sea montando tu propia empresa, o reparando para alguien.
Los contenidos han sido actualizados recientemente, lo cual es muy importante: puedes echar un vistazo a la clase gratuita, acerca de cómo quitar la tapa a un Samsung Galaxy S21. Además, no queremos marearte con centenares de horas de formación: nos gusta ir al grano, y que aprendas lo máximo posible, en muy poco tiempo.
Tras esta formación, serás capaz de reparar en cualquier servicio técnico, e incluso sentarás las bases para montar tu propio negocio de reparaciones.
Aprende con nuestro curso de reparación de móviles, a tu ritmo y desde casa, sin importar si vives en España (Madrid, Barcelona, Valencia, Alicante, Sevilla, Málaga, Coruña...) o en América Latina (México, Chile, Perú, Colombia, Argentina, Venezuela...).
target_audience: Si buscas trabajo o necesitas un cambio, y además te gusta entender cómo funcionan las cosas y disfrutas "cacharreando"

courses.title: マイコンとレゴを使ったロボットカーの開発
courses.bio: 新バージョンのアルディーノIDE2.0に対応！　アルディーノ（Arduino）マイコン、おもちゃのブロック「レゴ（LEGO）」、超音波距離センサーを使って、障害物をよけて進むシンプルなロボットカーを製作します。
objectives: シンプルなロボットカーの仕組み
マイコンボードの使い方
電子部品の使い方
電子回路図の読み方
ブレッドボードを使った電子部品の配線方法

複数の電子部品を組み合せたプログラミング
レゴを使ったロボットカーの車体の組み立て方
自動走行のプログラミング
障害物をよけるプログラミング

コース紹介: コースを活用する方法
アルディーノ: アルディーノIDEのインストール
アルディーノIDE v2.0のインストール
アルディーノIDE v2.0の設定
アルディーノＩＤＥ　ｖ２．０．０で起こる症状
ロボットカーを組み立てる: ロボットカーの仕組みを学ぶ
ロボットカーを組み立てる
ロボットカーのタイヤを回す: ポテンショメータを学ぶ
ポテンショメータとサーボモータを接続する電子回路を学ぶ
ポテンショメータとサーボモータを配線する
サーボモータのプログラミング
サーボライブラリのインストール（ＩＤＥ　ｖ２．０）
サーボモータのプログラムを実行する（１）
サーボモータのプログラムを実行する（２）
ロボットカーに自動走行させる: 自動走行のプログラミング
自動走行のプログラムを実行する
超音波距離センサーで距離を測る: 超音波距離センサーを学ぶ
超音波距離センサーを接続する電子回路を学ぶ
超音波距離センサーを配線する
超音波距離センサーのプログラミング
超音波距離センサーのプログラムを実行する
ロボットカーに障害物をよけさせる: 障害物をよけるプログラミング
障害物をよけるプログラムを実行する

requirements: Windows、または、MAC、LinuxのPC。コースではWindowsPCで説明しています。
アルディーノボードや、電子部品、レゴの部品をご準備できれば、このコースの内容を体験できますが、必須ではありません。
courses.description:
このコースでは、マイコンボードと「レゴ（LEGO）」を使ってシンプルなロボットカーを製作します。
車に、センサーを搭載して、
マイコンボードにプログラミングをして、
自分で障害物をよけるロボットカーを作ります。


マイコンボードは、使いやすくて定番の「アルディーノ（Arduino）」を使います。
ロボットカーの車体は、おもちゃのブロック「「レゴ」を使って組み立てます。そのため、車体の製作に工具は必要ありません。
電子部品の配線には、ブレッドボードを使います。そのため、電子回路の製作に、はんだ付けは必要ありません。


360度回転するサーボモータで、タイヤを回転させて、ロボットカーを走らせます。
超音波距離センサーを使って、非接触で、前方の障害物までの距離を測ります。
これらの電子部品をマイコンボードに接続し、組み立てたロボットカーに搭載します。
ロボットカーが自分で判断して行動するプログラムを作成します。
プログラムを実行し、パラメータを調整して、障害物をよけて進むロボットカーの完成です。


はじめに、このコースと一緒にロボットカーの製作を体験するために、準備するものを学びます。
次に、アルディーノについて学びます。アルディーノのソフトウェア開発環境「アルディーノIDE」を、パソコンにインストールします。
（このコース制作時は、アルディーノIDEのバージョン1.8でしたが、最新のバージョン2.0に対応できるよう追加で説明しています。）
そのあと、障害物をよけて進むロボットカーを開発していきます。


ロボットカーの仕組みを学びます。
・ロボットカーを組み立てます。
ロボットカーのタイヤを回します。
・ポテンショメータの使い方を学びます。
・サーボモータの使い方を学びます。
・ポテンショメータとサーボモータを、マイコンボードに接続する電子回路を学びます。
・ポテンショメータとサーボモータを、マイコンボードに配線します。
・サーボモータのPWM信号を変えるプログラミングをします。
・プログラムを実行して、右左のタイヤをそれぞれ独立に回して、ロボットカーがどのような方向に動くのかを確かめます。
ロボットカーに自動走行させます。
・自動走行するロボットカーのプログラミングをします。
・プログラムを実行して、ロボットカーが、前進、後退、右回転、左回転、と自動走行するのを確かめます。
超音波距離センサーで距離を測ります。
・超音波距離センサーの使い方を学びます。
・超音波距離センサーを、マイコンボードに接続する電子回路を学びます。
・超音波距離センサーをマイコンボードに配線します。
・超音波距離センサーで距離を測るプログラミングをします。
・プログラムを実行して、超音波距離センサーで距離が測れるのを確かめます。
ロボットカーに障害物をよけさせます。
・障害物をよけるロボットカーのプログラミングをします。
・プログラムを実行して、障害物がなければロボットカーは前進、障害物があればロボットカーは右回転して障害物をよけるのを確かめます。障害物をよけるパラメータを調整して、ロボットカーの完成です。
target_audience: アルディーノやマイコンで、簡単な電子工作を経験したことがある初級者。
マイコンボードを使ってロボットを作りたい人。

courses.title: Internet of Things (IoT) สำหรับผู้เริ่มต้น
courses.bio: เรียนรู้และพัฒนา Internet of Things (IoT) สำหรับผู้เริ่มต้นโดยใช้แพลทฟอร์ม Arduino
objectives: การติดตั้ง การเตรียมเครื่องมือ Tools และ Libraries สำหรับการพัฒนา IoT Application โดยใช้บอร์ด NodeMCU ESP8266 (Arduino Platform)
สร้างโปรเจคด้าน IoT โดยใช้บอร์ด NodeMCU ESP8266 (Arduino Platform)
เขียนโปรแกรมควบคุมการทำงาน IoT Application

การใช้งาน Output แบบ Digital ควบคุมการปิดเปิดอุปกรณ์ และ Pulse-width Modulator (PWM) สำหรับควบคุมอุปกรณ์เช่น DC Motor ฯลฯ
การเชื่อมต่อเซนเซอร์เข้ากับ IoT เช่น Analog Sensor, Digital Sensor ทำการวัดอุณหภูมิ ฯลฯ
การสร้าง Access Point และ Web Server
MQTT protocol และการใช้งานส่งข้อมูลระหว่างอุปกรณ์
Pulse-width Modulation, I2C bus, Pull-up, Pull-down

บทนำ: เริ่มต้น Internet of Things (IoT)
มีอะไรในคอร์สนี้
บอร์ด Micro-controller ที่ใช้ในคอร์สนี้
การติดตั้งเครื่องมือต่างๆ และ Libraries: ติดตั้ง Arduino IDE
รู้จักกับตัวแปลง USB to Serial
การติดตั้ง Driver บน Windows
การติดตั้ง Driver บน MacOS
การติดตั้ง Library
ทดลองสร้างและรัน Project แรก: ระบบทำงานอย่างไร
การใช้งาน Arduino IDE เบื้องต้น
พื้นฐานอุปกรณ์อิเลคทรอนิคส์เบื้องต้น และ: ขาอินพุทเอ้าพุท GPIO
อุปกรณ์อิเลคทรอนิคส์พื้นฐาน
การใช้งานขาเอ้าพุท Digital
พื้นฐานการเขียนโปรแกรมควบคุม
ตรวจดูการทำงานโปรแกรมด้วย Serial Monitor: ตรวจสอบการทำงานของโปรแกรมด้วย Serial Monitor
พลอตกราฟดู Wave Form ด้วย Serial Plotter
การส่งข้อมูลด้วย Serial Monitor
การรับอินพุทแบบ Digital: การใช้งาน Digital Input

การใช้งาน Pull-up Resistor

ไฟกระพริบแบบปรับความถี่ได้

การเอ้าพุทสัญญาณ Analog ด้วย PWM
ปรับความสว่าง LED ด้วย PWM
เชื่อมต่อเซนเซอร์เข้ากับ IoT: วัดอุณหภูมิด้วย LM35
วัดอุณหภูมิและความชื้นด้วย DHT
การสื่อสารส่งข้อมูลด้วย I2C bus: เกี่ยวกับ I2C bus
ต่อ IoT ออกจอ LCD : Part1 (Hardware)
ต่อ IoT ออกจอ LCD : Part2 (Software)

requirements: พื้นฐานคอมพิวเตอร์เบื้องต้น เช่น Logic สถานะ High Low ฯลฯ
คอมพิวเตอร์ PC Windows/MacOS/Linux...
courses.description:
เทคโนโลยีอินเตอร์เน็ตในทุกสรรพสิ่ง หรือ Internet of Things หรือ IoT หมายถึงสิ่งของต่างๆ มีการเชื่อมต่อกันเป็นโครงข่าย ส่งข้อมูลเพื่อแลกเปลี่ยน ทำการประมวลผล หรือเพื่อควบคุมการทำงานต่างๆ สิ่งของที่กล่าวถึงนั้น หมายถึง “Things” คือสิ่งของทุกๆ อย่าง ได้แก่ เครืองใช้สำนักงาน เครื่องมือเครื่องจักรกลการเกษตร เครื่องจักรในโรงงานอุตสาหกรรม อาคาร บ้านพักอาศัย อุปกรณ์เครื่องใช้ในชีวิตประจำวันต่างๆ อาทิ นาฬิกา รถยนต์ ตู้เย็น อุปกรณ์เตือนภัย ฯลฯ โดยสิ่งที่กล่าวถึงนั้นจะมีเซ็นเซอร์ซึ่งทำหน้าที่รับรู้สภาวะแวดล้อมต่างๆ แล้วทำการส่งข้อมูลผ่านระบบเครือข่ายดังกล่าว โดย IoT จะมีส่วนช่วยในหลายๆ ด้าน เช่น การเพิ่มผลผลิตทางการเกษตร การดูแลความปลอดภัย การดูแลสุขภาพ การบันทึกเก็บข้อมูลสำหรับการวิเคราะห์ วิจัย  ฯลฯ

คอร์สนี้เหมาะสำหรับผู้เริ่มต้น โดยมีเนื้อหาเริ่มตั้งแต่อุปกรณ์ฮาร์ดแวร์อิเล็กทรอนิกส์ขั้นพื้นฐาน การใช้งานเซนเซอร์  Analog และ Digital การเขียนโปรแกรมควบคุมบอร์ดที่ใช้เป็นคอนโทรลเลอร์ การเชื่อมต่อแบบไร้สาย การสร้าง IoT Application ที่ทำงานเชื่อมต่อกับระบบคอมพิวเตอร์และอุปกรณ์ Mobile อื่นๆ ท่านสามารถนำไปต่อยอดพัฒนาสร้างโปรเจค IoT สำหรับงานด้านต่างๆ ได้
target_audience: นักเรียน นักศึกษา หรือผู้สนใจด้าน Internet of Things
นักพัฒนา นักเรียน นักศึกษา ทำโปรเจคด้าน Internet of Things

courses.title: Getting Started with Arduino and Breadboards
courses.bio: Learn from scratch to light LEDs, make simple projects and understand the world of Arduino without prior knowledge.

First steps with Arduino: Arduino IDE and our first program

requirements: No previous knowledge of electronics or programming is required.
courses.description:
Course description
Do you want to learn electronics from scratch and start creating real projects with Arduino? This course is designed for you, whether you do not have any previous experience or if you have already heard about Arduino but you do not know where to start.
Through this course, you will introduce yourself to the world of microcontrollers in a practical and simple way. You will learn exactly what an Arduino Uno board is, what it is for, how it connects to the computer and how you can program it with the official IDE. I will also explain how to use a protoboard to assemble electronic circuits without welding, and I will show you step by step how to make correct connections with LEDs, resistances and sensors.
During the course, we will carry out several simple but useful projects, such as lighting and blinking an LED, reading values of a light sensor (LDR), controlling a traffic light with timings, and printing data to the serial monitor. All this with clear explanations, diagrams, commented code and real demonstrations.
This course is ideal for students, teachers, curious and anyone who wants to enter the maker world. With a step-by-step methodology, you will learn the basis to continue creating your own projects.
No prior technical knowledge is required, just a desire to learn and some material. Are you joining?
target_audience: People who want to start in the world of electronics and programming with Arduino from scratch.

courses.title: Montagem e Manutenção de Computador do ZERO
courses.bio: Informática profissionalizante: Aprenda do ZERO desde a montagem do Hardware até a formatação e instalação do Windows 10
objectives: Identificar cada peça do computador e seu funcionamento
Montar o computador do ZERO
Aprenda tudo DIRETO AO PONTO, sem enrolação, pois respeitamos o seu tempo!
E muito mais...

Montando o Computador: Montando o kit fora do gabinete
Manutenção - Teste de peças e limpeza: Testando a placa mãe fora do Gabinete
Limpando e fazendo manutenção na fonte
Extras: BONUS: Placa de Video Off Board
BONUS: Instalando a placa de Video

requirements: Sem requisito definido
courses.description:
Aprenda 2 em 1 - Montagem e Manutenção + Formatação
CURSO VIVO: Novas aulas disponibilizadas


O CONHECIMENTO É A ESTRADA, O SUCESSO É O DESTINO!
Equipe com mais de 20 anos de experiência!
Perca o medo do computador!!
Aprenda a montar e desmontar o seu próprio computador. Conheça cada peça e seu funcionamento, cuidados, manutenção.
Aprenda também a trabalhar e ganhar dinheiro com manutenção de computadores, e economizar dinheiro cuidando do seu próprio computador.
Você não precisa ter conhecimento prévio de informática pois o curso vai te mostrar passo a passo, começando do ZERO a como fazer a manutenção do seu computador.

Mas se você já conhece um pouco de hardware, também vai gostar das dicas técnicas de uma equipe com mais de 20 anos de experiência!


VOCÊ APRENDERÁ:
- Montar e desmontar o computador
- Conhecer todas as peças e os cuidados necessários de manutenção para o seu computador durar mais
- Conhecer as ferramentas necessárias para fazer a manutenção
- Consertar o computador, testar as peças, identificar o problema e a substituir as peças, se necessário
- Acelerar o desempenho do computador por substituir o HD por um SSD
- Acelerar o desempenho do computador por acrescentar memória RAM
- Limpeza preventiva das peças
- Diferença entre tipos comuns de gabinetes
- Ganhará segurança para trabalhar com manutenção de computadores
- E tudo isso direto ao ponto, sem enrolação nas aulas, com respeito ao seu tempo!


Nossa equipe preparou esse curso pensando em você.
Venha aprender com a gente!! :)
target_audience: Para leigos e curiosos, pois ensinamos passo a passo do ZERO
Para quem quer perder o medo do computador e aprender a consertar ou atualizar o seu computador

courses.title: Altium Designer ile PCB Tasarım
courses.bio: Altium Designer ile Elektronik Kart Tasarlamak Artık Çok Kolay- Sıfırdan İleri Düzeye!
objectives: Altium Designer ile "şematik ve footprint" kütüphanelerinizi oluşturabilecek,
Şematik devre tasarımlarınızı yapabilecek,
Altium Designer Programi ile PCB Tasarlayabilecek,
Tasarladığınız devrenin PDF çıktısını alabilecek
Tasarladığınız devreyi üreticiye göndermek için Gerber Dosyalarını oluşturabilecek
Devre tasarlarken şematikte nerelere dikkat etmeniz gerektiğini öğreneceksiniz.
requirements: Temel Elektronik Bilgisi
Altium Designer Programı
Biraz sabır ve öğrenme azmi.
courses.description:
Altium Designer programı "Savunma Sanayisi"  başta olmak üzere, birçok alanda yoğunca kullanılmaktadır.  Eğitim serisinde "Sıfırdan başlayarak" , Altium Designer programının bir kart tasarlamak için kullanılabilecek bütün özelliklerine değinmeye çalıştık.


Kurs sonunda artık hazır sensör ve işlemci kartları almak yerine, kendi elektronik kartlarınızı tasarlayabilecek, fabrikasyon dosyalarını üretebileceksiniz. Ayrıca regülatörler, haberleşme protokolleri ve kullanımı ( I2C, SPI, UART...), datasheet okuma  gibi teknik konular hakkında da bilgi sahibi olmuş olacaksınız.


Kurs, PCB hakkında hiçbir şey bilmiyormuşsunuz gibi hazırlanmış olmakla birlikte, kurs bittiği zaman kendi PCB kartınızı tasarlayabilecek böylelikle hazır kartları kullanmaya son vereceksiniz.


Eğer siz de gerçek bir mühendis gibi, kendi kartlarınızı basmak istiyorsanız, bu kurs tam size göre!
target_audience: Profesyonel olarak PCB Donanım Tasarım Mühendisi olmak isteyen mühendis adayları, öğrenciler
Elektroniğe ilgili ve kendi devrelerini basmak isteyen herkes.

courses.title: Formation complète Robot Structural Analysis
courses.bio: Guide + Dimensionnement des structures en béton et des structures en acier selon les Eurocodes et le code Américain
objectives: Maitriser les fonctionalités de Robot Structural Analysis
Modéliser une structure en béton
Modéliser une structure en acier
Dimensionner les éléments de structures selon plusieurs codes
requirements: Installer le logiciel sur vos ordinateurs
courses.description:
Cette formation englobe l'apprentissage de Robot Structural Analysis accompagnée d'exercices et démonstrations. Ce cours comporte des parties réservées à l’apprentissage de :
1- Guide pratique, présentant l’apprentrissage de toute les fonctionalités offertes par Robot Structural Analysis
2- Application sur une structure en acier selon les Eurocodes
3- Application sur une structure en béton selon le code Américain ACI 318 (Etude sismique UBC 97)
Le plan du cours comprendra plusieurs parties :
Partie 1: Guide pratique
Cette partie sera divisée comme suit :
1- Introduction des modules
2- Explication de la barre de menu
3- Matériaux
4- Preferences de la tache
5- Noeuds
6- Definition des barres
7- Translation
8- Poutres
9- Etages
10- Angle gamma
11- Caractéristiques
12- Manipulation de la vue de notre modèle
13- Modélisation des panneaux et vues isolées
14- Dalle orthotrope
15- Modélisation d’un radier
16- Orientation du ferraillage de la dalle
17- Critère ELS dans le ferraillage de la dalle
18- Coefficient de fluage
19- Options de ferraillage des dalles
20- Modélisation des murs et refends
21- Visualisation du modèle 3D
22- Supprimer les poteaux et poutres des refends
23- Modelisation des ouvertures
24- Changement des propriétés des panneaux
25- Selection professionnelle
26- Appuis
27- Application des charges
28- Application des charges surfaciques
29- Charge linéaire sur panneau
30- Charges de vent
31- Calcul manuel des charges de vent
32- Application manuelle des charges de vent sur robot
33- Introduction à l’analyse modale
Et bien d’autres sous-chapitres que vous pouvez consultez à travers les vidéos offertes dans ce cours
Partie 2 : Modélisation et dimensionnement d’une structure en béton selon le code Americain ACI (et UBC 97 pour l’étude sismique)
Partie 3 : Modélisation et dimensionnement d’une structure en acier selon les Eurocodes
Les parties du cours seront accompagnées de ressources et exercices, qui vous seront très utiles pour vos applications.
target_audience: Ingénieurs
Etudiants

courses.title: LabVIEW Beginners Guide
courses.bio: A-Z Guide that takes you from ZERO to HERO in LabVIEW and helps you start using LabVIEW efficiently.
requirements: A computer or laptop - With Window 7 or later, > 2Gb of RAM (4Gb Reccomended) , 1.5Ghz Processor or higher (Multicore Core 2Ghz processor Recommended).
LabVIEW Software in trial version or you can purchase a license
Internet connection to download LabVIEW
courses.description:
Learn the basic concepts, tools, and functions that you will need to build fully functional control apps with LabVIEW.
If you're looking to get started with LabVIEW, this beginner's guide course is the perfect place to start. You'll learn the basics of how to use LabVIEW to create virtual instruments and measure or control real-world phenomena. The course is designed for anyone with little to no prior experience with LabVIEW, so you can go at your own pace. By the end of the course, you'll be able to build your own custom applications.
LabVIEW is a graphical programming language that uses icons instead of lines of text to create applications. It is easy to learn for beginners and can be used to solve problems in a wide variety of fields. This guide will teach you the basics of LabVIEW so that you can get started programming right away.
Why You Should Take This Course:
A-Z Guide that takes you from ZERO to HERO in LabVIEW.
Helps you start using LabVIEW efficiently.
Takes you through the basics of LabVIEW step by step.
Teaches you how to use all 16 unique graphical programming blocks found in LabVIEW.
Gives easy-to-understand explanations for each block.
Provides all the information without overwhelming you with technical terms.
Course Benefits:
Unlock the Power of LabVIEW: When you're first starting out with LabVIEW, it can be difficult to know where to begin. With this guide, you'll quickly learn the ins and outs of the world's most popular data acquisition and analysis software. You'll discover common data types, powerful tools, and key features that will make your work easier and more efficient.
LabVIEW for Beginners: Everything You Need to Know: As a beginner, it is natural to have questions about what LabVIEW is, what the common data types are, and what some of the key features are. This guide will answer all those questions and more, making it the perfect resource for anyone just starting out with this powerful software.
Welcome to This Course:
Together we will build a strong foundation in LabVIEW fundamentals and start your journey towards greatness in the control industry.
Course Outline:
LabVIEW Download and Installation
Basic Features
Examples and Exercises
Advanced Features and Techniques
A Powerful Skill at Your Fingertips:
Learning the fundamentals of LabVIEW puts a powerful and very useful tool at your fingertips. It is easy to learn, has excellent documentation, and is the base for all modern control applications.
Jobs related to LabVIEW application development are plentiful, and being able to learn LabVIEW will give you a strong background to easily pick up other control software and hardware.
Complete with working files, datasets, and code samples, you will receive a verifiable certificate of completion upon finishing the course. We also offer a full Udemy 30-Day Money Back Guarantee if you are not happy with this course, so you can learn with no risk to you.
Continues Updates
More Than 1300 STUDENTS!!! THANK YOU!!!
What Students Are Saying:
Chris Hayden says, "Informative. Good graphical explanations help to show examples."
Yves Lebrun says, "Thanks a lot for sharing this information with us. I learned a lot from this course. Thank you so much."

Woo-Young Yoon says, "Wonderful teaching."
See You on This Course. ENROLL NOW!
What You Will Learn:
Basic concepts of LabVIEW.
How to use LabVIEW to create virtual instruments.
Measuring and controlling real-world phenomena.
Step-by-step instructions for building custom applications.
Understanding and using graphical programming blocks in LabVIEW.
Who Is This Course For:
Beginners with little to no prior experience with LabVIEW.
Individuals interested in data acquisition and analysis.
Hobbyists and enthusiasts looking to expand their knowledge.
Requirements:
Basic computer skills.
No prior knowledge of LabVIEW required.


About the Instructor Info
Educational Engineering Team
Team of skilled Engineers Sharing Knowledge with the World
Educational Engineering Team is a Leading Team in the Microcontroller Industry, with over 13 Years of Experience in Teaching and Doing Practical Projects.
We strive to put all our hands-on experience in these courses. Instead of superficial knowledge, we go into the depth of the topic and give you the exact, step-by-step blueprint on how to tackle simple as well as complex topics in easy and digestible bite-sized videos.
This real-world knowledge enables you to grasp knowledge easily, and you can apply this learning immediately to your life and projects.
Educational Engineering Team has been in the Programming and Microcontroller business since 2007. We have been part of many projects. Over the course of these years, we have gained a good insight into students’ and educators’ needs. We are passionate about sharing all our collective knowledge with you. As of 2018, we have already taught over 250k-THOUSAND students and counting.
Currently, we have more than 100+ Courses on Udemy.
Educator and Author of “Educational Engineering”
Ashraf is an educator, Mechatronics engineer, electronics and programming hobbyist, and Maker. He creates online video courses on the EduEng YouTube Channel (More Than 4 Million Views, 20k + Subscribers) and author of four Microcontroller books.
As a Chief Educational Engineer since 2007 at Educational Engineering Team, the company he founded, Ashraf’s mission is to explore new trends and technology and help educate the world and make it a better place.
Educational Engineering offers educational courses and Bootcamps, articles, lessons, and online support for electronics hobbyists, Programming hobbyists, Microcontroller hobbyists, STEM students, and STEM teachers.
The team also works as freelance engineers, helping many students in their graduation projects, and providing guidance and consulting for many students over the years to help them kick-start their careers.
Ashraf’s core skill is explaining difficult concepts in a step-by-step easy-to-understand manner using video and text. With over 11 years of tertiary teaching experience, Ashraf has developed a simple yet comprehensive and informative style in teaching that students from all around the world appreciate.
His passion for Microcontrollers and Programming, particularly for the world of Arduino, PIC Microcontroller, Raspberry Pi, has guided his personal development and his work through Educational Engineering.
Ashraf’s online courses have helped over 250,000 people from around the world to be better and to make a great career in the industry.
Educational Engineering Team offers Courses on:
Circuit Design, Simulation, and PCB Fabrication
Arduino, PIC Microcontroller, and Raspberry Pi
Programming in C, Python, and other programming languages
PLC Industrial Programming and Automation
3D Design and Simulation
ESP and IoT World

requirements: Öğrenme Arzusu
Herhangi bir yazılım bilgisine gerek yoktur
Çalışan bir bilgisayarınızın olması yeterlidir
İsteğe bağlı olarak Arduino kartına ve gerekli komponentlere ihtiyaç vardır.
courses.description:
Herkese Merhaba


Arduino kursumuza hoş geldiniz. Kursumuz başlangıç seviyesi ile başlayarak ileri seviye projelere kadar devam edecek.İlk olarak bilgisayar ortamımızı Arduino yazılım geliştirmek için hazır hale getireceğiz.
Arduino ile uygulamalar geliştirebilmek için temel yazılım bilgisine sahip olmanız gerekiyor. Bilgisayarımız hazır hale geldikten sonra sıfırdan gerekli yazılım bilgisi anlatılacak daha sonra Arduino ile uygulamalar geliştirmeye başlacağız.
Arduino ile uygulama geliştirmek için sadece bilgisayar yeterli olmayacak Arduino kartı ile birlikte sensörler ve gerekli component'lere ihtiyacımız olacak. Ama siz şu an için almak istemiyorsanız elinizde herhangi bir kart veya component olmadanda kursu izleyerek Arduino eğitimini tamamlayabilirsiniz. Benim tavsiyem bu kursun amacı sonuç olarak robotik uygulamalar geliştirmek olacağı için kursla birlikte gerekli component'leri temin ederek kurs eşliğinde uygulamalarınızı deneyip kendiniz bizzat yapmanızı tavsiye ederim.
Arduino eğitimi içerisinde projeler anlatılırken projenin kodlarını video içerisinde görebilirsiniz ayrıca Github üzerinden de projenin kodların erişebileceksiniz. Devre şemasının gösteriminde daha iyi anlaşılması için uygulama üzerinde sanal ortamda devre şemamızı çizeceğiz ayrıca devre şemasının kurulumunun kamera kaydını da videoların sonunda izleyebileceksiniz. Böylece oluşabilecek herhangi bir anlaşılmazlığı ortadan kaldırmaya yönelik olarak çeşitli imkanlarınız bulunacak.
-- Güncelleme--
Kursun son güncellenme tarihi 2018 olarak kurs önizlemesinde gözükmektedir. Kurs içeriğinde sürekli güncelleneceğine dair bilgilendirme yapmıştım ancak son güncelleme tarihi 2018 olarak sonlandırılmıştır. Artık kursumuz sürekli güncellenen bir kurs değildir. Lütfen kursu alırken buna dikkat ederek alınız. Ayrıca soru cevap bölümü eğitmen tarafından cevaplanamamaktadır. Bu güncelleme yazısı sonradan eklenmiştir.
target_audience: Arduino'da  uygulama geliştirmek isteyen herkes

courses.title: Introduction to PCIe SR-IOV protocol
courses.bio: Complete Guide to PCIe SR-IOV protocol
objectives: This course covers complete PCIe SR-IOV protocol in detail.
This course covers practical aspects of PCIe SR-IOV protocol.
This course will cover practical application of PCIe SR-IOV protocol.
This course will cover reason behind SR-IOV is used in servers.

Introduction to PCIe SR-IOV(Single Root: PCIe SR-IOV Initialization and Resource Allocation

requirements: Student must be aware of PCIe Gen1 to Gen4 basic protocol. This course will not cover PCIe basics.
courses.description:
PCIe SR-IOV (Single Root I/O Virtualization) is a technology that allows a single physical PCI Express (PCIe) hardware device, such as a network interface card (NIC), to be shared efficiently among multiple virtual machines (VMs). It improves performance and reduces CPU overhead by enabling direct data transfer between the hardware and the VM's memory, bypassing the hypervisor layer.


Key points about PCIe SR-IOV:
Virtual Functions (VFs): These are lightweight, hardware-assigned instances of the physical device that can be dedicated to individual VMs.
Physical Function (PF): The full-featured primary function that manages the VFs and handles configuration.
Benefits: Increased I/O performance, lower latency, and better resource utilization in virtualized environments.
Use Cases: High-performance computing, data centers, and cloud infrastructure where efficient network or storage access is critical.

PCIe SR-IOV (Single Root I/O Virtualization) has a wide range of applications, especially in environments requiring high-performance I/O and efficient resource sharing. Here are some common applications:


Network Virtualization:
Enables multiple virtual machines to share a single high-speed network interface card (NIC) while maintaining near-native performance.
Used in data centers and cloud service providers for scalable, secure, and high-speed network connectivity.


Storage Virtualization:
Facilitates sharing of high-performance storage controllers and RDMA (Remote Direct Memory Access) interfaces among multiple VMs.
Supports low-latency, high-throughput storage solutions.


High-Performance Computing (HPC):
Provides VMs or containers with direct access to high-speed interconnects (e.g., InfiniBand, Ethernet) used in scientific computing and simulations.


Telecommunications and 5G Infrastructure:
Used in virtualized network functions (VNFs) where high-throughput, low-latency network processing is critical.


Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI):
Improves graphics and data throughput for virtual desktops by providing direct access to GPU resources when combined with GPU virtualization.


Cloud Computing and Private Clouds:
Enhances multi-tenant environments with dedicated and predictable network/storage performance, facilitating workload isolation and security.


Edge Computing:
Supports low-latency, high-performance data processing at the network edge by sharing high-speed interfaces efficiently.
target_audience: This course is for all the professionals and students who wants work on PCIe server and desktop platforms.

courses.title: Robótica com Arduino: o seguidor de linha
courses.bio: Aprenda a montar e programar um robô seguidor de linha com arduino
objectives: Com este curso você aprenderá a montar e programar um lindo robô com a função de seguidor de linha

O Projeto: O Projeto do Robô Seguidor de Linha

requirements: Conhecimentos básicos em Informática
Conhecimento em Algoritmos
Conhecimento em Arduino
courses.description:
Sinceramente, este curso não é apenas um curso. Faremos uma viagem ao mundo da robótica educacional e juntos vamos mergulhar no campo da ciência e será uma viagem inesquecível.
Olá, meu nome é Marcos Tulio, seu professor, seu Coach.
Neste curso, de forma ativa você superará desafios e aprenderá novas habilidades. Este curso é diferente de todos os outros por várias razões: Você já deve ter imaginado que este treinamento é básico e que eu te ajudarei no passo-a-passo para você montar e programar o seu próprio robô do zero.
Usaremos a dinâmica de aprendizagem baseada em competência: isso lhe fará colocar a mão na massa e trabalhar junto comigo desenvolvendo o projeto do robô.
Eu te ensinarei através de um contexto claro e direto, para você ser capaz de alcançar seu objetivo. O curso possui diversas tarefas e exercícios que o farão se aprofundar no assunto.
Na primeira aula discutiremos sobre o uso dos microcontroladores.
Na segunda aula veremos sobre o Arduino e sua família.
Na terceira aula aprenderemos sobre a IDE do Arduino.
Na quarta aula faremos um breve histórico sobre a robótica.
Na quinta aula mostraremos os dispositivos que usaremos em nosso curso.
Na sexta aula discutiremos sobre o projeto em si.
Na sétima aula mostremos o kit que usaremos no curso.
Na oitava aula veremos todos os componentes eletrônicos do kit.
Na nona aula veremos como ligar tudo.
Na décima aula discutiremos o micro servo motor SG90.
Na décima primeira aula discutiremos sobre o uso do servo motor.
Na décima segunda aula discutiremos sobre o sensor ultrassônico.
Na décima terceira aula discutiremos sobre o uso do sensor óptico reflexivo.
Na décima quinta veremos a lógica de programação usada no robô.
Na décima sexta aula veremos o código base para você evoluir em cima.
Na décima sétima aula eu mostro todo o código usado no robô, unindo todos os componentes num só código.
Na décima oitava aula demonstro o código sendo executado no robô.
Na última aula mostro minhas referências bibliográficas feitas para a construção do curso.

Junte-se a nossa turma, e clique no link de inscrição do curso.
Estou ansioso para te ver lá dentro da plataforma.
Até lá!
target_audience: Qualquer pessoa que tenha Interesse em novas tecnologias e processos eletrônicos e automáticos. Mergulhe conosco no conceito do FAÇA VOCÊ MESMO (DIY)

objectives: Curso de Eletrônica Períodos 1,2, e 3
requirements: Saber ler e Escrever
courses.description:
Costumo afirmar por convicção de certeza, que o aprender vem de aplicar na prática toda teoria, que só se aprende de verdade vendo, realizando, fazendo, vendo funcionar, não acredito no saber de prancheta, de livro, de apostila, todo conhecimento deve sair destes itens descritos para bancada, para mesa, sair do mundo da imaginação para o mundo da realização. Este curso oferece os conceitos essenciais para a reparação e manutenção de equipamentos eletrônicos, com ênfase na área de Tecnologia da Informação (T.I). Embora seja acessível a todos, aqueles que atuam na área de T.I. encontrarão aqui uma base sólida de conhecimento.
Este curso abrange todos os conceitos fundamentais de hardware, independentemente da sua área de atuação dentro da T.I. Ele atualizará seu conhecimento, trazendo melhorias significativas em sua vida pessoal e profissional. Irá expandir sua visão sobre como as coisas funcionam ao seu redor.
Lembre-se de que uma longa jornada começa com o primeiro passo, e este é o seu primeiro passo no fascinante mundo da tecnologia elétrica. Com uma base sólida, você compreenderá como tudo funciona de forma prática e envolvente, proporcionando uma nova perspectiva do mundo ao seu redor.
Este curso irá desvendar os princípios fundamentais da eletrônica com um método de ensino que já alcançou mais de 15 milhões de visualizações no YouTube e conta com mais de 100.000 seguidores. Venha aprender os conceitos essenciais da ELETRÔNICA.
Espero que esta versão simplificada do texto atenda às suas necessidades. Se você tiver outras solicitações ou precisar de mais ajuda em suas dúvidas, fique à vontade para perguntar - whatsApp 22 - 98 160 4291 Professor Marcelo Moraes

courses.title: ラズベリーパイ（Raspberry Pi）とPythonでIoTはじめの一歩～IoTキッチンガーデン講座～
courses.bio: IoTにより、どの位のコストで、何ができそうかを体感するための講座です。ラズパイ、Python、Google Cloudを用い、CO2、温湿度、照度、水深の測定、Google Sheetsへのデータ保存、自動水やり機能を実装します
objectives: RaspberryPi（ラズベリーパイ、ラズパイ）のセットアップ方法

Pythonを用いた各種センサー（CO2、温度、湿度、照度、距離（＝水深））のデータ計測方法
Google Cloudを活用し、各種センサーで計測したデータをGoogle Sheetsに自動で貯める方法
計測したデータ(水深)に応じ、外部機器の電源(水やりのための給水のポンプ)をon/offする方法
上記を実現するPythonプログラムの概要（なぜその様に動くか、全てのコードの概要を解説しています）

はじめに: 講座のご紹介
おまけ) 講師自己紹介

Pythonを活用して、センサーやリレーモジュールを便利に操作しよう

キッチンガーデンを作って、野菜を育ててみよう: キッチンガーデンがどんなものか理解しよう
必要な道具を知り、組み立ててみよう
キッチンガーデンを運用してみよう
自動で水やりしてみよう: 自動水やり、環境測定装置をキッチンガーデンに取り付けよう
センサーでデータを取りつつ、自動で水やりしてみよう
CO2濃度も計測してみよう: CO2センサーを取り付けてみよう

おわりに: 学習の振り返りと終わりのご挨拶

requirements: Raspberry Piやプログラミングの経験は不要です。初心者の方を想定し、講座を設計しています
講座中ではRaspberry Pi 4Bを使用して説明していますが、Raspberry Pi 5、3B、3B+でも動作確認済です（4Bと操作が異なる点に関しても、講座中で随時解説しています）
courses.description:
講座概要
本講座は、RaspberryPi（ラズベリーパイ、ラズパイ）、Python、Google Cloudを用い、センサー（温湿度、照度、距離、CO2）の測定値を、クラウド（Google Sheets）に無料で蓄積する方法、また、台所でハーブ類や香味野菜を育てるIoT機能付きの水耕栽培装置(IoTキッチンガーデン)の組み立て・運用方法について解説します。
3つの特徴
簡易なIoTシステムの作り方が分かる
簡易なIoTが「どのような仕組みで動いているか」、「何ができそうか」、「（プロトタイプを作る際、）どれ位のコスト・手間でできそうか」を体感して頂けるよう設計しています


ラズベリーパイのイロハが分かる
ラズベリーパイ初心者の方を想定し、ラズパイのイロハ（起動し、遠隔操作し、センサーやリレーモジュールを接続し、動かす）を躓かず学習できるよう、丁寧に解説しています


「なぜその様に動いているか」分かるよう、プログラムの概要を解説
プログラミング初めての方が、「なぜその様に動いているか」がざっくりと分かるよう、全てのプログラムの概要を簡単に解説しています。（注：初心者の方が理解出来るようにするため、極力平易な言葉を使うようにしています。例えば、モジュール、メソッドという言葉は敢えて使用していません。）
ご自身の生活やビジネスにおいて、「IoTって実は難しくない」、「工夫次第で、様々に活用できそう」と実感してもらえると嬉しいです。また、IoTやラズベリーパイ、DX（デジタルトランスフォーメーション）に関する学びを深めて頂ければ幸いです。では、講座でお待ちしております！
留意点
お子さんと一緒に取り組まれる場合、ハンダ付けや他電子工作・電子回路構築で危険な作業があります。必ず、保護者の方の監視の下、安全に配慮し実施してください
講座は、安価で入手しやすいRaspberry Pi 4Bを前提に進めていますが、Raspberry Pi 5、3B+、3Bでも動作確認済です。Raspberry Pi 5は、4Bと操作が異なる点がありますが、講座中で随時解説しています
Raspberry Pi Zeroでもセンサー、プログラムは動きますが、Webブラウジング程度の操作でフリーズするため、慣れていない方にはオススメしておりません。Raspberry Pi Picoに関しては、根本的に設計が異なり、本講座で使うことはできません
講座中では、CO2センサーとして、CO2-MINIを用いております。2020年8月頃にCO2-MINIの仕様が変更となり、それ以前にご購入されたCO2-MINI(旧版と呼称。データが暗号化されています)に関しては、講座中のプログラムでは上手く読み取れません。旧版をご活用になりたい場合、旧版に対応したプログラム（暗号の復号機能あり）をお送り致しますので、メッセージやQ&A機能で講師までご連絡ください
直近の主な更新履歴
2024/11　Raspberry Pi 5に対応
2023/2　「なぜその様に動いているか」が分かるよう、全プログラムの概要解説を追加
2022/12　ご要望を受け「必要な道具」の一覧を作成。当該レクチャーにリンク追加
target_audience: IoTシステム構築を通じ、IoTに関する理解を深めたい、新規事業担当者やエンジニアの方
IoT構築におけるコーディング・プログラミング事例について学びたいエンジニアの方
Raspberry Pi（及び、そのIoT活用事例）について学習したい方
採れたてのハーブや野菜を料理に活用したい方（さらにIoTを用い、生産手法の改善を図りたい方）
IoTを用いたDX化の参考事例について学びたい事業担当者の方
各種環境データを計測するIoTシステムを格安で導入してみたい生産者さん

courses.description: Bu kursta günümüz teknolojisinin temel unsuru haline gelen dijital elektronik'e giriş konuları işlenmiştir. Bilgisayarların, cep telefonlarının,  tabletlerin ve diğer elektronik cihaz ve aletlerin nasıl çalıştığını merak ediyorsanız bu kurs tam size göre. Kendi dijital saatinizi yapmak istiyorsunuz ama nereden başlayacağınızı bilmiyorsunuz. İşte bu kurs size kendi dijital saatinizi ya da benzer dijital devreleri yapmanız için gereken temel bilgileri verecek. Programlama ile mi ilgileniyorsunuz? O zaman temel düzeyde dijital elektronik bilmek yararınıza olacaktır.  Arduino, Raspberry Pi gibi mikrodenetleyici tabanlı kartlarla ilgileniyorsanız en azından başlangıç seviyesinde dijital elektronik bilmeniz bir gerekliliktir. İşte bu kurs size temel düzeyde dijital elektronik konularını açıklamak için hazırlandı.

Entry Level L1, Desktop Support, Service Engineer, Customer Support Engineer, FM Engineer, Hardware Engineer and IT Support Specialist வேலை வாய்ப்பு பெறுவதற்கு இந்த பாடநெறி வடிவமைக்கப்பட்டுள்ளது.
மாணவர்கள்  Desktop and Laptop கம்ப்யூட்டர் ஹார்ட்வேர் டெக்னாலஜி போன்ற Motherboard, Hard Disk, Memory Processors, Assembling, Computer Peripherals Like Printers & Scanners போன்ற கணினி உபகரணங்கள் பற்றி அறிந்து கொள்வார்கள்.
Windows 10 Operating System பற்றிய முழுமையான சிறப்பு அம்சங்களை புரிந்து கொள்வதற்கு உதவுகிறது.
அனைத்து வகையான Hardware மற்றும் OS தொடர்பான பிரச்சனைகளை சரிசெய்தல்.
கூடுதலாக, இந்த பாடநெறி வேலை வாய்ப்பு பெறுவதற்கு உதவும் வகையில் வடிவமைக்கப்பட்டுள்ளது.
வீடு / தனிப்பட்ட பயனாளிகள்  தங்கள் டெஸ்க்டாப் / லேப்டாப்பில் ஏற்படும் சிக்கல்களின் மூல காரணத்தை அடையாளம் கண்டுகொண்டு வேறு எந்த நபரின் உதவியும் இல்லாமல் அவர்கள் சொந்தமாக சரிசெய்யலாம்.
இந்த பாடத்திட்டத்தின் மூலம், மாணவர்கள் CompTIA A + சான்றிதழ் போன்ற சர்வதேச சான்றிதழ்களைப்  பெறும்  அறிவை அடைகின்றனர். CompTIA A + கோர் சான்றிதழ் பெற  மாணவர்கள் இரண்டு தேர்வுகளில் தேர்ச்சி பெற வேண்டும்: கோர் 1 (220-1001) மற்றும் கோர் 2 (220-1002).

courses.title: Laptop Motherboard Voltages: From Input to CPU Final Stage
courses.bio: Master laptop repair by learning every voltage rail step by step: charging, B+, 3V/5V, BIOS, RAM, PCH, CPU, and more.
requirements: No prior electronics repair experience is required. Everything will be explained step by step.
A basic digital multimeter is recommended to follow along with practical demonstrations.
Interest in laptop repair, electronics, or troubleshooting is helpful but not mandatory.
courses.description:
Do you want to fully understand how laptop motherboards work and master the voltages that power every circuit, from the DC jack to the CPU?
This course will give you a complete step-by-step guide to all motherboard voltage rails, helping you analyze, troubleshoot, and repair laptops like a professional.
What You’ll Learn
Understand all motherboard voltages from the input to the CPU.
Learn 19V main power rail analysis and flow.
Study 3V/5V system voltages and their role in powering devices.
Analyze RAM, CPU, VCCP, VCC_Core, VTT, and GPU voltages.
Discover how to use test points to measure and verify signals.
Master voltage protection circuits and common failures.
Learn how to trace signals step by step through schematics.
Troubleshoot voltage drops, shorts, and missing rails.
Why Choose This Course?
Covers every laptop voltage rail in detail, no missing pieces.
Designed by a computer engineer with repair experience.
One-on-one support, your questions get answered quickly.
Clear explanations with real examples and diagrams.
Short and easy-to-follow lessons.
Constant updates with new repair tips.
Certificate of completion included.
Transforms you from beginner to confident repair technician.
Who Is This Course For?
Beginners who want to learn how voltages power a motherboard.
Laptop technicians who want to upgrade their troubleshooting skills.
Electronics students who need a clear and practical guide to voltage rails.
Anyone curious about how CPU, PCH, RAM, BIOS, 3V/5V, and system power circuits work.
By the end of this course, you’ll know every voltage rail inside a laptop motherboard, how to test them, and how to troubleshoot failures like a professional.
Enroll now and start your journey to mastering laptop motherboard voltages.
target_audience: Engineers, technicians, and students curious about laptop motherboard repair.
Beginners who want to build a solid foundation in laptop repair and diagnostics.
Repair professionals who want to strengthen their knowledge of laptop voltages and troubleshooting.
Anyone who wants to learn how to fix laptops with “no power,” “no display,” or charging failures.

objectives: Conhecer os diversos aspectos relacionados à Plataforma Arduino
Saber como interligar outros componentes com Arduino
Conhecer componentes como: botões, resistor, transistor, LED etc.
Saber utilizar uma protoboard
Aprender programação para a Plataforma Arduino
Conhecer e utilizar bibliotecas
Conhecer e controlar motor dc e servo motor
Realizar conversões Analógico-Digital
Utilizar Display LCD e 7 Segmentos
requirements: Saber usar um computador
Acesso à internet
courses.description:
Programação, Display de 7 segmentos, Display LCD, PWM, Conversão Analógico Digital, Motores e mais!
Conceitos básicos de eletrônica, introdução à programação e a união dessas duas áreas em 12 módulos com mais de 11 horas de aulas com explicações e exemplos para você aprender ao máximo!
# Faça como mais de 16000 alunos inscritos em nossos cursos e venha aprender conosco!
DIFERENCIAIS DO INSTRUTOR
Professor com experiêcia. Já lecionei em Universidades e Faculdades em cursos de graduação e pós-graduação onde orientei vários Trabalhos de Conclusão de Curso usando microcontroladores, Arduino e programação.
Formação sólida. Mestre em Engenharia de Sistemas, Pós-Graduado em Cloud Computing e Graduado em Engenharia da Computação.
Profissional de Tecnologia. Mais de 20 anos atuando na área de tecnologia além da docêcia, com mais de 20 anos em desenvolvimento de software, gestão de equipes e sócio-fundador de startup.


# VEJA O QUE OS ALUNOS ESTÃO COMENTANDO


"Muito bom o curso! Super didático e com bastante exemplos. Parabéns!", Otávio S.


"O curso é excelente! O professor tem boa didática e não é necessário ter conhecimentos de eletrônica, ou mesmo possuir um Arduino para acompanhar.", Douglas G.


"Até o momento está sendo tudo que eu esperava... Numa linguagem simples... showww.", Jander Ribeiro.


"O curso parte de fundamentos básicos, porém sólidos para desenvolver um aprendizado focado na engenharia.", Helio Miloski J.


"Mais um curso que atende ou supera as expectativas.", Eduardo Henrique.


"muito obrigado esse curso foi muito bom para mim estava com bastante duvida da faculdade.", Adilson Carlos Viana Carlos.


"Aulas bem intuitivas e de fácil entendimento. Parabéns.", Carlos Mário André.


"Excelente curso! Didático, objetivo, repleto de informações relevantes que respeitam o nível introdutório ao tema.", Miguel Henrique Lima P.


A engenharia faz parte da nossa vida cotidiana em diversos aspectos. A plataforma microcontrolada Arduino abriu as portas do vasto mundo da engenharia eletrônica e computação para o público em geral, proporcionando uma forma prática de criar nossas próprias soluções e implementar nossas ideias. Ela é utilizada em projetos como
automação residencial, predial ou industrial;
impressoras 3D;
robótica educacional;
arte eletrônica;
brinquedos etc.
Estudantes, profissionais e hobbistas de áreas como arte, educação e engenharia estão utilizando a plataforma Arduino cada vez mais para por em prática suas ideias.
Neste curso vamos ver o que é e como funciona a plataforma Arduino. Serão apresentados diversos exemplos cobrindo conteúdos essenciais para a criação de vários outros projetos. Os conhecimentos necessários para curso, como a base para programação e eletrônica, serão apresentados durante as aulas.
No curso serão apresentados os conceitos básicos utilizando o Tinkercad, uma ferramenta de simulação online. Então você não precisa se preocupar em comprar materiais para inciar o curso, mas se preferir você pode sim montar os exemplos!


CURSO ATUALIZADO (23/07/2024)
Nova seção com Tira Dúvida com o objetivo de apresentar explicações e resolução de dúvidas enviadas pelos alunos.
Inicialmente contando com novos 4 vídeos que somam quase 1 hora, são eles:
1. Potenciômetro pode gerar curto no Arduino?
2. Alimentação Externa no Arduino
3. Funcionamento do bit a bit e alternativas para HIGH e LOW
4. Controlando Tempos Diferentes com millis()


CURSO ATUALIZADO (16/07/2020)
Novas 5 aulas adicionadas somando mais de 60 minutos de aula acrescentados.
Na Seção 12, Shields, com as aulas:
Conhecendo a Shield Ponte-H L293D
Controlando um Motor DC
Controlando Plataforma Móvel - Parte 1
Controlando Plataforma Móvel - Parte 2
Controlando Plataforma Móvel - Parte 3


CURSO ATUALIZADO (31/08/2019)
Novas aulas adicionadas em duas seções somando mais de 70 minutos de aula acrescentados.
Seção 11, Além do Simulador, com as aulas:
O que é preciso para ir além do Simulador?
Como instalar a IDE do Arduino.
Conhecendo a IDE do Arduino.
Enviando o programa para a Placa.
Seção 12, Shields, com as aulas:
O que são Shields?
Conhecento a Shield Multifunção.
Controlando LEDs da Shield Multifunção.
Alerta Sonoro com a Shield Multifunção.
Usando o Display com a Bilbioteca da Shield Multifunção.


Está em dúvida? Experimente! O curso inclui
Garantia de devolução do dinheiro em 30 dias;
10 horas de vídeo sob demanda ;
Acesso total vitalício;
Acesso no dispositivo móvel e na TV/Chromecast;
Certificado de Conclusão.


O curso está dividido em 12 seções descritas a seguir:


Apresentação. É uma seção curta onde o instrutor é apresentado e fala sobre o curso de forma geral. Também é feita a apresentação do simulador online e é mostrado onde você pode comprar materiais.


Componentes Básicos. Neste seção vamos falar sobre alguns componentes essenciais, como LED, Resistor, Diodo e Transistor. Veremos como eles funcionam de forma prática sem se aprofundar em teorias complexas.


Introdução à Programação com Arduino. Não se sente seguro para programar? Não tem problema. Nesta seção vamos abordar as principais estruturas da linguagem utilizada pelo Arduino.

Conhecendo o Arduino. Ao chegar nesta seção você já terá visto os conceitos iniciais da programação e então vamos aplicar estes conceitos para manipular alguns LEDs.

Botões e Chaves com Arduino. Dando um passo a frente vamos compreender como utilizar botões de pressão e chaves liga-desliga com o Arduino.

Display de 7 Segmentos. Amplamente utilizados, os Display de 7 Segmentos permitem mostrar informações aos usuários e eles serão abordados de várias formas para que você fixe e use-o da melhor forma.

Display LCD. O uso de Displays LCD não poderia ficar de forma. Vamos ver como fazer a montagem corretamente e apresentar informações importantes neste tipo de Display.


Conversão Analógico-Digital. "O Mundo Real é Analógico!". Sim, e é por isso que esta seção traz um conteúdo valioso para que você possa conectar seu Arduino com a realidade.

Usando Motores. O uso de atuadores são sempre requeridos em projetos de automação, plataformas móveis, robôs etc. Vamos tratar nesta seção de como utilizar os motores dc e de passo... Ah, não sabe o que são? Depois desta seção isso não será problema!


Modulação por Largura de Pulso ( PWM ). Para proporcionar um controle mais afinado esta seção mostra como controlar a intensidade de LEDs e a velocidade de Motores utilizando PWM no Arduino.

Além do Simulador. Com as aulas sobre o que é preciso para ir além do Simulador como a instalação da IDE do Arduino e gravação do programa na placa.

Shields. Com aulas práticas, inicia mostrando o que é uma shield e o uso da Shields Multifunção na prática.
Crie, inove, projete. Coloque suas ideias em prática com o curso Introdução à Engenharia com Arduino.

courses.title: The Architecture of The First Computer: IBM PC 5150
courses.bio: Learn the architecture of computers by creating the first computer ever, made in 1981 (IBM PC 5150)
objectives: Architecture of the first computer ever made
Computer design
Hardware design
Cpu design
Refresh memory
8259 interrupt controller
Bios
8237 dma controller
8253 timer chip
8255 peripheral chip
Timing in computers

Architecture of ibm pc 5150: Types of buses in IBM PC 5150
8088 maximum mode operation in the IBM PC 5150-part1(nano-second Analysis)
8088 maximum mode operation in the IBM PC 5150-part2
Architectures of the DRAMs on the Motherboard
Refresh memory of DRAMs in the lowest level
READING/WRITING to/from RAMs at nanonseconds level-part1
READING/WRITING to/from RAMs-part2-RAS and CAS signals
Reading from ROMs in IBM PC 5150(rom mapping in the address space)
Reading from ROMs in IBM PC 5150-part2-and some BIOS code
Parity check implementation in ibm pc 5150-part1-the 9th ram!
Parity check implementation in ibm pc 5150-part2-parity clock and NMI
Masking the non-maskable interrupt(NMI)!! in IBM PC 5150

requirements: Topics like registers, address bus, data bus. In general students should know concepts like memory and processor, even though we try to explain everything, but since this is an advanced course, having some knowledge about computers would help.
courses.description:
IBM PC 5150 is arguably the first personal computer and was made in 1981, from then on almost any computer that you see is an improvement of that first computer.


But there has never been any course or book analyzing maybe the most important computer of all time, there has been a lot of courses talking about "how to create a computer", which I, myself, have created a course called "creating a cpu using transistors and logic gates", in which we created a computer from scratch. The reason for this, is because IBM PC 5150 (or any other REAL-WORLD computers- meaning computers that have been created by companies and have been sold in the world- is much more complicated than a computer that you could create on your own, in your garage or using software.


When we look at the motherboard of IBM PC 5150 we see so many chips that feels so complicated, and the reality of it, is that it is really complicated, in fact if it was easy everyone would have known that. What we have done in this course, is that we completely drawn all the motherboard wire by wire and bit by bit, every 0 or 1 on that motherboard has a reason and we leave nothing to chance. We take nothing for granted. But the question is:


why should we take this course?


By understanding the architecture of IBM PC 5150, we will be able to understand the BIOS code written in one of the ROMs on the motherboard, this BIOS is somehow the first operating system, the first program. Then we will rise through a path which would lead us to understanding the following in the most intuitive way which is by studying the source code:


BIOS


DOS operating system


Assembler


Compiler


80286 and 80386 processors


Understanding the first linux by reading its source code


Remember the best way to undestand anything is to study the source code, and to understand the soure code we need to learn the underlying hardware down to the most detailed and lowest level possible and thats what we have done in this course.
target_audience: Computer designer
Programmer wanting to understand programming more deeply

courses.title: Deep Dive into Microcontroller Design and Architecture
courses.bio: Master internal MCU design, from pipelines to peripherals, and build a strong foundation in embedded system hardware.

Foundations of Microcontroller Operation: System Clocks and Resets: Architecture-Level Insight
Memory and Data Flow Management: Understanding Memory Hierarchy: How Memory Is Organized
Managing Access: Bus Protocols & Arbitration in Embedded Systems
Smart Peripheral Systems and Power Manag: Peripheral Subsystem Theory: What They Are and How They Work
Low-Power Design Techniques: How Microcontrollers Save Energy
What’s Next in Microcontroller Innovatio: Future Directions in MCU Design & Capabilities

requirements: A basic understanding of electronics and microcontroller use
Familiarity with terms like memory, CPU, and peripherals is helpful
No hardware or software tools required—this is a theory/deep-architecture-focused course
Suitable even if you haven’t worked with MCUs deeply before
courses.description:
Take your embedded systems expertise to the next level by understanding the inner workings of microcontrollers. This course goes beyond basic usage—you’ll explore how microcontrollers are designed, how they manage data, interface with peripherals, and optimize power. Whether you’re an embedded systems student, hardware enthusiast, or junior engineer, this deep dive will help you analyze, design, and optimize microcontroller-based systems confidently.
You’ll learn how microcontrollers execute instructions through pipelining, how they control timing, structure memory, and manage bus traffic, and how they integrate peripherals and save power through modern low-power techniques. We also explore the future of MCU architectures to help you stay ahead of the curve.
This is not just theory—this is about building the foundational knowledge that empowers everything you do with microcontrollers.
What You’ll Learn
Understand the architecture and stages of core pipelines in MCUs
Explore system clock and reset circuit design and functionality
Analyze memory hierarchy and access in embedded systems
Learn how bus protocols and arbitration work within microcontrollers
Examine peripheral subsystems and how they connect with core logic
Apply low-power design techniques to energy-efficient embedded systems
Identify trends and emerging directions in microcontroller design
Who This Course Is For
Electronics and embedded systems students looking to go deeper into MCU architecture
Junior engineers and developers working with low-level embedded code or hardware
Anyone interested in understanding how microcontrollers work
Hardware tinkerers and makers who want to design more efficient systems
Requirements
Basic understanding of microcontroller applications
Familiarity with terms like CPU, memory, and peripherals is helpful
No advanced coding or hardware tools required—just a desire to learn how it all works
Ready to understand how microcontrollers really work?
Enroll now and build the deep architectural knowledge that will guide every hardware or embedded system you design in the future.


Instructor Bio
The Educational Engineering Team brings over 13 years of experience in electronics, embedded systems, and microcontroller design. With more than 250,000 students taught worldwide and a portfolio of over 100+ hardware courses, their mission is to empower learners with practical, foundational knowledge that leads to real-world innovation. Their teaching style is clear, applied, and grounded in experience.
FAQ
Q: Do I need a microcontroller to follow this course?
A: No, this course is focused on architecture and theory—you won’t need hardware.
Q: Is this a hands-on course?
A: While it’s theory-focused, it’s packed with practical design examples and use cases.
Q: Will I receive a certificate?
A: Yes! You’ll get a certificate of completion at the end of the course.
Q: Can beginners take this course?
A: Absolutely—basic electronics knowledge is helpful, but this course is beginner-friendly.


Start Learning Today and Unlock the Secrets Behind Microcontroller Architecture
target_audience: Embedded systems students seeking deeper hardware insight
Junior engineers moving beyond coding into architecture
Self-taught hobbyists with a passion for low-level design
Professionals aiming to design or evaluate efficient MCU systems

requirements: Conocimiento básico de leguaje C
Placa de desarrollo de bajo coste NUCLEO-F446RE  (o similar)
STM32CubeIDE (gratuito)
courses.description:
En este curso aprenderás paso a paso y en profundidad a programar drivers en C para manejar diferentes periféricos y crear firmware de calidad. Durante el proceso, aprenderás también a manejar toda la documentación necesaria (reference manuals, datasheets, user guides...), a manejar un analizador lógico y a depurar tu propio código o el de terceros.


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * IMPORTANTE !! * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *
Si aún tienes dudas de si hacer el curso y necesitas que te ayude a decidir, aquí tienes un cupón de descuento:
1ADD49DB3590DFC13DD6


Utilizándolo, recibirás un descuento, tendrás preferencia en las preguntas y  comunicaciones conmigo y me ayudarás a que Udemy valore más mi trabajo!
* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


A continuación te muestro una explicación más detallada del curso:
La programación se hace desde cero, no se utiliza ningún tipo de código auto generado ni de terceros. Los drivers proporcionados por los fabricantes, como la HAL de ST, intentan ser todo lo generalistas que pueden para abarcar el número máximo de MCUs, esto hace que sean muy poco eficientes y poco aconsejables para proyectos serios y profesionales. En este curso se estudian las particularidades de los cortex-m y se van construyendo los drivers poco a poco desde bajo nivel (escribiendo directamente en los registros) para crear las APIs que ofrecen al usuario el nivel de abstracción necesario para simplificar en gran medida el control de los periféricos en el desarrollo del firmware en capas superiores. Esto te permitirá entender en profundidad cómo funcionan los periféricos internamente, en lugar de usar a ciegas drivers de terceros.
El temario está dividido en cinco módulos, en los que verás:
GPIO: Todo lo relacionado con las entradas y salidas de propósito general. Programarás un driver para configurarlas y controlarlas por completo, incluyendo su uso mediante interrupciones.
RCC: en este módulo aprenderás las diferentes fuentes de reloj de las que dispone la MCU y cómo configurar el clock del sistema. También aprenderemos el uso del PLL para multiplicar la frecuencia de reloj y ajustarla a nuestras necesidades. Sacaremos varias señales de reloj hacia el exterior mediante el pin MCO1 para poder medir la frecuencia configurada y comprobar que nuestro driver funciona correctamente.
TIMERS: este es el módulo más extenso, ya que se estudia al detalle el uso de los diferentes timers con incluye la MCU. Desde los básicos hasta los avanzados, pasando por los de propósito general. No solo estudiamos el uso de los timers como simple temporización, sino que también se explican los usos de Input Capture para la obtención del tiempo entre eventos de entrada y medición de señales, y de Output Compare para la generación de salidas y señales PWM. Hay multitud de ejercicios para afianzar los conceptos de cada uno de los modos. Al final del módulo se incluyen ejercicios avanzados. En uno de ellos se explica el PWM Input mode, para la medición por hardware del periodo y el ciclo de trabajo de una señal PWM. En otro se utiliza el modo Encoder para la obtención y el tratamiento, también por hardware, de las señales entregadas por los encoders.
SYSTICK: en este módulo se estudia el timer del sistema, interno al CortexM4. Aprenderás a configurarlo y a beneficiarte de las ventajas que ofrece y que aprovechan los sistemas de tiempo real RTOS.


WATCHDOG: en este móculo se estudia el uso de los diferentes watchdogs que ofrece la MCU. Primero se explica el Independent Watchdog (IWDG), que es el más común, y luego se ve el Window Watchdog (WWDG), que permite controlar los tiempos de refresco de forma más fina e introduce un tiempo mínimo de espera antes de actualizar el watchdog para evitar el reset. Como siempre, programamos los drivers para ambos y realizamos ejercicios para ver posibles usos y afianzar conocimientos.
En resumen, más de 11h de curso repartidas en 5 módulos de los que acabarás siendo un experto. Después de este curso serás capaz de programar tus propios drivers, entenderás el funcionamiento de periféricos fundamentales, de los cortex-M y tendrás un conocimiento amplio del desarrollo firmware.


IMPORTANTE! No se utilizan generadores de código ni librerías de terceros. Lo hacemos todo desde cero, que es como más se aprende!


Si estás interesado en el mundo de los microcontroladores y el desarrollo firmware, este curso te va a ser de gran ayuda y te va a ahorrar cientos de horas de búsqueda de información por tu cuenta. Además, si, por cualquier motivo, el curso no te convence o no es lo que esperabas, puedes solicitar un reembolso durante los primeros 30 días, y se te devolverá en su totalidad, sin pedir ningún tipo de justificación ni hacer preguntas.
Puedes ver el temario y ver el vídeo de presentación para hacerte una mejor idea de lo que vamos a ver. Y si tienes cualquier duda, no dejes de escribirme y te ayudaré en todo lo que pueda.
Espero verte dentro!


Muchas gracias y un saludo!
Javi
target_audience: Gente interesada en aprender en profundidad el uso y programación de microcontroladores
Profesionales que usan librerías de terceros en sus proyectos y quieran entender lo que hay por debajo de ellas
Aficionados que quieran dar un importante paso hacia la profesionalización en el mundo del firmware

objectives: Gain valuable experience by building 4 different computers with different budgets and usages
Learn the principles of building a computer

Introduction: Why Should You Buy This Course?
Build Examples - Gaming: How to Build a Gaming PC?
Build Examples - General Usage: How to Build a PC on a Budget?

requirements: Some introductory knowledge about computer hardware is needed.
courses.description:
Learn how do experts build a computer, how do they decide and which principles they use from the first person view.
Gain practical knowledge on computer hardware and gain valuable experince by building 4 different computers
Learn how to build a gaming PC
Learn how to build a workstation
Learn how to build a general usage PC


Contents & Overview
This course has 1.5 hours of content. This course is on intermediate level, and aims to give practical knowledge by building many types of computers to users with introductory computer hardware knowledge.
We are Kickstart Hardware, founded with the mission of teaching you hardware fast, simple but also comprehensive. In this course, and actually, in any of our courses, we will never make you memorize information that will be obsolete in a few years or even months. We will directly teach you the principles that makes a component better than the other one, so you will learn to decide on your own and within any technology.
We will start our course with the principles of building a gaming PC. Then, we will build 2 different gaming PCs, with 1000$ and 2000$ budgets respectively. Then, we will learn the principles of building a workstation, and build a workstation with 3000$ budget. Lastly, we will learn the principles of building a system on a budget, a.k.a general usage systems that can be used for office, school or light gaming etc. We will build a special system with 600$ budget, and finish our course.
There will be helpful practice quizzes, at the end of each section, so you can test yourself and truly embrace what you've learned.
By the end of this course, you'll learn how to build a gaming PC, workstation as well as general usage PCs. You will not memorize pre-defined build lists that will be obsolete in a few months. We will directly teach you the principles of selecting the right component, based on your budget and usage, and show you firsthand how do we find them, so you will confidently build your computers in any technology.
This isn't the course for complete beginners. We will assume you have some knowledge about computer hardware.
In this course, Udemy gives you 30-day money back guarentee, so you can try it without any risk. As Kickstart Hardware, we promise to always be here for you if you've questions along the way. We commit ourselves to improving and deeply think about how we can make your learning experience better. We're hoping to see you inside, where you'll put your computer hardware knowledge into practice and learn how to actually pick up the parts for your build.


What you'll learn in this course
How to build a gaming PC?
How to build a workstation?
How to build a general usage PC?
How to decide between components when building a computer?
What you'll NOT learn in this course
Installing and mounting the parts
target_audience: This course is not for complete beginners. At least some familiarity with computer hardware concepts is required.

O mercado de montagem de computadores é amplo, você pode trabalhar para empresas ou até mesmo montar sua própria empresa de prestação de serviços e venda de peças.


Quando queremos montar uma nova máquina, é comum que pensemos apenas em processador, memória e placa de vídeo, mas você já viu como é um computador por dentro? O sistema é complexo e o número de componentes que fazem parte dele é muito maior do que imaginamos.

courses.description:
NOVIDADE: Agora o curso possui Simulados, para lhe auxiliar no processo de aprendizagem!
Aprenda a criar Firmwares para o STM32F411 utilizando a STM32CubeIDE.
Neste curso você aprenderá sobre:
Utilizar a STM32CubeIDE de forma eficiente.
Compreender as documentações disponíveis, como procurá-las e utilizá-las.
Criar projetos para o STM32F411.
Configurar corretamente o microcontrolador de acordo com cada necessidade.
Utilizar a biblioteca HAL para programar o STM32.
Depurar o código e analisar o comportamento do programa.
Organização do programa e dicas para criar bibliotecas.
Proteger o programa gravado no microcontrolador.
Para desenvolvimento dos programas, utilizaremos a placa de desenvolvimento Blackpill e um gravador ST-Link v2, caso queria acompanhar os programas desenvolvimentos, mas caso opte por um kit oficial da ST, pode ser utilizado a NUCLEO-F411RE. É recomendável, também, ter em mãos estes dispositivos, além de componentes eletrônicos, como botões, LEDs e resistores.
O curso buscará apresentar-lhe o essencial para que você possa programar este microcontrolador em bare-metal (sem nenhum tipo de kernel o RTOS), apresentando-lhe como configurar os seus sistemas de clock, GPIOs, e demais periféricos, tais como Timers, I2C, SPI, UART, etc. E, ao final, desenvolver um simples projeto utilizando pelo menos 2 periféricos, com o objetivo de apresentar técnicas de programação, depuração e proteção do firmware.
É esperado que ao fim do curso você seja capaz de desenvolver projetos utilizando microcontroladores STM32, tendo condições de planejar, estruturar e desenvolver aplicações com uso consciente e eficiente dos recursos disponíveis na plataforma.
Espero ver você no curso, e qualquer dúvida, estou à disposição.

courses.description:
■コンテンツ追加履歴
随時追加しております。
2024年12月：セクション7に「ライントレースロボットの制御」について解説を追加しました。
2025年1月：セクション8に「メカナムホイールロボットの制御」について解説を追加しました。
2025年9月：セクション4の「Arduino IDEのダウンロードページ」が変わりましたので解説を追加しました。
また、セクション5に「最も手軽にロボットを組み立てる方法」と「中華系キットのパーツセットのご紹介」について解説を追加しました。


■はじめに
こんにちは！「山ちゃん先生」こと講師の山野と申します。
私はこれまで学生と社会人を合わせて5000人以上にプログラミング学習を指導してきました。


ゼロからイチをわかりやすく解説する専門家として活動しており、
本業ではArduinoを用いたIoT開発とロボットプログラミングを専門にしています。


■このコースの概要説明
このコースでは、Arduinoを使ったロボットプログラミングを組み立てから電子工作、
プログラミングの基礎まで、初学者でも理解できるように体系的に詳しく解説しています。
一緒にロボットを製作し、プログラミングする楽しさを体験できるコース内容となっています。


それぞれかなり詳しく解説していますので、経験者の方には説明が不要な箇所があります。
その場合はご自由に講義をスキップしてください。


ChatGPTを活用したエラーの解決方法も紹介していますが、
こちらは無料プランでもできるようにアカウントの解説から行なっています。


また、学習内容を確認する「小テスト」、コースの目標よりさらに高い問題に挑戦したい方のための「チャレンジ演習」をご用意しています。
ご自身のレベルに合わせて最適な学習を進めることができます。


■このコースで学べること
◆ Arduinoの基本的な使い方から始め、電子工作の基礎知識を習得
◆ ロボットプログラミングの全体像をつかみ、自分に合う進め方を発見
◆ ロボットを実際に組み立てる過程で、必要なプログラミング技術を習得
◆ 親子で一緒に学ぶこともできるコース構成
◆ 体験と実践を通じて、確実にスキルアップを目指す


■コースを受講することで…
このコースを終えるころには、Arduinoを使用して自分だけのロボットを設計し、
壁にぶつからないロボットのプログラミングを考えるスキルを身に付けることができます。
（2024年12月：ライントレースロボットの解説も追加しました。）
（2025年1月：メカナムホイールロボットの解説も追加しました。）


プログラミングで制御するロボットの組み立て方を理解し、
マイコンの選び方、電子部品の使い方、ロボット制御に必要な電子工作の基礎、
全部で5つのパターンのロボットの組み立て方をパーツの購入方法から紹介しています。


・モーターを使った制御では、3つのモータードライバの使い方を詳しく解説！
・サーボモータを使った制御では、レゴ互換サーボやM5Stack用の360度回転サーボを使った制御を解説！


など、ご自身の目的やロボット製作のレベルに合わせて理解を深めることができます。
最後まで、挫折せずに進めることができるようにカリキュラムを組んでいます。


■こんな方が受講に向いています
・ プログラミングに興味はあるけど、何から手をつけていいかわからない方
・ 未経験でもロボットプログラミングをやってみたい方
・ ハンズオンで学びながら具体的なロボットの製作方法を知りたい方
・ 子どもにプログラミングの楽しさを教えたい親御さん
・ Arduinoについて詳しく知りたい方
・ 過去にプログラミングを学ぼうとして挫折した経験のある方


■このコースは全部で8セクションです
セクション1：はじめに
セクション2：プログラミングロボットの仕組みと全体像
セクション3：電子工作の基礎
セクション4：プログラミングの基礎
セクション5：プログラミングロボットの製作
セクション6：ボーナスレクチャー
セクション7：ライントレースロボットの制御（2024/12追加）
セクション8：メカナムホイールのロボットカーを制御しよう（2025/1追加）


全部で17時間56分のコースです。
その他、ワークシートを用意し、学んだことをアウトプットしながら実践的な学びを深めることができます。


また、プログラミングの知識を確認する小テストや、壁にぶつからないロボットのプログラミング応用力を確かめるチャレンジ演習も用意しています。
2025/1現在、ライントレースロボットの制御、メカナムホイールロボットの制御など、演習としてコンテンツを追加しています。
今後も受講生が増えるたびにセクションを追加する予定です。


■最後に
このコースに興味を持っていただいた方は、ぜひ「コース登録」へ進んでください。
まだご検討中の方は、無料プレビューで講座の一部を視聴できますので、ぜひ覗いてみてください。


楽しいプログラミングの世界への第一歩を一緒に踏み出しましょう！
target_audience: プログラミングに興味がある人
Arduinoの使い方を基礎から知りたい人
Arduinoでロボットプログラミングを学びたい人
夏休みの宿題にプログラミングをやりたい小学生
ロボットのプログラミングをやってみたい親子
子どもにプログラミングを教えたいお父さん
