courses.description:
Atualizações importantes:
Este curso está totalmente atualizado para 2025! Aqui, você aprenderá de forma prática e direta como consertar placas-mãe de notebooks, netbooks e MacBooks.
Além disso, terá acesso aos nossos grupos privados, com mais de 800 profissionais prontos para trocar experiências e ajudar no seu crescimento.
Este é um curso 100% prático, sem enrolação e sem SLIDES. Todo o conteúdo foi gravado dentro de uma assistência técnica real, mostrando a rotina e os desafios desse mercado.


Para garantir a melhor experiência de aprendizado, utilizamos duas câmeras de alta resolução, uma fixa e outra com zoom, permitindo que você veja cada detalhe com clareza absoluta.
Aqui, você não apenas aprende, você pratica e domina a manutenção de placas-mãe!


O que você vai aprender?
Ao final do curso, você será capaz de:
Montar sua bancada de trabalho com os materiais necessários
Medir os principais componentes da placa-mãe
Evitar danos causados pela eletricidade estática e fazer um aterramento adequado
Trabalhar com Gravador de EEPROM
Identificar e testar os seguintes componentes da placa-mãe:
Capacitores
Transistores
Diodos
Bobinas
Resistores
Cristais
Circuitos reguladores de tensão
Chipsets
Super I/O
Gerador de CLOCKS
CI PWM
Driver acionador
Utilizar o multímetro corretamente
Fazer um checklist completo de notebooks que não ligam
Identificar erros comuns e suas soluções
Descobrir a base de valores para consertos atuais
Aprender estratégias essenciais para quem está começando na área
Diagnosticar defeitos no processador, GPU e Chipset
E muito mais!


Com esse conhecimento, você terá domínio completo sobre manutenção de placas-mãe e poderá atuar com confiança no mercado.


Perguntas frequentes
O curso está atualizado para 2025?
Sim! O conteúdo foi desenvolvido com base nas técnicas mais eficientes e atuais do mercado.
Quanto ganha um profissional de manutenção de notebooks?
O faturamento depende de fatores como localização, número de clientes e dedicação. Em geral, um técnico qualificado pode ganhar pelo menos R$ 5.000 por mês, e quem decide abrir sua própria assistência pode faturar mais de R$ 10.000 mensais.
O curso foi gravado com duas câmeras?
Sim! Utilizamos uma câmera fixa e outra com zoom para garantir que você veja todos os detalhes com perfeição.
O professor responde dúvidas?
Sim! O suporte é direto e diário. Todas as suas dúvidas serão respondidas rapidamente para que você continue evoluindo sem dificuldades.
Além do curso em vídeo, também recebo uma apostila?
Sim! O curso inclui vídeo-aulas e uma apostila detalhada, totalmente passo a passo, para que você tenha um material de apoio sempre à mão.


Este é um dos cursos mais completos e práticos sobre manutenção de placas-mãe disponíveis na Udemy.


Se você quer desenvolver uma habilidade valiosa, se destacar no mercado e até mesmo abrir sua própria assistência técnica, este curso é para você.


Não perca tempo! Inscreva-se agora e comece sua jornada na manutenção de placas-mãe.
Nos vemos no curso!
target_audience: Técnicos de informáticas que estão iniciando e procuram saber como identificar problemas de placas mães de notebook. Este curso não se destina a Técnicos que procuram um conhecimento avançado do assunto.

courses.title: Advanced topics in SV Verification Methodology (VMM/Pre-UVM)
courses.bio: - Verification Methodology Manual based
requirements: Verilog
SystemVerilog
Basic Verification Methodology (VMM/UVM)
courses.description:
Welcome to this course - Advanced topics in SystemVerilog Verification Methodology (VMM/Pre-UVM). As with many of our other courses on Udemy we use  a hybrid approach of slides + presenter + whiteboard to make the learning more dynamic than slide-plus-audio-only style. Feel free to contact us if you want a more seasoned, slide-plus-audio type course with labs etc. We will be glad to assist you with the same.
Objectives
To appreciate key concepts behind factory OOP pattern
Appreciate callback and other design patterns as it applies to verification
Learn how sequences/scenarios help in verification
Understand how a Scheduler - like that of UVM Sequencer - works
Prerequisites
Audience must be familiar with Verification features of SystemVerilog and basic methodology (VMM/UVM). If you need to get started, we suggest you look at our Udemy course titled: SystemVerilog Verification Methodology - using VMM (Pre-UVM)
Topics covered
Factory pattern
Introduction, requirements
Methods
Using factory to change the generator output
Callbacks
Introduction, requirements
Façade class declaration
Adding the callback hook in transactor
Populating the callback method
Registering callbacks
Error Injection example
Scenario Generator - precursor to UVM Sequences
Array randomization woes in SV
Using pre-built scenario generator
In-depth view of scenario generator
Extending scenario generator
Tweaking election policy
Notifications in VMM - UVM events complimentary
Define, configure, notify, sync
Get status/transaction
Different types of notifications
Sample applications
Scheduler (similar to UVM Sequencer)
Broadcaster
Slides use VMM base class library, however concepts are applicable to UVM as well. Also the narration relates relevant UVM counterparts thereby making the connection easier for users to appreciate
target_audience: VLSI Design Verification engineers
ASIC/FPGA Design Verification managers
Verification lead engineers

courses.bio: Raspberry Pi（ラズベリーパイ）の概要・初期設定、Pythonプログラミングの基礎、音声出力やテンキーパッドによる入力を学び、自動起動・リスト再生・フェードアウトなどの本格的な機能を盛り込み、実用的に使えるモノに仕上げます。

本コースの紹介: 必要なスキルと学習内容

requirements: 基本的なPC操作
courses.description:
「ラズパイサンプラー」は、ボタンを押すと事前に割り当てた音声を出力する再生機器です。「ポン出し」とも呼ばれており、効果音やBGMを割り当てることで、プレゼンやイベントなどで活用することができます。
実用的に使える効果音・BGMプレーヤーを作ることで、Raspberry PiやPythonプログラミングの基礎を学び、自ら考えてRaspberry Piを活用した様々な応用機器が作れることを目標とします。完成後にはモニター、キーボード、マウスは一切不要で動きます。
Raspberry Pi（ラズベリーパイ）をこれから始めてみようと思っている方にも分かる内容になっています。
継続して学習しやすいように各レクチャーは短時間で区切ってありますので、隙間時間の学習にもご活用ください。


成果物の特徴
実用性が高い
コンパクトで操作しやすい
安価でオリジナリティ
実際に弊社の技術ハンズオンでも使っており、実用的に使える工夫を盛り込んでおります。
モニターやPCは不要で、Raspberry Pi単体で動作可能です。自動起動やリスト再生、遅延対策、電源オフ、フェードアウトなどの機能も実装します。
販売されているスマホアプリなどもありますが、プレゼンやイベント中に電話や通知が流れてしまったり、ツルツルなタッチ画面は操作しづらかったりします。
機器として実売されている「サンプラー」よりも安価に作れ、例えば１つのボタンにBGMを複数割り当てて押す度にランダムに選曲するなど自分だけのオリジナルの機能を盛り込むことが可能です。


必要な機器
Raspberry Pi（ラズベリーパイ）本体と通常の開発に必要な機器（PC、ディスプレイ、キーボード、マウス、HDMIケーブル、ACアダプタ、microSDカード）があれば大丈夫です。コース内でも詳しく説明しています。
ワイヤレステンキーパッドがない場合、USBキーボードのテンキーでも代用可能です。
スピーカーがない場合、HDMIディスプレイのスピーカーでも代用可能です。
すでに何らかのRaspberry Piのお持ちの方は 、新たに本体を購入しなくても対応可能だと思います。
target_audience: IoTに関心がある方
Raspberry Pi（ラズパイ）に関心がある方
音を使ったガジェット作りに関心がある方
Pythonプログラミングを学んでみたい方

courses.title: From Gears to Gigabytes: The History of Computing
courses.bio: The Evolution of Computing: From Mechanical Calculators to Modern Machines
objectives: The origins of mechanical computation and its early pioneers.
Key inventions that paved the way for modern computers, including punch cards, transistors, and microprocessors.
The rise of personal computing and the role of companies like IBM, Apple, and Microsoft.
How the internet and mobile technology transformed computing in the 1990s and 2000s.
The state of computer technology by 2015, including advancements in hardware and software.

History of computer: Difference Engine, Analytical Engine and Tablulating Machine

requirements: Nothing
courses.description:
Embark on an extraordinary journey through the history of computing, from the invention of the Pascal Calculator in 1642 to the powerful computers of the early 21st century. This video explores the key milestones, groundbreaking inventions, and visionary minds that transformed simple mechanical devices into the advanced machines that define modern life.
In this engaging and informative video, you’ll discover:
The origins of mechanical computation with Blaise Pascal’s Pascaline and Leibniz’s Stepped Reckoner.
The groundbreaking ideas of Charles Babbage and Ada Lovelace, who laid the foundation for programmable computers.
The rise of electromechanical machines like Herman Hollerith’s Tabulating Machine, which revolutionized data processing.
The birth of electronic computers in the mid-20th century, including the ENIAC and the transition to transistors.
The personal computer revolution of the 1970s and 1980s, led by pioneers like Steve Jobs, Bill Gates, and the rise of companies like Apple and Microsoft.
The evolution of computing in the 1990s and 2000s, including the rise of the internet, laptops, and smartphones.
The state of computing technology by 2015, with a look at advancements in processors, storage, and connectivity.
Special Focus:
Leibniz Wheel: Learn how Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz’s stepped drum mechanism enabled the first mechanical calculator capable of addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.
Enigma Machine: Discover how this complex encryption device used by the Germans during WWII worked, and why it was considered unbreakable.
Bombe Machine: Explore how Alan Turing and his team at Bletchley Park designed the Bombe to crack the Enigma code, changing the course of history.
Difference Engine & Analytical Engine: Dive into Charles Babbage’s visionary designs—the Difference Engine, which automated complex calculations, and the Analytical Engine, the first conceptual design of a programmable computer.
What You’ll Learn:
The origins of mechanical computation and its early pioneers.
Key inventions that paved the way for modern computers, including punch cards, transistors, and microprocessors.
The rise of personal computing and the role of companies like IBM, Apple, and Microsoft.
How the internet and mobile technology transformed computing in the 1990s and 2000s.
The state of computer technology by 2015, including advancements in hardware and software.
How gear-based machines like the Analytical Engine inspired the programming languages we use today.
Who Is This Video For?
Tech enthusiasts who want to understand the history of computing.
Students studying computer science, engineering, or technology.
Professionals looking to gain a deeper appreciation for the tools they use every day.
Anyone curious about how computers evolved from simple machines to the devices we rely on today.
Why Watch This Video?
Gain a comprehensive understanding of the history of computing.
Learn about the brilliant minds and inventions that changed the world.
Explore how past innovations laid the groundwork for modern technology.
Understand how gear-based machines like the Analytical Engine inspired modern programming languages.
Enjoy a visually engaging and easy-to-follow narrative of computing history.
Watch Now and travel through time to uncover the incredible journey of computers—from gears and punch cards to the powerful machines of 2015. Discover how far we’ve come and how these advancements continue to shape our lives today!
target_audience: Tech enthusiasts who want to understand the history of computing.  Students studying computer science, engineering, or technology.  Professionals looking to gain a deeper appreciation for the tools they use every day.  Anyone curious about how computers evolved from simple machines to the devices we rely on today.
Students who want to understand the basic logic for the current basic algorithms

courses.description:
Conoce de cerca como administrar la infraestructura tecnológica siendo tu la única persona encargada del área de sistemas, esto es algo que se suele ver mucho en las PYMES (Pequeña y mediana empresa).


En muchos casos solo tu vas a ser la persona encargada de dar soporte técnico a toda la empresa, si conoces bien como distribuir el tiempo, crear óptimos planes de mantenimiento tanto preventivos como correctivos y dar capacitación a los usuarios, vas a estar en la capacidad de administrar entre 100 a 150 equipos de computo hasta puede ser un poco mas, pueden parecer muchas computadoras para una sola persona dar el soporte técnico, pero la clave esta en la organización del técnico que va a estar a cargo y en caso tal que hayan mas personas en el departamento de TI nuestro trabajo sera mucho mas fácil e incluso siendo dos personas se podría llegar a administrar tranquilamente el doble de los equipos mencionados anteriormente.


En las grandes empresas nos vamos a encontrar con las mesas de ayuda o Helpdesk conformadas por muchos técnicos dispuestos a dar soluciones oportunas y rápidas pero nosotros vamos a estar en una PYMES  que en este caso no tiene mucho presupuesto para un Helpdesk. Por lo cual debemos aprender los conceptos y algo de practica de los temas de Redes y Soporte técnico.


Si aprendemos todo lo mencionado anteriormente el día que nos contraten en una empresa grande con mesas de ayuda sera muy fácil nuestro trabajo ya que solo nos enfocaremos en una sola área del soporte.
target_audience: Técnicos en soporte informático principiantes
Estudiantes en el área de soporte técnico
Técnicos que quieran obtener nuevos conocimientos o complementar sus conocimientos
Personas que deseen obtener nuevos conocimientos

courses.title: AC/DC Converter in Simulink
courses.bio: Design and simulate controlled rectifiers using MATLAB/Simulink
objectives: Understand the principles of power electronics and the role of switching devices.
Identify and analzye different types of power converters
Analyze and design uncontrolled rectifiers for both half-wave and full-wave applications
Design and simulate controlled rectifiers using MATLAB/Simulink, including single-phase half wave, single-phase full wave (semi-controlled and fully controlled
Gain practical insights into AC-DC converter performance and behavior through hands-on MATLAB/Simulink simulations
requirements: Simulink Basics
courses.description:
In this comprehensive course on Power Electronics, participants will delve into the fundamental principles and applications of power electronics, gaining the knowledge and skills necessary to design and analyze various power converter circuits. Through a combination of theoretical lectures and practical hands-on simulations using MATLAB/Simulink, participants will explore the intricate workings of power electronic devices and their applications in real-world scenarios.
The course begins by introducing the principles of power electronics and the pivotal role of switching devices in modern power systems. Participants will learn how these devices facilitate the efficient conversion and control of electrical power, enabling the design of advanced power converter circuits.
Moving forward, participants will delve into the analysis and design of different types of power converters, including uncontrolled rectifiers for both half-wave and full-wave applications. Through theoretical discussions and practical examples, participants will gain a deep understanding of rectifier operation and design considerations.
A significant portion of the course is dedicated to the design and simulation of controlled rectifiers using MATLAB/Simulink. Participants will learn to design and simulate various configurations of controlled rectifiers, including single-phase half-wave, single-phase full-wave (semi-controlled and fully controlled), and three-phase setups. Through hands-on simulations, participants will gain practical insights into the performance and behavior of AC-DC converters under different operating conditions.
By the end of this course, participants will have developed a thorough understanding of power electronics principles and the ability to design and analyze complex power converter circuits. Armed with practical skills and insights gained from MATLAB/Simulink simulations, participants will be well-equipped to tackle real-world challenges in power electronics engineering with confidence and proficiency.
target_audience: Anyone interested in power electronics

objectives: Aprenderá a cómo obtener el Diagrama Esquemático Final. Basé para iniciar con el diseño del PCB.

Aprenderá a generar sus archivos GERBER, usando el software propuesto.
Aprenderá a reconocer el uso de cada archivo GERBER, aplicable para cualquier software de diseño de tarjetas Electrónicas PCB.
Aprenderá a verificar sus archivos GERBER con ayuda de un software web adicional, online y gratuito.
Se mostrará como cotizar la fabricación de las tarjetas electrónicas PCB por medio de un fabricante industrial.
Como Modulo Complementario Aprenderá a Fabricar Tarjetas PCB Prototipo, en Placa Virgen con un acabado Profesional, utilizando materiales Accesibles.
Como Modulo Complementario Aprenderá Tips para el correcto procedimiento de Soldadura Electrónica.

Procedimiento de Pedido de Fabricación d: Procedimiento de Pedido de Fabricación de Tarjetas Electrónicas PCB

requirements: Conocimientos básicos de Computación.
Conocimientos básicos de Electrónica.
courses.description:
Curso de Diseño de Tarjetas Electrónicas ó PCB a nivel industrial o para su fabricación en serie.
En este curso te enseñaré, como tema principal, a como crear ó generar los archivos GERBER, archivos necesarios para la fabricación a nivel industrial o en serie de tarjetas electrónicas PCB que necesita el fabricante para su producción.
También explicaré a detalle la finalidad de cada uno de los archivos GERBER, de esta manera contarás con una guía que te orientará para la creación de estos archivos con cualquier software CAD de diseño de PCB.
Y como complemento, en la SECCION 8 dejo un miniCurso para que puedas diseñar tus Tarjetas Electrónicas Prototipo en Placas Vírgenes como un Profesional y de esta forma puedas probar tus prototipos antes de fabricarlos en serie.
Propongo empezar el curso realizando proyectos con el software EAGLE Vers. 5.6.0, programa que utilizo, tanto para la creación de los diagramas, como para la creación de los negativos PCB. y su verificación antes de la generación de los archivos GERBER.
Como paso siguiente, utilizaremos un software gratuito WEB para la verificación de los archivos GERBER generados y como paso final te mostraré como cotizar con fabrica tus PCB's.
Aprovecha esta oportunidad...
target_audience: Profesionales del área de la Electrónica ó Electricidad.
Aficionados y apasionados de la Electrónica ó Electricidad.
Diseñadores de Hardware Electrónico.
Estudiantes del campo de la Electrónica ó Electricidad.

courses.title: LwM2M Academy
courses.bio: Accelerate IoT development with the LwM2M standard
requirements: Basic understanding of embedded development
Raspberry Pi Pico W development board
(Free) account on Coiote IoT Device Management Platform
courses.description:
Welcome to the LwM2M Academy, an immersive online course tailored to equip you with understanding of the Lightweight Machine to Machine (LwM2M) protocol. This program is designed to provide you with both the theoretical understanding and hands-on skills necessary to utilize this powerful standard to rapidly build reliable, secure and scalable Internet of Things (IoT) applications.
By the end of the course, you will understand the advantages of the LwM2M standard and possess the skills to implement it effectively. With a strong emphasis on real-world applications, the course is designed to provide you with practical experience, empowering you to build IoT applications confidently using LwM2M.
Course content
The course consists of 5 modules which will journey you through the diverse aspects of LwM2M, from the underlying principles and architecture to its implementation and optimization for creating robust IoT applications.
Module 1 - Introduction to LwM2M
Module 2 - Getting started
Module 3 - Building LwM2M applications
Module 4 - Device management
Module 5 - Firmware updates
Tools
The practical exercises are designed around the Raspberry Pi Pico W hardware platform, used in combination with AVSystem's Anjay SDK (LwM2M Client) and the Coiote IoT Device Management Platform (LwM2M Server).
Embark on this learning journey and explore the fascinating world of LwM2M.
target_audience: IoT developers interested in learning the LwM2M standard

courses.title: Fundamentals of Arduino and Sensors with C/C++
courses.bio: C/C++ | Electronics | Arduino | Electrical Schematics | Software Development | Troubleshooting
requirements: No prior experience needed!
Arduino Uno R3 (or equivalent)
Kuman 37-in-1 Sensor Kit
Jumper Wires (10x Male to Male, 10x Male to Female, 10x Female to Female)
courses.description:
Learn programming and electronics skills from the comfort of your home!
It doesn't take years of school or a 4 month boot camp to start tinkering with sensors and building fun projects.
The best time to start is today. You will learn the fundamental principles of programming and electronics in this short but value packed course!
You will learn how to read and understand electrical schematics which are key to the design of any electronic circuit.
You will learn all of the necessary techniques needed to build and program electronic circuits without any of the fluff. All the skills learnt in this course can be applied right away and are transferable to other future projects or applications that you may encounter both in the course and in the future.
Gain confidence in your ability to read an electric diagram, and program sensors.
Get involved with the latest IoT trends by working with sensors and gain a deeper understanding of where you can use your skillset in todays job market.
Learn how to troubleshoot your circuit using programming techniques taught in this course!
If you have not yet used an Arduino this course shows you all of the key information needed to start building with the Arduino right away.
Skip the overwhelming process of figuring out where to start on your transition in to tech through guided step-by-step projects that are fun and interactive.


WHO THIS COURSE IS FOR:
People with no technical background interested in getting into tech
Freelancers that want to get a feel for Arduino based projects
Hobbyists
New grads that want to build a portfolio project
Those who want to pursue a career in electronics or programming
Teachers who want to introduce their students to IoT concepts
target_audience: Beginner developers, hobbyists and anyone interested in programming and electronics with no experience.
Working with the Arduino and other electronic devices can be overwhelming at times. I created this course so anyone can start at any level of experience in this guided process!

Conoce lo más importante para empezar a utilizar tu PLC de Delta y conviértete en un experto.
De la mano de un instructor con mas de 7 años de experiencia con Delta y  con 20 cursos impartidos y capacitado a mas de 100 personas. Con certificaciones de Delta México directamente y tomando cursos en las instalaciones en Taiwán.
Empieza esta aventura con los PLC de una de las marcas que mejor costo beneficio tiene. Con softwares gratuitos y programación simple.
En este curso entenderás los conceptos básicos de como usar el ISPsoft para programar el PLC de la serie AS. Lo mismo funcionaría si quisieras utilizar los PLC de la serie DVP.
Sirve para cualquier persona con ganas de aprender, se tienen ejemplos prácticos y visuales.
La marca de Delta se ve cada vez mas en la industria, debido a que llegan máquinas de China, o los clientes finales están pidiendo a los integradores más maquinas con este tecnología.
Además de que en México no se esta afectando tanto el stock de estos PLC como los de otras marcas, ya que el problema de los semiconductores han hecho que no haya suficiente stock de los otros PLCs. Delta tiene suficiente para cubrir las necesidades del mercado.
La automatización es muy importante para poder hacer más fácil la vida en la industria, ya que las personas no son robots y pueden equivocarse, y tener mejor calidad y repetibilidad en tus proyectos.
target_audience: Personas que quieren aprender del uso del PLC Delta
Personas que quieren expandir sus conocimientos de PLCs

courses.bio: Wire up your Banana Pro to create a fully functional computer and make two complete projects

What will you learn from the course: What will you learn from the course
Introduction & physical computing: Raspberry Pi vs Banana Pro - Part 1
Raspberry Pi vs Banana Pro - Part 2

Real time demonstration - First step to physical computing
Smoke and gas detector with Email notifi: Source code : Programming the gas sensor

requirements: Complete Banana Pro Kit
courses.description:
This is an introductory course about the credit card sized Banana Pro. This course is useful for those who are interested in exploring the possibilities of Banana Pro as a computer. The course does not assume any prior knowledge of computers or programming. However, a knowledge of Linux operating system and Python programming language would greatly help you in getting up to speed.
The course will teach you to hook up the Banana Pro with a keyboard and monitor so that you can use it as a low-cost computer. You will also learn how to step into the world of physical computing something that you normally do not do with your home computer or laptop.
You will learn to build two complete projects. The first one teaches you how to make a magic candle and turn it ON or OFF by just blowing air as you do in birthday parties. By doing this, you will learn how to code and interact with physical devices such as sensors.
The second project involves building a smoke and gas detector with e-mail notifier to enhance the safety in your kitchen area. You will use the Banana Pro to design the circuit and Python program to code the sensor.
You will also learn how to install Android operating system in your Banana Pro and experience the Android interface.
The course provides complete source code for both the projects.
The entire course can be completed within a week, including the hardware assembly for the magic candle and smoke sensor.
By the end of this course, you will learn how to boot and wire up a Banana Pro and write your own Python code to interact with physical world.
target_audience: This course is useful for those who are interested in exploring the possibilities of Banana Pro as a computer and step into the world of physical computing

courses.title: Basics of Embedded System
courses.bio: Learn basics of Embedded System
objectives: Understand the fundamentals of embedded systems
Identify the key components of embedded systems
Differentiate between embedded systems and general-purpose computing systems
Learn the design flow of embedded systems
Explore the basics of microcontroller operation
Understand the role of firmware and embedded software
Gain insights into real-time operating systems (RTOS)
Analyze simple case studies and real-world examples
requirements: No prior experience in embedded systems is required
A basic understanding of electronics
Familiarity with fundamental programming concepts
A laptop or desktop computer
Willingness to install free simulation tools or IDEs
Optional: Access to a microcontroller development board
Enthusiasm to learn through real-life examples and project-based content
A curious and problem-solving mindset
courses.description:
Course Description: Basics of Embedded System
Embedded systems are at the heart of modern electronics — from mobile phones and smart home devices to automotive systems and industrial machines. If you've ever wondered how these devices work and want to build a strong foundation in this exciting field, then this course is the perfect place to start.
"Basics of Embedded System" is a beginner-friendly course designed to introduce you to the fundamental concepts, components, and applications of embedded systems. Whether you're a student, hobbyist, or aspiring engineer, this course will help you understand how embedded systems function and how they are programmed to interact with the physical world.
We start by exploring what embedded systems are, how they differ from general-purpose computers, and where they are used in everyday life. You’ll learn about the key building blocks such as microcontrollers, sensors, actuators, and memory. The course also covers how embedded systems are designed — from hardware and software integration to system-level thinking.
You’ll gain insight into real-time operations, the importance of timing, and how embedded systems handle multiple tasks using interrupts and scheduling. We’ll also introduce basic programming concepts as they relate to embedded systems, helping you understand the role of embedded software (firmware) in controlling devices.
No prior experience in embedded systems is required. This course is structured to be clear and engaging for beginners. If you have a basic understanding of programming or electronics, it will be helpful, but not necessary. Throughout the course, we'll use simple analogies, practical examples, and optional hands-on activities using simulation tools or basic microcontroller kits (like Arduino or 8051) to reinforce learning.
By the end of this course, you will:
Understand how embedded systems work and where they are used
Identify and describe the key components of embedded systems
Learn the basics of microcontroller operation and interfacing
Grasp the role of firmware and real-time operation in embedded design
Explore simple applications and case studies from real-world industries
This course is not about just theory — it's about understanding how software and hardware come together to create smart, responsive, and reliable systems.
Whether you want to pursue a career in embedded systems, robotics, IoT, or simply want to explore how your favorite gadgets work, this course will give you a solid start.
Join us today and begin your journey into the world of embedded systems — where software meets hardware!
target_audience: Students and beginners
Electronics and Electrical Engineering students
Computer Science students
Hobbyists and tinkerers
Aspiring embedded engineers
Working professionals
Anyone curious about how devices like smart home gadgets, medical equipment, and automotive systems function

requirements: Conocimientos de PLC
Conocimientos de Automatización Industrial

courses.description:
Sé uno de los pocos ingenieros que apliquen el Control de Movimiento en la industria en este 2022. Esta especialidad en el ámbito de automatización es de las mejores pagadas a nivel mundial, ya que los profesionales que certificados son escasos.


Con este curso podrás:
-Instalar y conocer el software IAB.
-Calcular el hardware a utilizar para cualquier proyecto de automatización.
-Conocer las distintas instrucciones para Control de Movimiento.
-La aplicación de las instrucciones.
-Problemas más comunes del Control de Movimiento.
-Pensamiento lógico aplicado a Control de Movimiento.
-Programación de control de movimiento desde cero.
-Prácticas REALES entre programación y servomotores.


Teniendo una base de programación de PLC, puedes tomar este curso y dar un paso a tu carrera, ya que esta área de la automatización industrial (literalmente) es el futuro en todas las industrias de cualquier giro. En un mundo de fabricación masiva, la automatización en control de movimiento es una necesidad que debe de satisfacerse de manera masiva.
Conocerás las diferencias, ventajas y desventajas entre Control de Movimiento y Robótica. En qué casos se utiliza cada uno y cómo impacta en la industria.
Este curso de Control de Movimiento es impartido por un ingeniero certificado en Motion Control en USA Cleveland, por parte de Rockwell Automation. Teniendo en su experiencia diversos proyectos de la misma índole en diferentes industrias en el país.

Ingenieros de Automatización y Robótica

courses.title: Curso completo de Arduino desde Cero, Electrónica + 15 Projs
courses.bio: Aprende Arduino desde Cero, con el mejor curso completo de Arduino desde cero, electrónica y circuitos | + 15 Proyectos
objectives: Programación en Arduino
Componentes electrónicos
Creación de Proyectos
Uso de Sensores
requirements: No se requieren conocimientos previos
courses.description:
¡Basta de los cursos que te muestran sketchs, y te dejan con más dudas de las que te resuelven! Con este mega curso completo de Arduino desde cero, aprenderás todo lo que necesitas para introducirte en el mundo de la electrónica, circuitos y Arduino.
¿Cuántas veces, te ha pasado? Que buscas información sobre cómo crear un proyecto con Arduino, y te aparecen cientos de recursos, pero en ninguno te explican cómo o porqué funciona el proyecto.
O tal vez seas nuevo en este mundo de la electrónica, y quieres saber cómo trabajar con Arduino, pero no encuentras una guía con la cual puedas ir aprendiendo incrementalmente.
¡Eso se acaba hoy mismo!
Te presento, el mejor curso de Arduino en Español hasta la fecha. En este curso, iniciamos desde cero. Y cuando digo cero, en verdad es desde cero.
Empezamos explicando algunos fundamentos que son necesarios para crear proyectos, tales como el funcionamiento de los pines de Arduino, funcionamiento de componentes electrónicos, e inclusive, desmenuzamos el sketch que se nos crea siempre que creamos un nuevo archivo desde el Arduino IDE, con el fin de analizarlo y probar qué pasa si faltan líneas de código.
Aunado a que es un curso enfocado a aprender a crear proyectos, también nos centramos en la programación, ya que, aunque el objetivo del curso no es que te vuelvas un experto programador, la programación es un componente fundamental, que te permitirá crear proyectos cada vez más complejos. Es como una caja de herramientas adicional, que debes saber utilizar.
En muchos de los proyectos, empezaremos creando proyectos en la plataforma Tinkercad, con lo cual, no tendrás que preocuparte por tener el hardware necesario para crear los proyectos, y no tendrás que preocuparte por quemar los circuitos, definitivamente una genial opción si estás empezando.
A lo largo del curso, iremos creando múltiples proyectos, que te van a volver un maker en toda la extensión de la palabra, desde aquellos sencillos, hasta unos más complejos.
En total, se crean más de 15 Proyectos con Arduino, todo explicado y paso a paso.
Algunos de los temas que tocaremos en el curso son:
Bases de programación con Arduino
Sentencias de decisión
Pines digiatles
Pines analógicos
Uso de sensores
Uso de componentes electrónicos
Arreglos
Matrices
Leds
Potenciómetros
Ciclos
Fotorresistencias
Uso de Tinkercad para crear simulaciones
y un largo etcétera.
¿Qué esperas para volverte un maker con Arduino? Te veo en el curso.
target_audience: Estudiantes de electrónica
Aficionados a la electrónica
Aspirantes a maker
Desarrolladores que quieran crear soluciones IoT

courses.title: Beckhoff TwinCat3 HMI Designing
courses.bio: Learn to Build Professional HMIs Using TwinCAT 3 for Beckhoff PLCs
objectives: Design professional-grade HMI interfaces using TwinCAT HMI with real-time connectivity to PLC variables
Understand how to bind HMI controls directly to TwinCAT PLC variables for real-time interaction with automation systems.
Implement key HMI controls such as buttons, text inputs, gauges, and navigation tabs to build responsive and interactive machine dashboards.
Visual Indicators & Styling: Design visual indicators using shapes and colors, and enhance HMI screens for clear status monitoring and user interaction.

Learning to add a Button and Indication: Learning to add a Button and Indication
Learning to add and use a Combo Box: Learning to add and use a Combo Box
Learning to add and use Images in Projec: Learning to add and use Images
Learning to add Guages in Project: Learning to add tachometer, linear and radial gauges
Chemical Processing Unit – Logic and HMI: Chemical Processing Unit – Logic and HMI Design
Example 2: Adding Motors in the Project: Example 2: Programming and designing motors and tachometer

requirements: Basic Understanding of PLC Concepts
Computer with TwinCAT 3 and Visual Studio Installed
Basic Understanding of Industrial Automation
courses.description:
This course is a complete beginner’s guide to designing Human Machine Interfaces (HMI) using Beckhoff’s TwinCAT 3 HMI platform. It is specifically designed for individuals who want to learn how to build professional, interactive, and functional HMIs for industrial automation systems—without the need for any physical hardware.
Throughout this course, you'll learn how to create intuitive user interfaces that can visualize and control various PLC processes. The course begins with an overview of TwinCAT 3 software and quickly moves into hands-on design. You’ll start with simple HMI objects like buttons, combo boxes, and gauges, then progress to dynamic elements like image displays, tag-driven animations, and real-time status indicators.
We’ll also walk through two practical projects: a chemical processing unit and a two-motor system with tachometer. These examples will help you understand how to structure a complete HMI project—from logic development to visual representation. By working on these examples, you’ll gain the skills to design interfaces that not only look good but are also reliable, responsive, and production-ready.
One of the highlights of this course is the animation section, where you’ll learn how to animate components like fans and bottles. These techniques are useful for simulating actual machine movements and improving user interaction on industrial HMIs.
By the end of the course, you will be able to:
Create and configure a new TwinCAT 3 HMI project
Use essential HMI components (combo boxes, images, gauges)
Bind HMI elements to live PLC tags
Develop and visualize real-time data and status updates
Implement smooth animations for moving parts
Design HMIs for complete automation systems
Whether you are a PLC programmer, automation engineer, or student, this course gives you all the tools and knowledge needed to start building industrial-grade HMIs using Beckhoff’s TwinCAT 3 environment.
target_audience: Anyone interested in learning how an industrial process works automatically
PLC Programmers and Automation Engineers
Technicians and Maintenance Professionals
Freelancers and Control System Integrators
Machine Builders and OEM Developers
Electrical and Mechatronics Engineering Students

courses.title: Learn Conversational UX on Pepper the Robot
courses.bio: Build a chatbot for Pepper to create an amazingly natural, conversational humanoid, robot interaction.
requirements: Understanding of basic technical concepts.
courses.description: This course teaches how to build an interactive, conversational experience on Pepper using the new Pepper Chat / Host platform for Pepper from SoftBank Robotics America. The course teaches how to use Google's Dialogflow (chatbot technology) to create a chatbot specifically for Pepper using SBRA's native Pepper Markup Language. The course then teaches how to pair the chatbot to a Host / Pepper Chat account and then activate the chatbot onto an individual Pepper.
target_audience: Anyone who owns a Pepper or who would like to purchase a Pepper robot in North America.

requirements: Não é necessário ter experiência pois o aprendizado é desde o básico.
courses.description:
O Curso de Hardware para iniciantes é um curso abrangente projetado para fornecer aos alunos uma base sólida de conhecimento e habilidades em áreas essenciais da informática. Apesar deste curso ser voltado para iniciantes, é abordado temas que podem ajudar até técnicos mais experientes.


O curso começa com uma introdução ao hardware de computadores, onde os alunos aprendem sobre os principais componentes de um computador e seu funcionamento. Eles serão apresentados aos conceitos de processadores, placas-mãe, memória, armazenamento e periféricos.


Durante o curso você aprenderá a realizar a montagem de um computador desktop, a realizar trocas de memória RAM e HD por SSD em notebooks e posteriormente a realizar o procedimento de instalação do Sistema Operacional, que vai desde a criação do pen drive com boot, configuração da BIOS até a instalação correta dos Drivers.
Aprenderá a instalar programas que geralmente os usuários utilizam e pedem ao solicitarem o serviço de formatação, para que você possa entregar o serviço de forma completa.


Ensino também a configurar uma rede local através de roteadores e também na crimpagem (montagem) de cabos de rede.


Você aprenderá também a criar uma máquina virtual e a instalar outros Sistemas Operacionais, como uma versão do Linux e outra do Windows, além do Microsoft Office.
Aprenderá também a reconhecer alguns problemas e possíveis soluções.


Com a demanda por profissionais de hardware em constante crescimento, este curso é o trampolim perfeito para uma carreira lucrativa em tecnologia da informação.
target_audience: O curso é destinado para quem deseja aprender uma nova profissão ou até mesmo ampliar o conhecimento em informática. Os computadores nunca deixarão de apresentar defeitos e sempre será necessário alguém para fazer a manutenção correta.

courses.title: برمجة واجهة التشغيل وربطها بالمتحكم المنطقي القابل للبرمجة
courses.bio: سوف تساعد هذه الدورة التدريبية على معرفة HMI (واجهة الآلة البشرية) وبناء برنامج FIRST HMI والحصول عليها باستخدام PLC الخ
objectives: برمجة شاشة اتش ام اي HMI
برمجة المتحكم المنطقي القابل للبرمجة
ربط الشاشة بالمتحكم المنطقي القابل للبرمجة وارسال واستقبال الاوامر من والى المتحكم من خلال الشاشة
requirements: جهاز حاسوب او لابتوب
اتصال بالانترنت
برنامج برمجة شاشة HMI - متوفر مع الكورس ومجاني
courses.description:
سوف تساعد هذه الدورة التدريبية على معرفة HMI (واجهة الآلة البشرية) وبناء برنامج FIRST HMI والحصول عليها باستخدام PLC الخاص بك
HMI هو اختصار لـ Interface Interface ، ويمكن تصميمه على أنه مجرد ؛ واجهة بين المستخدم والجهاز.
واجهة الآلة البشرية (HMI) هي بالضبط ما يوحي به الاسم ؛ واجهة رسومية تسمح للبشر والآلات بالتفاعل. تختلف واجهات الآلة البشرية على نطاق واسع ، من لوحات التحكم لمحطات الطاقة النووية ، إلى الشاشة على جهاز iPhone.
في هذه الدورة سوف تحصل على نوع مختلف من البرنامج التعليمي
-النظري لمساعدتك على فهم أساسيات HMI Control وكيف يمكنك استخدام تقنيات تحكم مختلفة وتنفيذها باستخدام HMI & PLC الخاص بك.
- عملية لمساعدتك على كتابة رمز HMI & PLC الخاص بك لآلة جهازك وأخطاء المسار
تم تنظيم الدورة بطريقة تجعل الأشخاص الذين لديهم خبرة مختلفة في التحكم والأتمتة يستفيدون من المواد الموجودة بداخله ، ويتم توفير الكتب والمحاضرات في PDF لتكون بين يديك للرجوع إليها في المستقبل ، بالإضافة إلى دعم 24 ساعة لك في أي برنامج HMI & PLC لديك مشكلة.
يجب أن تأخذ هذه الدورة الدراسية لأنها سوف تساعدك على بدء شركة الطيران الصناعية الخاصة بك عن طريق بناء المعرفة الأتمتة الصناعية النظرية والعملية الصحيحة في مجال PLC.
target_audience: محبي المتحكمات
محبي الهندسة وانظمة التحكم الصناعي
الراغبين في تعلم برمجة شاشة HMI وربطها بالمتحكم المنطقي القابل للبرمجة PLC

courses.title: ARM Cortex-M Interfacing with Keyboards and LCD's (FREE! )
courses.bio: Write your own Keyboard and LCD drivers for Cortex-M

Welcome: Overview of the TM4C123 Tiva C LaunchPad
Setting up Development Environment and T: Downloading and Installing USB Drivers for Tiva C Microcontroller

requirements: This course assumes no prior knowledge of Interfacing Cortex-M to Keyboards and LCDs. All it requires from students is curiosity.
courses.description:
This course takes a step-by-step practical approach on how to write drivers and libraries that will allow your Cortex-Microcontroller to talk to Keyboards and Liquid Crystal Displays. It goes on to provide optimization methods such as accessing the LCD with 4-bits rather than 8-bits and also  programming keyboards using the  matrix arrangement approach.
We will start by differentiating between GPIO and SPIO, this will give students the understanding on how registers relates to IO ports then we shall write out the code to see how these registers actually work with inputs and outputs.
We shall look at how to write our own LCD Drivers and Libraries, we shall take a look at the pinout and how we interface with the microcontroller, take a look at how we control the shift registers inside the LCD, then we shall go on to code our own driver and library.The last section of the LCD chapter deals with writing data in 4-bits to reduce the number of IO pins used for LCD.
The final chapter of the course deals with interfacing to keyboards, I will introduce how keyboards also conserve the number of IO pins by using the matrix arrangement and then we shall go on to write our keyboard driver and library. In a nutshell, this are the key areas we shall be looking at in this course :
Keyboard driver and library coding
LCD driver and library coding
LCD 4-bits data transfer
Keyboard matrix arrangement
If you interested in having bare-metal level access to keyboards and LCDs  then this course is for you.
target_audience: Embedded systems students
Embedded systems professionals
Hobbyists

courses.title: Master en VHDL
courses.bio: Desde los Fundamentos hasta la Implementación en FPGA
objectives: Aprende la sintaxis VHDL para describir circuitos digitales y adquiere habilidades esenciales en diseño lógico.
Desarrolla la capacidad para diseñar, simular y verificar circuitos digitales usando VHDL de manera efectiva.
Comprende el flujo de diseño para FPGAs, generación de bitstreams y carga en FPGA para validar tus diseños.
Adquiere habilidades en la integración de periféricos y realiza proyectos prácticos con VHDL y FPGAs.

Elementos Básicos de VHDL: Ejercicio #2: Señales y Tipos de datos

requirements: Conocimientos Básicos de Lógica Digital
Herramienta de Desarrollo VHDL (Vivado)
courses.description:
Este curso te sumergirá en el mundo del diseño digital y la programación de FPGAs a través de la sintaxis VHDL. A lo largo del curso, los estudiantes adquirirán una comprensión profunda de cómo describir circuitos digitales utilizando VHDL, una habilidad esencial en el campo de la electrónica y la ingeniería. Desde los conceptos básicos, los participantes aprenderán a diseñar, simular y verificar circuitos digitales de manera efectiva. Además, explorarán el flujo de diseño para FPGAs, lo que incluye la generación de bitstreams y la carga en FPGA para validar los diseños.
Con una combinación de teoría y práctica, este curso proporcionará a los estudiantes una base sólida en diseño lógico y VHDL. A través de proyectos prácticos, los participantes tendrán la oportunidad de aplicar sus conocimientos en la integración de periféricos y resolver problemas del mundo real. No se requiere experiencia previa en VHDL, lo que hace que este curso sea accesible para principiantes. Está dirigido a estudiantes y entusiastas de la electrónica y la informática, así como a profesionales en campos relacionados que deseen mejorar sus habilidades en diseño digital y FPGAs. Al completar este curso, los participantes estarán preparados para enfrentar desafíos en el diseño digital y utilizar VHDL de manera efectiva en sus proyectos futuros.
target_audience: Estudiantes y entusiastas de la electrónica y la informática que deseen sumergirse en el fascinante mundo del diseño digital. No se requiere experiencia previa en VHDL, lo que lo convierte en la opción ideal para principiantes. Si tienes curiosidad por aprender a crear y programar circuitos digitales, este curso te proporcionará los conocimientos y habilidades esenciales para comenzar tu viaje en el diseño digital y la programación de FPGAs.
Profesionales en campos de electrónica, informática o ingeniería, deseosos de adquirir habilidades sólidas en diseño digital y VHDL.
Ingenieros de hardware o programadores de software que desean comprender y trabajar en el nivel de diseño digital.
Profesionales enfocados en sistemas embebidos que buscan mejorar sus capacidades en diseño digital y FPGAs.
Arquitectos de sistemas digitales que desean fortalecer sus habilidades y mantenerse actualizados en las últimas tecnologías.
Aquellos con interés en la implementación práctica de sistemas en FPGAs, ya sea para proyectos actuales o futuros.

courses.description:
If you work in the Technology industry or plan to, and don’t have an Electrical Engineering or Computer Science background, this ~120-minute course could be the most valuable training of your career.


Understanding how a computer works provides numerous advantages to the IT professional. For example:
Familiarity with terminology and concepts that might otherwise be a complete enigma.
Ability to communicate more effectively, gain credibility, and influence others.
Improved technical program management capability.
Career path options that might otherwise not be available.
Technical understanding upon which additional knowledge can be built.


The fields of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science are incredibly broad and incredibly deep.
The key to learning how a computer works quickly is to become familiar with just the right detail about just the right topics so you can quickly understand how a computer actually works.


“How Computers Work” training quickly describes the primary function of every computer and provides you with an opportunity to gain a competitive advantage.


F. Scott Fitzgerald said, “Our lives are defined by our opportunities. Even the ones we miss.”


If you want to understand how a computer works quickly to gain a significant competitive advantage, you’ll want to complete this unique learning experience.
target_audience: The course is for students or Technology professionals without an Electrical Engineering or Computer Science background who want to understand how a computer actually works.

Zigbee is at the heart of modern IoT applications, enabling seamless device communication in smart homes, industrial automation, and beyond. This comprehensive course guides you through developing Zigbee applications using the STM32WB55 microcontroller, equipping you with real-world skills in embedded systems.
Throughout this course, you’ll:
Learn Zigbee fundamentals and how to create a simple On-Off server-client setup
Master Over-the-Air (OTA) firmware updates for Zigbee devices
Explore the STM32 Zigbee ecosystem, tools, and development frameworks
Gain hands-on experience with interoperability demonstrations and Zigbee clusters
Implement a Thermostat Cluster example using STM32WB55
With step-by-step guidance and real-world applications, you’ll be ready to integrate Zigbee into your embedded projects. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced developer, this course provides everything you need to start your Zigbee application development journey.
Enroll now and start building Zigbee-powered applications today!
What You Will Learn
Understand the Zigbee protocol and its role in IoT
Set up and program a basic Zigbee On-Off Server-Client
Implement Over-the-Air (OTA) firmware updates for Zigbee devices
Navigate the STM32Cube ecosystem and STM32 Zigbee portfolio
Demonstrate STM32WB55 interoperability with other Zigbee devices
Develop a Thermostat Cluster example using STM32WB55


Who Is This Course For?
Embedded developers looking to add Zigbee capabilities to their projects
Engineers working on smart home, industrial, or IoT solutions
STM32 developers who want to explore wireless communication
Anyone interested in Zigbee networking and real-world implementations

courses.title: Mastering FreeRTOS using STM32
courses.bio: From Beginner to Expert
objectives: Fundamentals of RTOS and multitasking
Creating and managing tasks effectively
Using queues, semaphores, and mutexes
Real-time scheduling strategies
Stack management and memory optimization
Handling timers, delays, and interrupts
Integration with ARM Cortex-M microcontrollers
Building real-world embedded projects using FreeRTOS
Step by step method to use FreeRTOS on STM32 Boards
Real Life examples using STM32 Nucleo H63ZI board
Deep concepts of context switching, queues, task synchronization techniques
requirements: Basic programming knowledge
Familiarity with the command line
No advanced math or computer science background
courses.description:
Unlock the full potential of real-time embedded systems with Mastering FreeRTOS: Beginner to Expert. This course is a comprehensive, hands-on journey into the world of FreeRTOS, one of the most widely used real-time operating systems in embedded development.
Whether you're a student, a professional engineer, or a hobbyist, this course is designed to take you from the fundamentals of task scheduling and inter-task communication to advanced topics like real-time debugging, memory management, and RTOS integration with hardware.
You’ll not only learn how FreeRTOS works, but also why it works the way it does, through practical projects, detailed walkthroughs, and real-world scenarios.


Some highlights


Complete Beginner to Advanced Coverage
Start from the basics and progress to expert-level FreeRTOS concepts and applications.
Hands-On Learning with Real Hardware
Learn FreeRTOS by building real projects using ARM Cortex-M or STM32 microcontrollers.
Master Real-Time Scheduling
Understand how tasks, priorities, and preemption work in real-time systems.
Practical Task Management
Create, manage, and synchronize tasks using queues, semaphores, and mutexes.
Debug Like a Pro
Learn advanced debugging techniques using IDEs, hardware debuggers, and tracing tools.
Modular & Structured Content
Well-organized lessons, clearly separated into beginner, intermediate, and advanced modules.
Hardware & Peripheral Integration
Integrate FreeRTOS with GPIO, timers, interrupts, and communication interfaces.
Memory and Stack Optimization
Learn best practices for efficient memory management and safe stack usage.
Industry-Ready Skills
Prepare for roles in embedded firmware, IoT, and real-time systems development.
10. Downloadable Resources & Code Examples
Get full source code, lab templates, and documentation for every section.
target_audience: Students in electronics, computer engineering, or related fields looking to build real-time embedded systems knowledge.
Embedded developers who want to level up from bare-metal programming to using a real-time operating system (RTOS).
Firmware engineers aiming to improve task management, scheduling, and debugging in their embedded applications.
Hobbyists and makers working on ARM Cortex-M or other microcontroller-based projects.

courses.description:
Mais uma vez a Komunyka dá um passo a frente e oferece ao mercado um novo curso online, com tecnologia para interface celular GSM, capaz de proporcionar reduções realmente fantásticas nos gastos com chamadas telefônicas.
O Celular Siga-me externo com Mini Modem ou Chipeira GSM é um curso onde você irá construir um sistema de interface celular para entroncamento analógico FXS, tronco GSM ou tronco VOIP. Ele permite a conversão de chamadas dos troncos na central para a rede GSM e vice-versa, atuando praticamente como uma mini central pública, porém operando com tecnologia GSM.

O sistema poderá receber chips de várias operadoras e realizar consultas à base de dados da portabilidade. Isso permitirá ao Celular Siga-me identificar a operadora para a qual a chamada está sendo realizada e escolher um chip pertencente à mesma operadora, gerando uma considerável redução no custo das chamadas.
target_audience: Ideal para profissionais liberais que estarão sempre a disposição de seus clientes.

courses.title: VLSI/FPGA Design P2-S3: Verilog for Design and Verification
courses.bio: Consistency between circuit diagram, RTL code and waveform
requirements: Basic knowledge of digital fundamental
Basic C or C++ programing language
courses.description:
The speech isn't fluent, please turn on the subtitle to help your understanding.


Quick master through examples and coding exercises, in videos less than 10 hours. After study, you can have the ability of consistency between circuit schematic, Verilog code and waveform. That’s given anyone of them, you can figure out the other two. In this chapter (will be divided to several free sections), I’ll explain:
1: Digital IP/IC design flow;
2: Quick review of digital fundamental
3: Install Verilator and GTKwave
4: Common used Verilog syntax for design and verification
5: Design combination logic(basic gates, MUX, decoder, one-hot decoder)
6: Design sequential logic(sync-DFF, async-DFF)
7: Design small but useful block(counter, edge detect, shift registers, sequence check, sync_fifo)
8: Design FSM(finite state machine)
9: Design basic testbench
10: Common mistakes for synthesis(incomplete sensitive list, latch, multi-driven, combination logic loop)
11: Practice time: design and verify z-scan and complex sequence check(FSM)


This is chapter 2, section 3 of whole Digital IC and FPGA design course.
In the whole course, I will introduce fundamentals of digital IC and FPGA design, with 12+ coding exercises and 3 course projects.
Theory part: MOS transistor -> logic cells -> arithmetic data path -> Verilog language -> common used HW function blocks and architecture -> STA -> on-chip-bus(APB/AHB-Lite/AXI4) -> low power design -> DFT -> SOC(MCU level).
Function blocks and architecture: FSM, pipeline, arbiter, CDC, sync_fifo, async_fifo, ping-pong, pipeline with control, slide window, pipeline hazard and forward path, systolic.
Project: SHA-256 algorithm with simple interface, SHA-256 with APB/AXI interface, 2D DMA controller with APB/AXI interface.
After explaining of each HW architecture, I will give you a coding exercise, with reference code. Coding difficulty will begin from several lines to fifty lines, more than 100 lines, then around 200 lines. While the final big project will be 1000+ lines.
I suppose these should be essential knowledge and skills you need master to enter this area.
I will try my best to explain what-> how-> why and encourage you to do it better in this course.


Please browse to my homepage on Udemy to obtain information about each chapter of this course.
target_audience: Anyone who wants to study Verilog and digital IC/FPGA design

courses.title: hands-on development of cpu- soc on FPGA using vhdl(verilog)
courses.bio: cpu soc development using counter out-of-order processing and set-associative cache
objectives: Design and implementation of a counter-based alternative for dynamic instruction scheduling and dependency resolution.
Exploration of traditional out-of-order execution techniques, including Tomasulo’s algorithm.
Integration of processing units, memory, and I/O modules into a cohesive SoC design.
Practical implementation of a set-associative cache system on FPGA to enhance memory access efficiency.

Introduction: How to design the program memory
how to link program memory to instruction buffer and program counter buffer
Extracting instruction set from RISC-V datasheet
how to setup the read and write register alias table
feedback: how to return registers after instruction exec using output buffers
How to design a simple ALU
how to handle multiple function units. introducing memory buffers
how to connect different units using the control
how to control memory operation, register operation, alu operation etc.
how control handles cache misses and cache hit
how to setup the cache control for hit, miss, cache address and memory address

requirements: vhdl basics
courses.description:
This course provided a comprehensive, practical approach to designing and implementing a CPU and System-on-Chip (SoC) architecture on FPGA using hardware description languages (VHDL or Verilog). The program focused on key concepts and techniques, including counter-based out-of-order processing and the design of an efficient set-associative cache.  The student will learn new concepts like register alias table, reservation station, output buffers etc. the design is built incrementally starting from program memory and instruction buffers up to more sophisticated control.
Key Learning Outcomes:
Counter-Based Out-of-Order Execution:
Exploration of traditional out-of-order execution techniques, e.g Tomasulo’s algorithm.
Design and implementation of a counter-based alternative for dynamic instruction scheduling and dependency resolution.
Set-Associative Cache Design:
Understanding cache memory hierarchies and performance trade-offs.
Practical implementation of a set-associative cache system on FPGA to enhance memory access efficiency.
Course Outcomes:
Participants gained the ability to design, implement, and validate a high-performance CPU-SoC on FPGA with a focus on advanced architectural features. The course provided deep insights into out-of-order execution mechanisms and memory hierarchy optimization, bridging the gap between theoretical concepts and practical hardware design.
Target Audience:
This course was ideal for students, engineers, and professionals interested in computer architecture, hardware design, or FPGA-based development who sought hands-on experience with cutting-edge processor and SoC design techniques.
target_audience: fpga developers

requirements: No capítulo 2 uma lista de materiais com tudo que será necessário como placas, cabos, baterias e kits de robótica
Usaremos PC: Sistema Operacional Windows 7 or maior com as últimas atualizações instaladas (nota: Internet Explorer 8 não é suportado).
ou Mac: OS X 10.6 ou maior com as ultimas atualizações instaladas
Conexão de internet Wireless (Sem Fio)
courses.description:
A placa Raspberry Pi é uma das placas mais poderosas, difundidas e acessíveis utilizadas nos projetos de robótica, para aprendizado de programação, automação residencial, drones, impressoras 3D e muitas outras milhares de possibilidades.
Ela se destaca pelo seu alto poder de conectividade e capacidade de processamento, baixo custo e facilidade de programação.
Esse curso foi elaborado para todos aqueles que querem aprender a programar essa placa fantástica, sejam profissionais de engenharia, alunos de cursos técnicos e todas que têm como hobby criar projetos legais envolvendo programação.
Vamos aprender a programar a placa Raspberry Pi usando Python, uma das linguagens mais poderosas e populares da atualidade.
Vamos aprender também a usar o barramento de pinos da placa, o GPIO, para controlar e ler sinais externos. Com o GPIO você poderá controlar projetos de robótica, iot (internet das coisas), automação residencial, automação industrial, controle de hardware de impressoras 3D, ou seja, tudo que envolve o controle de sinais digitais.

O curso é dividido em 12 (doze) capítulos:
Introdução a placa Raspberry Pi.
Lista de recursos e materiais necessários para as aulas.
Preparação para a instalação do sistema operacional Raspbian.
Instalação do Sistema Operacional Raspbian.
Acesso Remoto ao Raspberry Pi.
Sistema Operacional Raspbian (Linux).
Introdução a linguagem de programação Python.
Montando o hardware do Robô 2WD kpacitor.
Preparação e montagem das partes mecânicas do Kit Robô.
Montagem das placas Raspberry Pi e Ponte H Dupla L298N.
Montagem dos cabos de interligação entre as placas.
Montagem das Baterias.
Introdução ao software do Robô 2WD kpacitor
Implementação do servidor Apache no Raspberry Pi
Implementação  do software de controle usando o microframework Flask
Implementação da interface de controle do Robô
Os primeiros capítulos são Introdutórios e permitem que os alunos consigam iniciar a operação da placa, partindo do zero, até seu funcionamento total. Aprenderemos a fazer o acesso remoto entre outras coisas muito importantes para programadores de Raspberry Pi. Vamos aprender passo a passo duas formas de acesso remoto, via SSH e também usando interface gráfica via  VNCViewer.
No capítulo 6 vamos estudar e aprender os conceitos essenciais para que os alunos possam usar o Linux, mesmo sem nunca ter tido nenhum contato com esse sistema operacional. Já no capítulo 7 vamos aprender os conceitos necessários para aprender a programar com a linguagem Python.
O hardware do Robô é composto pelo Kit robótico, placas Raspberry e Ponte H L298N, cabos e baterias. Tudo será montado no capítulo 8, passo a passo, detalhadamente explicado para que mesmo aqueles que nunca tenham feito nada parecido, consigam resultados exatamente iguais aos propostos.
A implementação do Software do Robô será minuciosamente explicado, todos os códigos escritos serão disponibilizados nos materiais extras de cada aula, fazendo com que o aluno não encontre dificuldades em obter os resultados esperados.
As placas Raspberry Pi se mostram extremamente confiáveis, com alta performance e baixo custo, a melhor opção entre muitas disponíveis no mercado. Ela conta com uma comunidade que colabora mundialmente, produzindo conteúdo de código aberto, e muito bem documentados, disponíveis para qualquer um que queira usá-los.
A Raspberry Pi se mostra uma das melhores opções para o desenvolvimento de um dos maiores e mais promissores movimentos de tecnologia, " The Internet of Things " (A Internet das Coisas), que tem como principal objetivo integrar objetos físicos("coisas"), compostos por eletrônica embarcada, sensores e atuadores, que se comunicam em uma rede, coletando e trocando dados entre si, visando tornar mais fácil e ágil a vida de todos nós.

Segundo dados de estudos da CISCO (Novembro 2011) , estima-se que em 2020, 50 BILHÕES de dispositivos vão estar conectados. Nada mal aprender a usar o Raspberry Pi, uma das mais poderosas do mundo para construir dispositivos para esse tipo de aplicação.
target_audience: Este curso destina-se a todos que querem aprender a criar projetos fantásticos usando a placa Raspberry Pi
Destina-se também a todos interessados em "iot" (Internet of things) Internet das Coisas, já que Raspberry Pi 2 é a melhor placa para construir projetos de inovação nessa área que tudo se conectará.

Não é necessário conhecimento em Linux ou Python, pois duas seções dedicadas a esses dois assuntos são parte da grade de tópicos ensinados, visando ajudar justamente aqueles que nunca tiveram contato com ambos assuntos
Lógica de programação é desejável, facilitando os trabalhos de implementação e análise de código
Usuários que programam outras plataformas como Arduino que querem evoluir seus projetos com uma plataforma mais completa como a Raspberry Pi.

courses.title: Computer Architecture: From Number Systems to Parallelism
courses.bio: Computer Organization and Architecture

Introduction: Number System and Logic Gates: - Binary, Decimal, Octal, Hexadecimal
Binary Arithmetic- Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication, Division
Logic Gates-AND, OR, NOT, NAND, NOR, EX-OR, EX-NOR.
Architectures: Basic structure of computers: Functional Units of a computer
Design of ALU: De Morgan’s Theorem, Adders, Multiplier – Unsigned, Signed
Fast, Carry Save Addition of summands
IEEE 754 Floating point numbers and operations
Control Unit: Generation of control signals, Micro-programmed control
Pipelining: Basic concepts of pipelining , Performance
Hazards-Data, Instruction and Control, Influence on instruction sets.
Parallelism: ARM Processor: Thumb instruction set, Processor and CPU cores
Instruction Encoding format, Memory load and Store instruction
Case study: ARM 5 and ARM 7 Architecture

requirements: No prerequiste
courses.description:
The Computer Organization and Architecture course  is a comprehensive exploration into the intricate workings of computers. It provides a deep dive into the fundamentals of computer hardware, memory operations, and addressing modes, offering students a solid foundation in understanding the internal structure of computers.
The course begins with an introduction to number systems, including binary, decimal, octal, and hexadecimal, and covers various codes such as Grey, BCD, Excess-3, ASCII, and Parity. It also delves into binary arithmetic, including addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division using Sign Magnitude, 1’s compliment, 2’s compliment, and BCD Arithmetic. The course also introduces students to logic gates, including AND, OR, NOT, NAND, NOR, EX-OR, and EX-NOR.
The course then moves on to the study of computer architectures, focusing on the functional units of a computer, operational concepts, bus structures, memory addresses and operations, assembly language, instructions, instruction sequencing, and addressing modes. It includes a case study on the 8086 architecture to provide practical insights.
The design and operation of the Arithmetic and Logic Unit (ALU) form a significant part of the course. Students learn about De Morgan’s Theorem, adders, multipliers, division, and IEEE 754 Floating point numbers and operations. The course also covers the basic processing unit, ALU operations, instruction execution, branch instruction, multiple bus organization, hardwired control, generation of control signals, micro-programmed control, and the basic concepts of pipelining.
The course explores the need for parallelism, the architecture of parallel systems, and Flynn’s classification. It also introduces students to the ARM Processor, its instruction set, processor and CPU cores, instruction encoding format, memory load and store instruction, and the basics of I/O operations. Case studies on ARM 5 and ARM 7 Architecture are included to provide practical insights.
By the end of the course, students will have a thorough understanding of computer organization and architecture, enabling them to identify computer hardware, apply Boolean algebra in designing computer logic, examine the operation of basic processing units, analyze concepts of parallelism and multi-core processors, and classify memory technologies and input-output systems. This course equips students with the knowledge and skills necessary to excel in the field of computer science and engineering.
target_audience: Students and Enthusiasts

courses.title: Arduino Robotics: Building and Programming Robots
courses.bio: Mastering Arduino Robotics: From Basics to Advanced
objectives: Understanding the Arduino platform, its components, and its programming environment
Learning the basics of electronics, including components like resistors, capacitors, motors, and sensors
Understanding the Arduino programming language (based on C/C++)
Designing the physical structure of robots, including chassis, wheels, and joints
requirements: Arduino kit, which typically includes an Arduino board (e.g., Arduino Uno), various electronic components (sensors, motors, wires), and a breadboard
Computer: You'll need a computer to write, compile, and upload code to the Arduino board. Ensure the computer is compatible with the Arduino Integrated Development Environment (IDE).
Arduino IDE: Install the Arduino IDE on your computer. It's freely available from the Arduino website.
courses.description:
An Arduino Robotics course is an introductory course that teaches students the basics of building and programming robots using the Arduino microcontroller platform. The course typically covers both the hardware and software aspects of robotics, allowing students to gain a comprehensive understanding of the field.


During the course, students will learn about the components of a robot, such as motors, sensors, and microcontrollers, and how to use them to build a functional robot. They will also learn how to program the robot using the Arduino programming language, which is based on C++.


The course will cover topics such as basic electronics, mechanics, and mathematics, providing students with a foundation for understanding how robots work. Additionally, the course may include projects and hands-on activities that allow students to apply what they have learned in a practical setting


By the end of the course, students will have the skills and knowledge necessary to design and build their own simple robots using Arduino microcontrollers. This may include programming the robot to perform specific tasks, such as following a line or avoiding obstacles.


Overall, an Arduino Robotics course is a great way for students to gain an introduction to the exciting field of robotics and to gain practical experience in building and programming robots.

courses.title: Thermal Modeling of Solar Energy Systems
courses.bio: Learn to model thermal systems with solar heating and realistic worldwide weather data
requirements: Basics physics or engineering background.
courses.description:
This course in an introduction to building thermal models of equipment that is exposed to solar heating and uses weather files from 1000's of locations around the world. Examples would include an airplane sitting on a runway in the sun, electronic equipment exposed to solar heating, passive solar heating of buildings and houses, solar power plants or heating of automobile dashboards.
This class is based on MSC Software's Patran, Sinda and Thermica. If you have access to these packages you will be able to complete the step by step tutorial problem. If you don't have access to the software, you will still learn the process of creating a thermal model with solar heating.
target_audience: Engineers who have some experience in creating thermal models.

courses.bio: Programación en Lenguaje Ladder, programación estructurada e integración con HMI.

Aprender a programar PLC's en lenguaje Ladder o Escalera.

courses.description: El presente curso de Programación de Controladores Lógicos Programables en TIA PORTAL está diseñado en base a sistemas metodológicos prácticos y dinámicos. Iniciando desde los fundamentos de la automatización, definiciones de los PLC, introducción al lenguaje Ladder y presentando cada una de las instrucciones de tipo lógica y avanzadas de una manera práctica y simple. Así, aprenderemos a utilizar las funciones básicos de programación así como el uso de bloques de temporización, conteo, comparación, comunicación entre autómatas, normalización y escalamiento de señales anañógicas. Así mismo se llevará a cabo la implementación de pantallas HMI y simulación de procesos industriales en FACTORY IO para maximizar el aprendizaje aplicativo.

courses.title: OpenPLC - From general overview to advanced analysis
courses.bio: Master OpenPLC and make it yours
objectives: Basics of OpenPLC and how it works
How to handle libraries for your projects
Ho to install Editor and Runtime in different scenarios
Improve performance thanks to PREEMPT
Interface the running PLC with Drivers and Python scripts
requirements: Ability to read python code, Structured Text code and a certain proficiency with informatic in general
courses.description:
This course was created after an in-depth study of the OpenPLC ecosystem.
PLC programming is a widely discussed subject around the world, as the importance of PLCs has never been greater than it is today.
Until recently, PLC programming was a topic reserved for a few specialists in technical schools, mainly due to the need for physical hardware and expensive, specialized software for skill development. Software companies have monopolized the educational space with proprietary tools. This has significantly slowed the development of real-time control engineering compared to the rapid growth of pure software development over the past 20 years.
OpenPLC is an open-source platform that spans from PLC language programming to powerful integrations with Python runtime and SoftPLC deployment, enabling a new control paradigm.
While studying the subject, I discovered how powerful the platform could be: integration with external software tools for advanced functionality (such as machine learning and APIs), the ability to convert all PLC languages to Structured Text (ST)—which allows code to be analyzed and fine-tuned by AI—fleet deployment, redundancy and execution control via Docker, and an integrated SCADA system for HMI.
This course is the result of all that learning and experimentation. It’s for you—to expand your capabilities and realize your potential. It’s for the community—to broaden the user base and help move this gem forward. And it’s for everyone out there—to spark creativity and support new ideas.
I hope you enjoy the journey as much as I did.
target_audience: IIOT developers
PLC developers
Field Engineers
IT
IOT
Enthusiasts
Makers

requirements: PLC Programlama Bilgisi

courses.description:
TIA PORTAL İLE HMI OPERATÖR PROGRAMLAMA EĞİTİMİNE HOŞGELDİNİZ
Ben Ayberk, kursumuz hakkında genel bir bilgi vermek gerekirse şunları söyleyebilirim:
Bu eğitimde, uzun yıllar endüstriyel otomasyon alanında çalışan bir mühendis olarak yılların verdiği saha tecrübesi ve birikim ile HMI programlamayı anlatıyorum. Bu konu hakkında daha önceden bir bilginizin olmaması hiç problem değil. Çünkü sıfırdan başlayarak ileri düzeye doğru adım adım gidiyoruz. Yalnız HMI programlama PLC tabanlı sistemler üzerinde yapıldığı için bu kursa başlamadan önce en azından orta seviyede PLC programlama bilmek sizler için faydalı olacaktır. Eğer bu konuda bir eksiğiniz var ise bu açığı PLC programlama kurslarımız ile kapatabilirsiniz.
Kursumuzda dersler belirli bir mantık sırasına göre ilerlemektedir. Bundan dolayı ders videolarını sırayla izlemeniz konuları daha rahat kavramanızı sağlayacaktır. Derslerimizi sırasıyla izleyip ve derslerde anlatılanları uyguladığınızda, HMI programlama konusunda çok iyi bir noktaya geleceğinizi size garanti ediyorum.
Kursumuzda öğrenciler sordukları bütün sorulara ayrıntılı geri dönüşler almaktadır ve bundan dolayı özel bir ders alıyormuş gibi hissetmektedirler. Kursun bu dinamik yapısı, öğrencilere kısa sürede konuları anlama ve hedeflerine ulaşma konusunda yardımcı olmaktadır.
Eğitim boyunca elinizde herhangi bir HMI panel olmadan insan makine arayüzü oluşturabilecek ve programlarınızı Tia Portal HMI Simülatörü ve Factory IO üzerinde simüle ederek her şeyi kontrol edebileceksiniz. Ayrıca sistemin sahada gerçek ekipmanlar üzerinde de nasıl çalıştığını görebildiğiniz bir eğitim tecrübesi yaşayacaksınız.
Kursumuzda birtakım konuları öğrencilerin en iyi şekilde anlayabilmesi için bu derslerin uygulamaları özel deney setleri üzerinde yapılmıştır. Ayrıca eğitimin her bir kısmı bittikten sonra öğrendiğiniz her şeyi pekiştirmeniz için sizlerle örnek HMI uygulamaları yapacağız. Böylece bu eğitimin sonunda; hemen hemen her sistem için HMI arayüzü oluşturabilecek ve bu arayüzü PLC bazlı sistemlere entegre ederek panel üzerinden sistemi yönetebilecek seviyeye geleceksiniz.
Yukarıda söylediğim bütün her şeyi yapabilme amacıyla oluşturduğum HMI programlama eğitimi 2 kısımdan oluşmaktadır. Birinci kısımda temel ve orta seviye konulara, ikinci kısımda ise ileri seviye konulara yer verilmiştir.
target_audience: HMI programlamayı sıfırdan öğrenmek isteyenler
